reviewText: The anti glare on the Ultra Optics Dual is great and it helps prevent fingerprints. It comes with a back screen protector which was in 3 pieces and it just wasn't for me. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was because when you run your finger across the screen it makes noise. It gets annoying when you're in a quiet place and when you're just trying to wipe down your screen. I personally don't hear it unless it's silent but other than that it might annoy you and other people around you.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I actually emailed the company first to try and not write a bad review for a company that normally has great screen protectors.On that note, the front screen protector fitted perfect and was crystal clear with no bubbles, with minimum fuss.The back three pieces however are all slightly too small, especially the top and bottom clear protectors.  If I would have known this, I would have lined up the edges so my bumper would cover where the protector didn't reach.The matte finish was nice, but it seemed to have more trouble with bubbles than the front.  The apple logo and writing is of course raised so you can easily see that there is a protector on.  It doesn't go flush like the picture on Amazon.The biggest issue for me was getting a lone piece of dirt or hair under the protectors once they were down.  For example, there was a little dirt that made it on at the last moment on the back, so I pulled it up from the edge, and used the lent sticker to get the dirt off, then put the screen back down.  The bubble was gone but the edge I pulled back wouldn't go down.  This happened to me on three different edges, two on the back, and one on the front.  This was on a brand new iphone 5, I pulled of the manufacturer plastic and put on the protectors.  I have also used SGP screens in the past with no problems.Update: SGP did send a replacement.  It had the exact same issue, one corner doesn't stay down.  I didn't even bother with the back, just left on the old ones because I had a feeling the new ones would be identical.  I do have to say that the front is very very clear and is the best screen protector I've seen.  Just be very careful when you lay any of them down, because you can't get anything out without jacking up the edges.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: Key is to create dust-free environment.  A method I use is to blast hot water in the shower, wait a minute or two as the dust settles  and then apply. Follow the instructions. reviewText: I've tried all of the different types of screen protector from SGP on both iPhone 5 and iPad mini, and I've always came back to the Ultra Optics because of its balanced anti-glare and fingerprint reducing properties. The protector doesn't affect the Retina screen like other anti-glare protectors.It's true that there's a slight squeaky sound when you swipe your finger across the screen, but not very noticeable unless if you swipe your finger with a lot of force.As for applying the protector on the screen, not much different or difficult than any other SGP protectors, so if you are used to applying screen protectors before, then you shouldn't find any difficulty with this one.Overall this is a good combination of price and quality.

reviewText: Pros• High optical clarity. Does not degrade Retina screen visual quality.• Does not noticeably interfere with touchscreen performance/sensitivity• Does not significantly alter tactile feel of touchscreen although you can tell there is a screen film in place vs. a uncovered iPhone.• Easy to wipe down.• Undercut film size for easier applicationCons• Film is undercut just a couple mm too much so there is small gap in coverage even if the film is perfectly centered around the home button/receiver/camera.• Smudges just as with an uncovered screen• As with all films, correct application is highly user dependent. title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: The screen protectors came in extremely bent and i tried putting them on but they would not stick, because of how severely bent they were.i tried contacting their customer support from their website (spigen.com) didnt hear back from them, and i contacted them again through their website and still did not hear back for them for over a week.i posted on their facebook page and was finally able to get a response. they said that they will tell their amazon team to search for my email...that is unacceptable for me. CS should respond to emails without being told to look for them. i did not hear from them for another 3 days (fri-sun) i understand that they are closed on weekends but still if there is a real problem they should try to fix it asap. i heard from warranty dept on tuesday. by that time i was extremely frustrated because the iphone was getting small scuff marks due to lack of screen protector, so i just went out to best buy and bought a zagg smudge proff invisisheild and told them to pricematch zagg ($18 on zagg and $26 at best buy) which they gladly matched. and i ended up returning this product via amazon to spigen.i cant say much about their screen protector cauz i was not able to test it out because it was damaged. For all i know their screen protector could be the best one out there, but based on the CS i received from their company i can not recommend them to anyone.If you do decide to go down this path and buy a spigen product, i hope you have better luck than i do.P.S their screen protectors are mislabeled. when you apply them take off part 2 first and stick it on your screen... not part 1. youd think they would fix such a blunder, or atleast include that info in their packaging if they dont want to increase their overhead by redoing their whole inventory.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I've exclusively used Spigen/SGP screen protectors for my last couple of phones, and they have been perfect. After getting a new phone, I decided to get the Ultra Optics version, and I'm beyond disappointed. I've used the Ultra Fine in the past and it did a great job of making the screen more matte and viewable, and this version is supposed to be slightly less matte but also have some anti-fingerprint treatment.Installation hasn't changed, but now that it's on my phone, there is such a noticeable drag when I touch the screen. I don't want to know my screen protector is there when I use my phone, but this is unmistakable. title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: You get quality for what you pay.Spigen products are just top notch from the film material, down to even packaging and even the squeegee, which is not cheap cardboard like others, but almost a credit card type of plastic with their branding.Nice fine details everywhere, definitely no cheap stuff.Application was easy, it came with 2 and I got it right on both mine and my wife's Iphone 5 without trouble.I used the "taco" method of application (Google it, search video on YouTube).which is the most effective.Don't follow the application method shown in the package, use the taco method to avoid any bubbles.The application on my wife's phone was perfect, not a single bubble or dust, just flawless on the first try.On mine, there was just one particle of dust trapped on the corner, so I used a tape to lift the corner of film and used their included dust remover sticker to remove the dust particle, so bubbles.The film is great quality, made in japan, it is not flimsy, no rainbow effects, feels like you are touching the naked glass, you just can't tell.I followed another poster's advice and worked under the hood of my stove on, so there was minimal dust hanging in the air.I think most of the negative reviews are coming from people that are just applying it incorrectly.Yes, you will get bubbles if you get dust trapped under the film, that's standard for ANY similar product.The secret is to work in a clean area with minimal dust, apply it fast, right after you remove the layer covering the adhesive side (otherwise dust will stick to it, and USE THE TACO METHOD!Then there's no way to go wrong.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: Does the job. reviewText: I am usually not the best at applying screen protectors so I was very cautious with this one. I made sure my screen was clean and started peeling the back off while placing it on my screen and then just stuck it all the way down (hope that makes sense lol). There were only 2 bubbles that were easy to get rid of. Then I noticed there were marks that looked like scratches so I freaked out and peeled it back.. Then I tried placing it back down and I thought it was ruined. I couldn't get it to look clean underneath again so I decided to give up and peel it off. That is when I realized I peeled off the front of the protector, which is what I was suppose to do. Yay! So just make sure you know there is a front and back that you have to peel off the protector. It looks PERFECT now, no bubbles or dirt underneath. I can barely tell it is even there! Definitely the best screen protector I have ever used.*UPDATE* - Earlier today I noticed a line on my phone that looked like a scratch and it was a rainbow color. When I ran my fingernail over it I noticed it was definitely a scratch. I wasn't sure if it was on my screen protector or if my phone was scratched. It was in an obvious spot so I decided to take the screen protector off and guess what.. No scratch on my screen. So even though the screen protector is suppose to be anti-scratch it really isn't! I will apply the second one and see if it does the same thing.

reviewText: This screen protector is a piece of junk.  It's no different than the ones you get free when buying an accessory or pay 99 cents for on eBay. title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: The iPhone 5 is my 4th iPhone, and I've never used a screen protector because I had seen some devices with screen protectors in place, and they looked annoyingly bad.  But I decided to give this one a try, and was pleasantly surprised... it truly does look almost imperceptible.  I cannot see any negative affect on the image quality of the screen, and the only visible evidence that the screen protector is in place is around the speaker/camera and, to a lesser extent, the home button (in particular, you can see the edge of the cutouts... it's certainly not offensive looking, but if you know it's there, you see it).However, it did take some work to install to this level of satisfaction.  I spent probably 20 - 30 minutes getting it perfect.  I used the "hinge method" that I found mentioned in a forum.  Rather than just trying to place the protector freehand, or lining it up at the top and hoping the home button cutout ended up in the right place, I instead kept the overlay films in place, and after positioning the protector perfectly, secured it along the side with blue painter's tape, creating a "hinge" that enabled me to flip it out of the way but still retain the carefully attained position.  After verifying and correcting the position several times, and cleaning the screen thoroughly and meticulously until all traces of dust/lint were gone, I then peeled off the back overlay film, and applied the protector.Despite my efforts, there were still a few dust specks, but I was able to use the supplied tape strips (presumably the blue painter's tape would work too) to partially lift the protector and dab off the dust/lint with another piece of tape.  Took a while to get it completely dust-free, but the end result was worth it.  And the great thing is that since I didn't screw it up, I now have an extra that I can use in a year or so.My only somewhat negative observation was that at first, it felt a bit "sticky"... when I slid the unlock button over, I could feel some resistance and a distinct "squeaky" kind of feeling.  However, interestingly, this effect seems to have greatly diminished since it was first installed yesterday, to the point where I simply don't feel it anymore.  I suspect that the stickiness was just the nature of the newly manufactured material, and just needed to be "broken in" a bit with use.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I got one of these with my Spigen air case.  I peeled off the side labeled 1, I think it said "front", thinking that this was the side that sticks onto the screen.  Well, I was wrong.  Everything is reversed.  Anyways, I ended up trashing the screen protector thinking that there was no way that I'd be able to get all of the lint off of the sticky side.  The next morning, I woke up and dug the screen protector out of the trash can.  I used some liquid dishwashing soap and washed the screen protector down and fanned it dry.  It totally worked.I installed it correctly this time.  Bottom of the protector first, then I used a credit card to "squeegee"  the screen protector to the top.  I have one small little bubble on the bottom of the screen, but everything else looks great considering that it was in the trashcan with bacon grease all over it the day before.Anyways, I've tried both Power Support and Generiks on my iphone 4, and I must say that this crystal clear screen protector is pretty good.  It does show fingerprints and smudges, but it does not affect the clarity of the iphone 5 screen in any way.  Whereas the Generiks screen protector completely distorts the screen on the iphone 4.  Power Support is pretty good too.  Definitely better for fingerprints, but it's not available for the iphone 5 yet.

reviewText: Okay, if you are looking for a matte finish screen protector for iPhone 5 (or I suppose 4 or 4s), let me help you out.Let me start by saying I have applied a LOT of screen protectors over the years, way back from Handspring Visor to Sony Clie to Palm TX to iPod nanos and Touches, as well as digital camera screens. The protectors get better with time. The clear gloss ones are a pain in the butt to get the bubbles out.I like the matte finish as it really decreases fingerprints and helps screen visibility. You may lose some resolution, but only slightly. So here goes.This Spigen Ultra-Fine "anti-fingerprint" screen protector for iPhone 5 is AWESOME. I had just purchased a Belkin matte screen protector to try it out for the past week. Compared to this new Spigen, the Belkin one makes the screen less clear and more slightly yellow, and actually is not that smooth of surface. Of note, I am using a Speck Candyshell case and both screen protectors fit fine inside the top surface, without bubbling. (if it does bubble any, you can push them out with a soft shirt/squeegee card/etc., toward the outer edge)This Spigen protector is super-smooth to run your finger across. When you feel it you'll know. The cutouts line up perfectly with the screen camera, ear speaker, and home button. The clarity is very good, and it cleans off easily. Prior to this, on 2 previous iPod Touch models I used the Power Support Anti-Glare HD screen protector from the Apple store, and it is awesome as well. I used each one for 2 years and they hardly look used at all.Comparing the PowerSupport next to me with this new Spigen, the PowerSupport film is slightly smoother/glassier feel, but it has been in use x 2 years. Both are smooth, decrease glare, and have great light transmittance and resolution.INSTALL HELP:Okay, I was nervous taking the Belkin screen film off since I had it perfectly aligned, no bubbles, no dust under it. But I bit the bullet, and am GLAD I changed to the Spigen.The first install attempt with the Spigen I started from the top edge. I only peeled back about 1/3 of the back film, lined up the top edge, and then squeegee out the bubbles as I unpeel it, applying it down the front. Well, at the bottom the home button cutout ended up crooked. Darn it!So, what I did is get a small piece of Scotch tape, stick it on the corner of the screen protector, and carefully peeled it up (that is the easiest way to get a grip on it). Then at the top I slightly adjusted it, then did the apply/squeege combo motion again. This lined up just right, but I had 2 pc. of dust under it!So then, I got a new piece of Scotch tape, and lightly touched it (sticky side) against the spots on the back of the screen protector to grab those dust specks. It worked great, and now it's on, and it looks and FEELS awesome. I'm so glad I put it on.SO THEN, in SUMMARY:This Spigen, and the Power Support HD anti-glare, are excellent screen protectors. They transmit light well, block glare, clean easily, and are very smooth and responsive to the touch. I realize they are a little more expensive, but you get 2 of them - and you never have to replace it. Get it set up, and you are done.Of note, they do a great job protecting the screen, but a hot object hit my ipod screen (an ejected shell casing) and left a nick because it melted the screen protector - but no damage to the glass.Sorry for long review, but I wanted to make it "crystal clear" (actually matte clear) as to why this is a great screen protector as well as how to help you apply it perfectly. This is 100% recommended. I have no affiliation with the company either, just a satisfied customer.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I've had Steinheil screen protectors for other phones, but have always had the Crystal Clear ones.  When I first got my iPhone5 the only SPs available were the Verizon branded ones.  While they do protect the screen, they're junk when it comes to fingerprints and smudging. And while I've liked my Crystal Clear SGPs in the past, I thought I'd try the SGP Oleophobic this time - a clear SP, but with a bit of fingerprint control (without the rainbow or blurriness of the anti-fingerprint style).I have to say I think the Oleophobic hits the perfect balance of visibility and fingerprint control.  Yes, you can (and will) still get fingerprints, but WAY less than the standard SPs (like the Verizon ones). I get very few, and it's easy to wipe completely clean without smearing. And the feel of the plastic is great, very glassy and not tacky feeling at all.The fit is also perfect and works great with my bumper case. Much better (and tighter) adhering than the other screen protector - never a hint of it bubbling at the edges, and I take the case on and off a lot too.My only "problem" was that SGP sent me 2 packages - I assume because they slightly adjusted the sizing after the iPhone5 came out. One package was white with "iPhone5" on a sticker and one was pink with "iPhone5" printed on it. While I couldn't see any difference to the naked eye between the two, I used the one in the Pink package since it looked like the newer branding.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: Just upgraded to an iPhone 5 and needed a new screen protector so I purchased an iSmooth for $10 first.  Not liking the fit or feel, I purchased this Spigen for $17. While I like the way the Spigen feels to the touch, it wasn't so easy to put on (similar to the iSmooth) and left some fingerprints though less than the iSmooth.  Now I've spent $27 in screen protectors that I don't love and will likely shell out another $25 for the Moshi iVisor I should've purchased in the first place.  All said, my final will have cost me $52.  I would not recommend the Spigen to anyone who's had the Moshi iVisor which is the superior product.

reviewText: So this is a fine screen protector and the quality is good although it seems to attract more fingerprints than the iPhone's surface. I noticed minimal degradation in quality and although the install was tedious I got great results.Over the years I have installed at least a dozen different protective films in iPhones and iPads. If there's anything at all that I've learned is that they are all a total and completely pain to install. And that's perfectly normal when you consider that you are installing a small piece of adhesive (or not) film that has 2 or more precisely cut openings that need to match perfectly. On top of that specks of dust will leave bubbles that don't go away by themselves and require lifting the film, removing the dust with an adhesive strip and then re-positioning the film.So when I read customer complaints I can empathize and I also think that it's usually because the user has some unrealistic expectations about how long it'll take to install the film.The SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear is one of the better films I've tried (I also like PowerSupport). You get two in the package so if you really mess up you can try again. A microfiber cloth and squeegee are including as well as a strip of adhesive stickers that can be used to remove dust from the film.I agree with many of the reviewers: the instructions are pretty poor and they could have done a better job of explaining the process and the difference between dust bubbles and air bubbles. Dust bubbles look like a pimple and there's a little head(dust) right in the middle.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I've used many screen protector brands in the past and I have to give it to Spigen for providing the best product. reviewText: At a minimum, a screen protector needs to provide protection, while minimizing the impact of the tactile feel on the screen as well as the clarity of the image. SGP continues to nail it with this Ultra Oleophobic Screen Protector by not only having an excellent, smooth tactile feel and crystal clear picture, but the oleophobic coating is nothing short of magic. Fingerprints simply won't adhere to the surface. And if you happen to have just consumed a bucket of chicken and get grease on the screen, it wipes off far more easily than the original iPhone glass.On top of that, the material really is hard stuff. I got a tiny bubble during installation (easy to avoid using the included dust stickers to pick up stray bits of dust!) and used my fingernail to push the bubble out. Lesser screen protectors would have scratched under the hard pressure of a fingernail. Not Steinheil! Not so much as a scuff.Like I said, this is the perfect screen protector. title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I have had my doubts about screen protectors in the past and have personally found them to be a nuisance. I am quite the perfectionist and even the smallest bubble forces me to rip off a protector. However, this product has changed the way that I feel about protectors! The product is matte-not glossy, so fingerprints do NOT show up on the screen at all! You can literally see the oil from your fingers evaporating off of the screen! I have a suggestion for putting on the screen protector to ensure that there are no bubbles.1) Without removing the backing, place the protector over the screen in such a way that the peel sticker is on the screen side towards the right.2) Make sure that the protector is perfectly aligned over the screen, and tape the protector to the screen from one of the longer rectangular sides. This tape will act as a hinge.3) Move the protector to the side, off of the screen.4) Wipe the screen. Be sure to remove any dust, fingerprints, or oil.5) Carefully remove the peel sticker on the protector.6) Move the protector back on to the screen. Because of the tape, the protector will go perfectly into place.7) Use the provided squigee (or a card) to remove any bubbles.8) If there is any dust, peel off the protector using a piece of scotch tape on the corner and use the provided dust stickers.Overall, I am satisfied with the protector. I have no bubbles and the screen is beautiful and displays no fingerprints! The screen feels slightly different (more like the screen of a PC monitor) but I feel that this is a plus. The protector does not interfere with brightness and is quite clear.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I see a lot of reviews complains about hard to apply the screen protector without bubble. I agree with that, but I believe it's the same with all screen protector, especially installing on white iPhone is much harder than black, it's very hard to align to the button and the earphone cut on the white phone. it took me quite a while to install with a big  damped rag under neat to help keep dust away, but I still get a few bubble but were able to take it out with the provide sticky to take out the dust. First I though I would ruin my first screen protector. But carefully, slowly and take time to do it right I was able to do a clean perfect install on a White phone. If it was a black phone it's easier to align... I been through many screen protector which affecting the screen display quality. This is a good one, can't tell if screen protector is on!!!
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: This is the 3rd device I've bought the Spigen screen protector for and I can't recommend it highly enough. I've tried Zagg, BodyGuardz and others, but this is by far the best there is. It goes on without bubbles and facial oil wipes off easily like the iPhone's own screen. Don't waste time with other brands, get this one.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: I love these protectors so much--I've bought them many times for my Android and now for my new iPhone 5. I like that they make the screen matte and finger-print resistant. The iPhone version fits like a glove and extends right up to the edge of the screen. Luckily I haven't dropped the iPhone yet, but I dropped my much heavier Evo and several times it landed flat on its face on concrete. Thanks to these screen protectors, my phone screen never suffered even a scratch.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: Ultra Optics Dual's Review:Love this screen protector!  I originally had a Skinomi installed and that was also a great product but its thickness caused it to lift with the majority of my cases(except for my Commuter and Spigen Neo Hybrid).  Maybe because it was a wet application screen protector.Pros:  98% clarity.  You can barely....and I mean barely noticed the texture of the screen protector.  It has like a microscopic bead texture to it.  It feels real nice in hand and is very responsive even to the slightest touch/swipe.  Also, it makes whatever your viewing a lot smoother.  Looks great with iOS7 and their colorful icons.  Aside from its feel, you can barely tell it's on.Cons:  Not really a con but it squeaks when you swipe through screens.  I actually don't mind it as I know it's just the protectors' texture.  I would rather have that squeaking sound over the matte feel of other screen protectors.  The included rear protectors are three clear pieces.  I kind of wish the rear protector was one piece instead of three but it looks fine.  No problem on the installInstallation: NOW I know why Spigen is considered one of the best.  Install went very smooth.  Only one speck got on the front protector but I used the included tape to lift it and another to retrieve the speck.  Other than that, it was a bubble free install starting with the front facing camera and working down towards the home button.  I installed mine in the bathroom with the shower running but be careful turning the bathroom into a steam room.  With too much steam it'll cause a rainbow effect to appear under the protector.Overall all a great product from Spigen.  I'm currently rockin' the Neo Hybrid(another great product) and these front & back screen protectors work fantastic together.I look forward to trying new Spigen products in the near future(I buy a new product for phones about every week ....accessorizing my iPhone 5 is my passion).OLEOPHOBIC's Review:If you're looking for a screen protector(SP) that looks like nothing is installed; the Oleophobic is the one for you.  Spigen's Ultra Optics Dual is also a good protector cause of its texture but the Oleophobic may offer 100% clarity.  The install was smooth, one small speck that was removed using the included tape.  I installed it while at a restuarant(not recommended---use the bathroom method for a perfect install) and it STILL came out awesome!  At first it felt a little sticky but I think it was from the residue from the "front" film which gets removed after install.  After a quick wipe, it felt amazing!
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: Excellent screen protector that provides great clarity. If you can I would recommend going for the oleophobic version since this one can gather a lot of fingerprints and get smudgy. Been using it for almost two weeks and have yet to experience any scratches on it.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: Very happy with this purchase. It only took less than 5 minutes to apply, and it looks great. I read the post by A. Wallace, and it definitely helped. I left the protective plastic that came with my iPhone on until I was ready to put the SPIGEN screen protector on. The trick about putting a piece of tape on the top so that it acts like a hinge is great! It definitely helped keep the screen protector in place. It only took me one try to get it on perfectly.I ended up with two big bubbles at the bottom that easily removed with the included cloth. I have a tiny bubble towards the top that is difficult to remove but it doesn't really bother me, so I'm leaving it.The one thing that I didn't pay attention to is that this screen protector is shiny, so there is a ton of glare outdoors. It's very clear though. Compared to a matte screen protector (my dad has one), I'm happier with mine because it's so clear.I'm using the Belkin Grip Candy Sheer case and it looks like the case edge ends right where the screen protector does, so there will probably be lint/dirt trapped in there, but it's too early to tell. I will just have to remove the case around it more.
title: SPIGEN SGP iPhone 5 Screen Protector Clear Steinheil Ultra Crystal [2-Pack] film cover shield for AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, International - CLEAR

reviewText: This was awesome, I've been trying to find screen protectors that were glossy as opposed to matte and this was it. Easy to apply no bubbles at all...

reviewText: Do not let the description fool you. This is NOT a metal case. It is a gunmetal COLOR... but is still plastic.The fit is great and keeps the iPhone's true slim feel. The lip is higher on the back than the front to protect it when setting it down.I'm not a fan of screen protectors, but I tried the back piece, I wasn't a fan of the three separate films, but i understand why. The middle section (that goes over the aluminum back) didn't look very good as the Apple logo and "iPhone" print is slightly raised.The headphone and lightening connector cutouts are only large enough for Apple versions of cables.... I doubt any third party stuff will work.I would give this 5 stars, but I find the "Metal" part of the product's name to be deceiving. When I looked at Spigen's product page for this case, it has in the description "Metallic finish to the polycarbonate frame". Kind of lame if you ask me to call it "Metal"... but whatever.I've tried Speck, Incipio, Elago, Tavik and now Spigen... so far, this is my favorite, but we'll see how it goes. :)
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid EX Slim Vivid Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Dante Red (SGP10026)

reviewText: I got the slim version of this bumper case, which appears (so far) to provide pretty good protection for the iPhone 5 without compromising much of its design.The included back and front films provide adequate protection against scratches from day to day use, and the bumper case is one of the slimmest I've seen for the iPhone 5, and the metal outer band (in look, not really metal) fit pretty tight and nicely on the phone.I read that the regular version of this bumper case is pretty thick, so I went with the slim version instead and so far I like it a lot.Will update this review after I've used it for a few months.BTW, it is a bit pricey so hopefully this product will last for a couple of years...

reviewText: Received my bumper today (wife's) and testing it out. The bumper is in fact "slim" leaving little front and back protection, but those aren't my concerns as I will be using a rear screen protector and the amazing BodyGuardz Pure Glass front glass protector. The Hot Pink bumper looks very nice and seems high quality, I only wished instead of grey "cheap looking" volume rockers and sleep/wake buttons they would have used metal to better match the phone.Overall a high quality bumper, why four stars? This is a very nice bumper, but not a $30+ bumper.I'd like add that I understand packaging and presentation means a lot, but the packaging on these bumpers is over the top. You could easily still have nice packaging and shave an easy $10 off the cost.Update: I now have the Hot Pink, Red and Silver. I really do believe these are the nicest bumpers around, the only improvement Spigen can make is to widen the charging port. Right now, only the OEM Apple lightning usb cable will work, make it wider and this would be a 5 star product.

reviewText: first things first.Everything that I say in this review is based on my experience with the previous and recent model of this product. I am NOT affiliated with this company whatsoever.I bought this the first time last November 27, 2012 since I'm a big fan of bumper cases and the color yellow. with a little bit of research and faith, I finally decided to get this and loved it! My dad loved it so I gave him mine instead. This month, I decided to get another one since I really loved everything about this case. Turns out, when I received and opened the package, It was as improved model!Pros:-The Bumper case is thinner now, but still gives a "lay on the table" design, so even if you put your iPhone 5 front screen down first, it wouldn't scratch.-feedback on the power and volume buttons are better and I like how they changed the color of the rubber from grey to black-since its color yellow, even if it scratches, its not noticeable at all.-comes in with a FRONT and BACK Screen Protector (the front screen protector is a clear one & the back screen protector is a three-piece, matte type.)now for the cons:-This case comes with a lot of freebies, but I really hate how they included the jelly bean buttons. I know it's optional to put it on, but if you do, its really awkward to press, plus if you place it just a little bit out from the home button, it would be just horrible. Also, its a pain to remove and leaves sticky residues. I'd rather get one of their HOME ALUMINUM BUTTONS then get 3 horrible jelly buttons.**The cons are not a deal breaker though!OVERALL, I really like this improved model and would highly recommend it to anyone. I will put an update on how durable this bumper case is within the next weeks or months. so far, the other sgp spigen the I have is still in excellent condition.UPDATE: BUMPER CASE IS STILL IN GREAT CONDITION. very little (unnoticeable) scratches on the bumper case itself which is normal when you put in in and out of your pocket. still a snug fit.

reviewText: I really like the case.  It's very thin and the design is extremely close to Apple's look and design of the actual iPhone.  This product comes with beautiful screen protectors for the front and back.  The ONLY two drawbacks I have with this product is almost every manufacturer of screen protectors and skins will guarantee not only their product's functionality, but also even your ability to install it correctly.  I have installed dozens of skins from a variety of manufacturers on my own devices as well as family/friends devices.  Everyone wants me to install theirs because I get them on perfectly.  And almost always without a problem.  I'm really anal about getting them on super straight and even more anal about getting them on without dust, dirt, or even an air bubble under them.  But even then, sometimes things happen.  Usually if you screw up during installation most manufacturers will replace the skin even if you were the one who destroyed trying to put it on.It just so happens that I payed a lot of money for this case and the skins that came with it.  It also just so happened that when I was getting ready to install the front  screen skin it popped out of my hands and landed on the floor in my kitchen.  Now we keep our house extremely clean.  However, the floor in an operating room in a hospital is not even clean enough for a self adhering screen protector to have land on it. So naturally there were now specs of whatever all stuck to it.  I rinsed the screen protector off under cool water taking a lot of extra care not to damage or scratch the adhesive on the protector in the process.I have several bottles of screen protector solution (that not only lubricates but cleans as well) in my desk draw so I did my very best to make sure the protector was absolutely clean before installing it.  Even with as much effort and care as I put into cleaning it, there were three tiny specs of whatever still stuck to the protector that you can see when installed on the phone.  I carefully removed the skin from the phone and cleaned it again.  And again.  And again.  In the process I got two of the specs off but not without first scratching the adhesive.  I knew it!  I wound up just leaving the third spec as it is just because of the damage I did to trying to get the other two off.  I installed it for the last time.  The two scratches are VERY visible as is the third spec on the black band up near the receiver and front facing camera.  Of course it couldn't be somewhere in the actual screen area where it would be less noticeable when the phone is on.Now I realize that NONE of this is Spigen's fault.  I have no one to blame but myself.  But what can you do?  $hlt happens.  But at $32 you would think that Spigen would be nice enough to extend the courtesy of a replacement screen protector even though they weren't the one to destroy it.  Another nice thing about companies that extend that courtesy is that there are times when your device dies and has to be replaced.  Sometimes removal and reinstallation of the skin is not able to be done correctly or without some sort of damage to it.  Say you are away on vacation.  You drop your iphone in the water at the beach.  You take it the Apple store to get a new phone.  They are not going to R&R; your screen protector for you there.  You will have to remove it and replace it yourself under less than optimal conditions.  That protector is going to get ruined.  Almost every other manufacturer will replace that protector for you out of customer courtesy.  So my next choice will probably not be another Spigen for just that very reason.The second drawback is this:  The three piece rear protector that's included with is case is beautifully designed.  The texture and look mimic's Apple's Glass-Aluminum-Glass look and feel incredibly well.  However the center piece is slightly too small so you either have to split the difference with the center skin and bottom skin or have the bottom skin make up the difference entirely and have it fall short of the outer band.  I split the difference between the center skin and the bottom.  I could not move the top skin down to split the differences between all three, which would have been better, but if I had done that then I would have moved the skin too low and have it wind up in the rear camera's lens area.  That was not an option.  The seam where the the top skin and the center skin meet is absolutely PERFECT.  You cannot see nor feel the seem if installed correctly.  Amazing!  However, because the bottom skin does not fit tight against the short center skin, you can see and feel the gap between those two.  This is what happens when you are this anal about stuff, are a perfectionist, and expect everything to be perfect.  Life is less than perfect.  Even at $32.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid EX Slim Vivid Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Dante Red (SGP10026)

reviewText: I hate phone cases, but I've been really paranoid ever since I dropped my iPhone on the cement the other day..  So I decided I needed something to help protect my phone.  I had a bumper by Apple for my iPhone 4, and it was solid and I loved it!!  So I decided I wanted a bumper-type case instead of a full body case.  Since Apple isn't making a bumper for the iPhone 5, after lots of research, I bought this one....PROS: Good looking, very low profile and thin (doesn't add any bulk or weight to your phone), sticks up a little higher than front and back screens for protection, all buttons, jacks, and lightning hole are easily accessible, and it's pretty easy to put on.CONS: Doesn't fit tight enough around the phone, very flimsy and uncomfortable feeling, first sleeve is silicon, so it feels a lot more like plastic than rubber, and it peeled up the edges of my ZAGG invisibleSHIELD on the front and back.  This case also comes with three little jelly button stickers, and they are really hard to stick on straight and they can't be reapplied once stuck on.Not a terrible bumper case, but I'm sure there are tons of sturdier, tighter-fitting bumpers out there for the iPhone 5.  This case is pretty inexpensive compared to other iPhone 5 cases, but for as flimsy as this case is, it seems a bit overpriced.  Overall, this really isn't a terrible bumper, but if you're like me and want a tight-fitting bumper that feels more natural to the iPhone, this probably isn't the one for you.Oh, and also...  I wanted to return this item for a refund, but my product didn't come with a receipt, so now I'm stuck with it...  Just be aware that you MIGHT not be able to return it.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid EX Slim Vivid Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Dante Red (SGP10026)

reviewText: Cute.  Does NOT make my 5s phone look like a 'gold’ phone since the color doesn't continue on the sides of the case, but the case looks just fine in my white phone, and has held up well to a couple major drops to the floor,
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: Spigen is brand that I have had several cases from and have never had any issues. I recently upgraded from a black iPhone to a white one, and decided it was time to upgrade the case as well.I am a huge fan of shell cases because they are thin and do not add unnecessary bulk to the phone. This case fits that perfectly. It is not an Otterbox, and it will not defend your phone the same as an Otterbox, but the tradeoff is thin or bulky.My iPhone is a White Silver 5S and this case, as they said it would, matches the color perfectly. The back of the case is made out of metal which in my opinion adds a reinforced structure to the shell. The back does have a slight texture to it, but it's something that is very minimal and likely to go unnoticed. I have also noticed that the back does not scratch, at least not very easily. I have owned it for a few weeks now without even the slightest scratch, it still looks brand new.The cutouts on the side for the volume buttons and vibrate/ring switch are plenty big so that you do not need to use the tip of your finger and try your hardest to push the buttons.As other reviewers have mentioned, the case does not have a lip that comes over the screen of the phone. It is raised up ever so slightly, but if you drop it directly on its face the glass could crack, again a risk you're taking by not buying a bulky Otterbox.Overall I love the case and I know that Spigen is a great brand that produces awesome products. Looks great on my iPhone and gives it the right amount of protection that I want.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: The look of the metal plate in the back of this case makes this the best looking Iphone 5 case on the market.  I got so many compliments on this case while I was using it with the most frequent comment being, "wait... I didn't even notice there was a case on your phone at first." The case offers good protection for the back and sides of the phone but that's really where it ends.  The fatal flaw of the case is that with no lip on the front and no top and bottom edge, aside from protecting the aluminum from getting scratched, this case won't do much for your phone in a drop.  I'd recommend checking out the Slim Armor also by Spigen as an alternative, which looks a lot like this case accept with a metallic looking plastic and much much better protection for your phone.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: it really doesn't even feel like there is a case on my phone. I am going from using an otterbox to this, so as you can imagine, now it feels like I am not even holding a phone. it is a very stylish case and goes well with the phone. The phone is held very snug and there isn't any movement or room for the phone to move around in the case. I haven't dropped my phone (nor do I intend to, but we never do lol), so I cannot comment on protection.I do recommend to anyone looking for a nice slim case for their iphone 5 thoughUPDATE: 2/19/2014****SO...... In the past month I've dropped my phone about 3 times. Each time it fell from a distance of about 3 feet onto tile floor. I am very pleased with the protection provided!!! The case itself got a light scuff on the one corner, and that was it. No damage was done to the phone!I am updating to 5 starsUPDATE 2/24/2014*****Well, My dropping streak continued through this past weekend. I dropped my phone on tile floor and a small piece from the upper right corner of the case chipped off. The phone received a very minor bump from the drop as well. I am still keeping the 5 star rating because the case did what it was supposed to do. I am now debating whether or not to buy a new case to replace this one or just go back to my otterbox. Although I love that this case is slim and it does protect the phone, it is just a matter of time I think until I drop it and the phone is really damaged.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: It arrived with bottom right corner of the metal loosely glued, exposing the plastic underneath. it slowly extended to top right. I wanted to save the trouble to ship it back, so I used super glue and tried sticking it back. I applied a little too much. the glue spilled out when I depressed the metal onto the case. It damaged and it irks me just to see it's condition now.It's quite disappointing, considering I only used it for half a day. Nevertheless, I'm giving it a second chance because of the red.

reviewText: Having a case for your iPhone is somewhat personal.  I am more of a functional person and had heard good things of this case but after making the purchase and trying it, it is relegated to the back of the drawer, possibly for someone else.The iPhone 5s has very convenient and easily accessible buttons and switches.  I found this case to get in the way of that functionality.  Now, that is me, and I have large fingers, but that is my opinion.I think for the iPhone, the case needs to envelope the phone so that the case has extensions that control the switches or it simply needs to be very skinny and offer better access without bring the plastic to close to the buttons.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: i like the case since read is my favorite color but the side is plastic thin and i don't like it
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: If you are like me that never drop your phone or you treat your phone right, this case is for you, it does look good, the back looks like heavy metal but the case itself it is very light, if you have an iPhone 5S, this case is perfect to show it off. I have all the colors now..
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: My last several case purchased have been Spigen and they always excellent.  Its metal back is very attractive, case is very slim profile but adds much needed protection.  Only thing is my wife has a $9.99 CVS bin case and I envy the nice rubber texture on the sides where your hand holds it.  This case is slick and has no grip on the sides so keep that in mind!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: -----------------OVERVIEW-----------------Having an iPhone 5s, I have purchased and tested numerous cases of all sorts. I personally am not a bulky/rugged/massive protection case person because I do not like the added bulk, weight and overall design and ergonomics those cases. I am familiar with Spigen Cases and they have quality products at an affordable price.--------------------PROTECTION--------------------Like I stated in my overview, this is a slim and sleek case and I did not expect it to provide military grade protection, or even small child protection for that matter. The case adds minimal thickness/bulk to the iPhone 5s which is great. The case snaps on the rear and really only protects the rear/back and sides of the iPhone 5s, nothing more so don't expect or assume screen protection of any sort with this case.What I also loved about the case is that I have my iPhone 5s wrapped in a full body skin to protect from just scratches and this doesn't ruin the skin. It snaps directly over it with no issues of it pushing the edges of the skin off.--------------------------DROPPED iPhone--------------------------While I use my iPhone 5s, my 6 year old daughter uses it on occasions and frequently drops and mishandles the iPhone. She has dropped it on a few occasions (mostly indoors) while the case was on and it has kept the iPhone 5s front scratches, dents and dings which is sufficient and what I expect out of this case. I was not let down.-------------------------------PRODUCT FEATURES-------------------------------- Give your iPhone 5/5S an Outfit! Polycarbonate and solid aluminum plate creates a modern hybrid design.- Protection without the bulk: Ultra Slim case offers corner and scratch protection, as well as a slight lift to allow your iPhone 5/5S to be put screen-side down on a flat surface.- Anti-Ghost Camera Cutout allows the camera and flash to be used without any interference from the case.- Direct access to all buttons and ports on your iPhone 5/5S; designed by Spigen in California and made in Korea to ensure the use of non-hazardous chemicals.- Disclaimer: Product color may vary due to lighting, screen pixel quality and color settings. Due to camera flash, shadows may exist in photos.------------------------SLICK/SLIPPERY------------------------A lot of cases and screen protectors I review can be rather slick and causes devices to slip from my hand more so than not protecting the device at all. I was actually surprise this was not an issue with this case.-------------------PROS/CONS-------------------PROS- Price- Special Coating- Precision Fit- Super Slim Design- Quality Control- Build/Quality- Color Selection- Works with SOME Full Body Skins such as Skinomi, IQ Shield, Zagg, Etc.- Sufficient Protection- Works with iPhone 5 and 5s- Prompt Customer ServiceCONS- Although "slim" still adds bulk/depth to the iPhone
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: i bought all 3 colors - red, silver, and gold. these are the best uber thin minimalist cases ever. the quality is top notch, and the aluminum back is so classy! i've received quite a few compliment and questions of where i got them. they do not have a lip so will not allow face down protection, but that's ok. i never put my phone face down...why would anyone do that anyway.love these cases!!!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: Cosmetically this case is amazing and that is why it got 5 stars. The metal backing is really cool but the case does not offer any protection. My phone fell off the ledge of my sofa and the glass screen protector cracked in the corner and I had to replace the glass. Ironically, the case did not suffer any damage. With that said, you do not buy this case if you want protection. I would recommend you buy the Spigen Slim Armor which is also a great looking case and it does offer protection on the corners. This saturn case however is an amazing looking case and I really hope they offer it in Gunmetal or a Carbon Fibre finish in the future.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: When this case arrived I was like wow, there really isn't much to it.  It comes in a fancy plastic box that requires a little thought to get into but it is exactly what I ordered.  If your looking for anything beyond basic protection then this case isn't for you; if you are prone to drop your phones this case isn't for you.  The protection is minimal, it may protect your phone if you drop it a couple feet onto the corner but there is no lip around the screen so it is completely exposed.  Lets be honest, its just a decorative case.  I'm not knocking the case at all, I rarely drop my phones I can't stand bulky protective cases, the Otterbox Commuter is way too bulky for me.  I just want basic protection and something that protect from scratches in my pocket, My favorite case is probably the Otterbox Reflex but the bottom of them is very flimsy and breaks just from normal use.  After my 2nd Reflex broke I decided to try something new and I really like how this case looks, it adds no bulk to the iphone just a little bit of individual style.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: This is a really nice looking case of high quality.  The only drawback is no screen protection (i.e. bumper) or shock protection.  This is essentially a case that will protect the back from scratches (top/bottom is exposed).
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Saturn Case for iPhone 5S/5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10141)

reviewText: I love this phone case. This is the second Spigen case I have purchased and my favorite. I loved the other case but love this one even more. :) it is the thinnest case I have ever used and the bruised aluminum is beautiful. I only wish they had it also in a light pink. I love that I can change the faceplates out without having to purchase a new case. It protects my phone. I have dropped it on the corners and so far have had no issues. I really like that both the top and bottom are open making it super easy to put on a charger. The case feels great, looks great and most importantly does the job I bought it to do. The biggest difference with this case is that there isn't a lip on the top to give it the protection from landing flat on the ground face down. The last Spigen had the lip to help keep it from shattering the screen. But I purchased a shatterproof screen protector and it seems to be well protected from all angles.

reviewText: Over all this was a great protective film. It's not like those cheap ones you get from overseas at a competitor's web. There are no rainbow effects and it seems like it's somewhat smudge resistant.In the package:2x protective screen guards1x squeegee1x microfiber clothe.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: By far, probably the best screen protector I've purchased for any phone. What I loved about it the most is that it was extremely easy to install and required no liquids; it was a dry application. The screen protector will cover pretty much all of front of the phone, including its sensors, while shielding very close to the edges of the phone's bezel. Not to mention that the screen protector looks nearly invisible and feels as though it's hardly there. Also, when I installed mine, I had hardly to any air bubbles, which I find so annoying to get rid of!  The only drawback is that it will pick up on oil, so make sure you are wiping it off every now and then. Other than that, fantastic! I will for sure buy again (maybe Oleophobic next time).
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: This is a good screen protector in the fact that it looks like it isn't there. As with cheaper screen protectors, you get what you pay for when it comes to clarity and quality. Pay a little more and get good protection and quality for a great device like the Galaxy S4.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: Very easy to apply! Just follow the instructions. And the clarity is so awesome- it's like ive never applied anything at all! Though fingerprints get noticed easily on this one. But nothing that the included microfiber cloth cant wipe off. Very happy with purchase. Thinking of buying another one.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: When I put this on my phone I loved it, went on perfect, not a flaw and could barely tell it was there.  After 2 and a half weeks though, scratches are all over the screen.  I keep this in my pocket and at times mingles with my keys or change.  Had a iphone 4 with a power support screen protector 2 years with less scratches in the same pocket.Wish power support made protectors for the S4.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewerName: Custnam "HE Loved Us Enough to Die For Us, Lo...
reviewText: I have had quite a few different brand screen protectors for my S3, and S4, and out of all of them I prefer the Spigens.  The main difference I see between the Spigen and other S4 screen protectors is screen coverage. The spigen covers the whole screen, when some of the others cut off at the top without covering the camera and sensors, or they dont go all the way around the home button at the bottom. Once its on you can barely see it even has one, and is very thin. I havent had any issues with case interference at all. I highly recommend the Spigen Ultra Crystal to protect your awesome S4 screen!
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: Spigen/Steinheil protectors are the best as far as I'm concerned. The one I had on my Motorola Droid Razr was the anti-fingerprint and anti-glare and did an excellent job - no scratches after two years! The one I have now is the Crystal Clear version and works great, however I think I prefer the anti-fingerprint version better simply because I can see the fingerprints on the Crystal Clear and they drive me crazy. It doesn't effect how the product protects however, and I wear earrings every day and no scratches or dull spots at all. Application was super easy and I got it on the first try on both phones. It comes with an extra, but unless I drop the phone in gravel on its screen and then step on it, I doubt I will need the second one. I didn't need the second one for my Razr and so I still have it. That one still looks like it did the first day I put it on.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: A little difficult to apply. You have to be very precise as this does not use any application solution to center it if you put it  wrong. But....... "is the best" shield I have ever used.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: This thing is great.  Its clear, doesn't smudge easy, and doesn't hurt the functionality of the touchscreen.  I have had this on my phone now longer then any other screen protector on any phone.  While it has some minor scratches, the screen hardly shows them.  I will replace it with the same protector when its time.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: I have a hard time installing these things, but they manufacturer did all they can to simplify. It has easy peel off tabs, etc, to help make things easier. Does what it is supposed to do.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: It is, as many have said, almost impossible to apply without get fingerprints or bubbles. I managed to get it without any bubbles by pressing hard and sliding up and down with the squeegee while applying, but there is still tiny dust in between the screen and the protector. The back side of the protector is like a dust magnet, and its stickiness mean you do not have the ability to clean it off without making things worse. Ruined the first one when trying to apply, so I had to use the 2nd one and I am not happy with it either. I would look elsewhere. I am not new to screen protectors, and I know this can be a problem with different ones, but I have never used one where the problem was this exaggerated. I should have gotten an ArmorSuit.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: There are no directions that come with the protector, so it took me one protector wasted in order to get it on right. However, once I got the second one on right, it is perfect. You can't even tell there is a protector on here!
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: I like screen protectors that are invisible and preserve original clarity of screen. Very easy to apply due to way they are packaged.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: I have the Ultra Clear one. This is the first time I've used SGP's screen protector. I've tried others in the past and it seems the same. Granted, the "other" ones I've used were also good brands at the time I bought them. I like how this protectors cover the whole screen top to bottom with the exception of the front camera. Wish they could have done a circle around it and not a U shape, but that's just me. I got this for 50% off since I also bought an SGP case. I'd recommend this screen protector to friends.Installation was also easy. I took a hot bath to steam up the bathroom. All the dust was settled down so none were flying around. Took me only about 5 minutes. First try and only got one speck under the screen protector. It was easy to take it out and then I was done.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: I hate screen protectors in general because they generally look fuzzy to me. The S4 has an amazingly clear screen, but it's plastic, so I also didn't want it scratched up.To install this, you simply line it up, put a piece of clear tape on the left or right side once you have it where you want it, readjust if necessary, then just peel the liners off and set it down. I've installed 2 and with this method I got either no bubbles or a very small one that eventually worked its way out on the edge.As for protection, my phone rides in a pants pocket with keys and all sorts of sharp things, a year later - no scratches whatsoever on the underlying screen. The protector itself is pretty hard to scratch, I think I had one tiny little scratch after over a year of keys against it in my pocket. When I say tiny, I mean, not visible without actually looking for it.It does clean up pretty easily, but yes, just like any screen, it'll smudge and such with use. I don't find it a big problem though.All cut outs were where you'd want them to be.As far clarity, this is easily the clearest screen protector I've ever seen (and I'm picky about that sort of thing).
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: I have used screen protectors in the past on my Blackberry and on my Samsung Galaxy Epic 4G so I am familiar with the basics of a screen protector.  In my research Spigen came up multiple times as a quality product, my evaluation so far is not contradictory to that estimation.  The instructions were clear and concise, the packaging included a microfiber cloth and a squeegee, although I would have liked a alcohol swab as well.  The cut is amazing, and the fit it perfect, the actual screen protector is cut slightly smaller than the housing of the phone, this is done on purpose and this is indicated on the instructions.  I laid the protector on the top, aligned it and pulled the backing off, for the most part it self sealed leaving only two small air bubbles for me to work out with the squeegee.  The clarity is the same as the naked screen, now that it is on I visually can not tell the screen protector is on.  The feel of the screen has dynamically changed however, this is why I gave the product 4 stars.  The naked S4 screen is very slick and smooth, but after applying the protector is feels like there is a bit of resistance to my swiping. it's almost like a matte rubber feel, it's not a hindrance to sensitivity or touch responsiveness it just feels different to my fingers.  I am sure with time I will acclimate to the feel and won't notice it.  All in all I believe the protection provided outweighs the small change in the feel of the glass.  This is a temporary solution as I plan to replace this protector with a Spigen GLAS.t Premium Tempered Glass screen protector in the future.*!*UPDATE*!*After using the phone for a bit the feel returns almost completely to the slick naked screen feel.  My wife installed the second protector on her phone and I advised after removing the top applicator plastic to wipe the screen down with the microfiber cloth.  This returned her screen to almost naked feel immediately.  It may be a residue left over from the applicator film that I was feeling.  the screen is smooth and feels 98% back to naked.  In my edit and update of this review I changed from 4 to 5 stars because the issue that caused the lower rating has been resolved.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen Steinheil Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Ultra Crystal (SGP10174)

reviewText: If you have used any plastic type film on your phones, you know most of the cheap films often are very tacky in feel when using the screen. reviewText: This is the second time I gave this screen protector a try. The first time, I cleaned the phone, my hands, my work area and proceeded by following the directions. reviewText: I'm a big fan of Spigen/Steinheil film screen protectors, but I'm just going to stick with the glass ones from now on. The glass provides a very smooth surface for using my S4 - everything feels very slick and responsive. The glass screen protector also picks up a lot less fingerprints than normal clear screen protectors. Which means that it's perfect for anyone who wants to retain the high definition of their screen (I've never understood matte/anti-fingerprint screen protectors, why would you want to make your magnificent phone screen appear all fuzzy).The application for this went much more smoothly than I'd thought - once I'd made sure the screen was free from dust, it went on pretty easily, no adjustments needed.The glass is ever so slightly visible since it doesn't cover the speakers at the top but to me, it's barely noticeable and the smoothness + anti-fingerprint nature of the glass is more important, anyway.(Update) I bought another one because I had a tiny crack at one corner from dropping my phone*. The rest of the screen protector didn't shatter, and I felt reasonably sure that my screen itself was alright. Got a little annoyed with the crack so I decided to install the new glass protector. And as a testament to how good the adhesive is, it took me a good five minutes to pry off the protector. And yep, my phone screen was still perfect - no cracks at all. Once I had removed it, I lined up the new protector with trepidation - I had been reluctant to install a new one since the first one had gone on so perfectly. What if I botched this one? Fortunately, it was as easy to install as the first time - I realise that it's probably because there's something you can actually hold on to to line it up with your phone.Bottomline:a) It protects your screen from shattering.b) It is easy to install.c) It's smooth and you can barely tell that you have anything on your phone screen.d) It helps keep off fingerprints.e) You should just buy it already.*Note: The crack happened when I dropped the phone with a Spigen Slim Armour case on. I've since dropped my phone at least a dozen times more with other cases, and no other cracks have appeared. So beware of the Slim Armour case...
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen GLAS.tR SLIM Premium Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging (SGP10178)

reviewText: I have nothing but praise for the Glas.tR for the Samsung Galaxy S4. Because the glass on the phone is perfectly flat, the screen cover covers the entirety of the edge to edge glass while leaving open the front speaker grill, three of the sensors and the homebutton. I've only had it for a little bit so I can't say anything about the durability, but the look and feel is just amazing. You can't even tell that you're touching a screen cover as opposed to the actual phone.Because the home button sticks out a bit on the actual phone, pressing the home button with Glas.tR isn't difficult, though it is a little recessed. I used Spigen's Aluminum Home Button Sticker and it fits perfectly within the cutout for the home button, which I highly recommend (because the jelly buttons are pretty ugly) but otherwise, stickers aren't really necessary.The screen, back and menu buttons suffer no loss in sensitivity, or a loss so small that you can't even notice. The camera sees perfectly fine and the notification light is still really bright. The screen still looks vibrant and colorful with no loss in performance.However, you should definitely buy a case with this to prevent chipping. I have Spigen's Neo Hybrid and it fits perfectly around the border of the Glas.tR, but because the cover's thickness, there isn't much of a lip and I wouldn't put the phone face down.An overall great buy, 10/10 definitely recommended.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen GLAS.tR SLIM Premium Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging (SGP10178)

reviewText: the aesthetics of this protector are fantastic. the display of my S4 is just as beautiful as it was without it. the curves on the glass give the device a finished look.The protector feels just like the bare glass underneath. touch sensitivity is unaffected, and air gesture and air view still work as before. the screen resists fingerprints well, and water glides right off of it, being hydrophobic and oleophobic. the package i recieved included a film protector for the back of the device, which was a nice gesture.now onto the reason i only docked one star from my rating: the application process. this film is not flexible. you must set it on the device straight. while applying it, you should get your bathroom all hot and steamy, turn off your shower and wait a few minutes. set the phone down and wipe the screen until it is clear of all debris with your included microfiber cloth. moisten the microphiber cloth with some rubbing alcohol(>95%) if you have it. wipe off all oils, so that the glass is very clean, again, look to see there is no debris or anything at all on the display. next, take the alcohol wipe "EOL wipe" that is included in the package. wipe down the screen with this, to be doubly sure the screen is clean. when you are sure there is nothing on the top of your phone, but very clean glass, take your protector, remove the cover on the back, adhesive side. holding the glass at the sides, lower it to the display, making sure everything is lined up, and drop it into place, praying you did it right. then press on the center of the display and watch the adhesive bond spread. if there are any bubbles, remove them with the squegee or with your hands. once you remove all bubbles, peel off the top film on your glas.tr. congratulations. if you are lucky, you have successfully installed your screen protector. if you are like me, you didn't see one speck of dust on the phone before you applied it, and now have one bubble that will never go away.even with all this, i love this protector. I am using this with the Spigen SGP Neo Hybrid, and this high level of protection does not detract at all in my opinion from the phone naked.I love this screen protector on my phone, but I hate putting it on my phone.
title: Galaxy S4 Screen Protector, Spigen GLAS.tR SLIM Premium Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Galaxy S4 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging (SGP10178)

reviewText: Could be more resistant to scratches and bubbles. Fits great and looks nice. Would have liked it to take more of a beating scratches easy. High price for low results. They do make some great cases for all phones THAT is what I like about Spigen they have a slick line of phone cases.
