title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I like this case much more than the neo hybrid from spigen. This case looks just as good if not better than the neo hybrid. The red is a different color. The buttons are easy to find and press. The case is easy to put on and take off. This case also offers more protection than the neo hybrid. Just like the neo hybrid this case is customizable and changeable by buying a different color backing. The bezel is the right thickness and height to provide protection without interfering with using the phones screen or capacitive buttons. The case fits nicely in my hands, it is a little on the slippery side. Although it hasnt slipped out of my hands yet. The back does get fingerprints very easily since its glossy. I would have preferred a matte finish for less finger prints and more grip. I dont think the matte would have looked as nice as the glossy back. No scratches on the back yet after 2 weeks of usage. This is my new favorite case. I switch back and forth between this and my urban armor gear which has a less colorful but more slimmer profile, providing some extra protection and grip.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This fits the phone perfectly. I got the slate blue and it looks fantastic. Very high quality looking case. I love that the volume and power buttons slightly stick out making them perfectly accessible and responsive. The cut outs are almost so precise, that you'd think that it was the phone itself. The case feels nice in the hand but I wish it had a bit more grip. Could use just a little strip of rubber on the sides maybe or they could have slightly textured the sides just a bit. The ONLY things that I really hate (HATE) is that it is kind of an smudge/grease magnet and the case scuffs from just daily use. I found that I was constantly making sure there was nothing in my pockets to scuff it, also I was consciously making sure I placed it facing down instead of laying it on its back. I felt the nag of taking care of my nice case. I ended up buying a UAG case (also in slate blue) because it bugged me so much. I occasionally put this back on, but I wish so bad that it had the classy yet rugged feel of my Urban Armor Gear case. The UAG is basically smudge proof and very scratch resistant. If this had the same type of feel to the back as my UAG, it'd be in my top ten favorite cases of all time. I've  owned over 650 cases from the early iPhone /EVO days to now. I'm a case nut. Before another company bought it out, I actually used to have my own website and sold cell phone cases for a living, so technically I've had thousands of phone cases. Anyways for me to say that this would be one of my all time favorite cases if the back was a lot more scratch and smudge proof, is a big deal because (to make a simple understatement) I'm very picky, almost obsessive, when it comes to phone cases. I would still recommend this product to someone because others may not care about the scuffing and smudges.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: Is a slim case for the Samsung S4. It has rubber corners for drop protection although it may only  protect for those small drops. Either way my phone feels protected and still has that slim form factor. If you often change batteries on your device then this case may not be for you as its outer layer is difficult to remove and may break of you are constantly taking it on/off.Note to manufacturer: please consider environmentally friendly packaging. That thick hard  and heavy plastic shipping box is a total waste.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I love this company. because they make great product for great prices.I love this case because1- The design (it is not bulky yet it is protective)2- The colors choices.3- Light weight but have a very good shock absorption. when you drop the phone the impact will be distributed evenly.The reason why I gave it 4 stars is because I wish it had a higher frame by the phone screen. however if you use this case with their plastic screen protector. your phone will be super protected.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: $45 for full body protection from a well known and respected brand, or $40 for a floppy Samsung view cover that is bulky and keeps the scratch prone Polycarbonate back with a cover that doesn't stay closed.Pros:- Slim- Adds a nice weight to the phone that makes it seem more substantial and less fragile than a nude phone- The fact that they provide a screen protector for the view window, I was worried about it being scratched, way to think of (almost) everything Spigen- It looks sharp and the straight lines are stunning, really a nice looking case-If you really hate the cover you can easily remove it from the phone and just use the case, love a case that gives you options-Black on black color option, too many of these cases are now pairing black with grey and it's nice to have one that keeps it uniform.Cons:-The rubber used for the back half is a little too stiff leaving me to believe that it won't absorb impact as well as my Acase 2 piece protector which uses a soft silicon rubber-Fingerprint magnet-texture is off and throws my hypersensitivity into whack (more of an autism thing)-For a company that included a screen protector for the view window, why didn't they add a velvet or felt like fabric on the inside of the cover, instead they went with a textured hard plastic.-The rubber case doesn't perfectly fit the phone a little of the silver lip shows through, I have a carbon fiber 3M skin on the back of my phone that adds a negligible bit of thickness. I tried the case on without my back cover and it still didn't fit over the silver rim-When closed it's kind of hard to reopen it to get to the phone.While there seems to be a lot of negatives with this case, the aesthetics and the slimness kind of more than overrides them. Also the S-View feature while a gimmick is one that I've grown to love. I also understand that most of the texture issues are more of a "me" thing that most people won't have an issue with. I would easily buy this case again if I need to.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I am months into using this case and I still LOVE IT.  I have had no problems pushing buttons, volume or camera controls.  The is nothing blocking the camera on the front or the back. It turns out to be safer because I lay it screen down in the car and I am less prone to look at it.I highly recommend this to anyone with an S4, dont waste all your money on some big clunky protection. title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: The lip surrounding the longer sides of the screen is not raised much at all.  So, I am concerned that if phone drops flat on the screen or on an uneven surface (for example, gravel) there's a possibility the screen will scratch or crack. Along with others, I would recommend a screen protector as a 'must have'.Overall, it is otherwise very attractive and nicely constructed and all button pushing functions work well.  In my opinion, it is also one of the most stylish cases on the market.I believe it more attractive and stylish than the Acase Superleggera Pro or the Otterbox Commuter, both of which I also own.  But they provide greater overall protection to the screen area.  I do not share such concern with those cases because the 'lip' surrounding is higher, and more likely to absorb the impact of a fall where the screen comes into contact with the surface.Hence, I rate this case 3-Stars, otherwise 5-Stars in all other respects.I am definitely keeping this as I also purchased it on a 'Flash Sale'-well worth it at that very low price. It's also worth it at the regular Amazon price which is currently $14.99...but I'm not buying another.  Why?  There's more 'risk' if you drop it.  If you are accident-prone in the sense of dropping your phone, I'd instead recommend purchasing the Otterbox Commuter or Acase Superleggera Pro.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I drop my phone several times a month and needed a case that protects it well.  This Spigen slim armor case seems to do the job just fine.  I have had the case about 1 month now and have dropped my phone 5 - 6 times.  Despite landing on asphalt a couple times, it still looks great!  I don't think it is as protective as an Otterbox case, but it protects very nicely for the wear and tear I give it.  Two things I really like about this case are that I can answer the phone without opening the case, and that the time displays in the front window.It adds some weight to the phone, but not an inordinate amount.  I strongly recommend this case if you need something in the intermediate protection range.

title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This case looks great and the customer service is outstanding.  I had an issue with my original case whereby I gave this product 3 stars because of the fit of the rubber portion (it wasn't quite overlapping enough on the phone so it would slip off slightly).  The company contacted me (unprompted I might add) and offered a replacement to help with the problem.  Within days I had a new sleeve to try and fix the problem.  Looks like it is just the design itself because the second one basically did the same thing.  The case still works well and will provide decent protection but it would benefit from having a little larger lip around the edge to hold the phone better.  The customer service was the best I've experienced. Still a good case at a decent price and if you don't mind occasionally "popping" it fully back into position then it's a great option.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: Stylish and attractive.  Good seal around the edges.  Buttons work fine. Excellent drop protection.  Works fine with the RND Dock.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This is a 2-piece case that includes a soft rubber interior liner and a hard (and shiny) exterior cover.  The rubber insert shows through at the top, bottom, and at the buttons...IMO this is perfect, because it provides traction in the most common contact places (top, bottom and buttons) so you can lean your phone against something without it sliding down.  I was able to use all of my OEM and aftermarket power charger cables with the phone in the case (a problem with other models).  The black exterior case cover is very high gloss black and VERY thin.  If you want to keep the very thin profile of the S4 while maintaining a high level of impact and tactile protection then this is the case for you.The front bezel of the case wraps around just barely enough to keep the phone screen from touching when laid face down.  The bezel also covers just barely past the chrome lip all the way around the front of the phone, so you can use almost any screen protector (don't leave your hyper-smudging greasy-finger loving gorilla glass bare)Just like other Spigen cases it includes a color-matching sticker for the HOME button, but I never use them.The hard exterior case piece is impact resistance plastic and very glossy so I'm pretty sure all the colors available will show finger prints just as badly as my black case cover.All-in-all, I've bought dozens of cases for my S3 and the Spigen models are my favorite.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: So I pre ordered this case in black on the website and it came with a free set of screen protectors. I now have my s4 for verizon and boy do I love this case!!! Goes wonderfully with the black s4, does show some finger oils and has only a slite lip for laying it down face first but its suffice. Im usually picky with cases but I love mines!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I purchased this case before I had even received my phone. A mistake that has haunted me in the past with prior purchases. I hadn't ever heard of Spigen when I searched for a case for my Galaxy S4 but this time the risk paid off. The Slim Armor is exactly that, slim and protective. This case is the Anti-Otterbox bulky case that most Apple IPhone users choose. Why purchase a phone that is slim if you plan on making it 4 times larger by adding a bulky case? This is a problem that you won't face with the Spigen SGP Samsung Galaxy S4 Slim Armor. The fact that it's slim is accompanied by the fact that the case actually feels sturdy in your hand while looking good. If you are going to get the Galaxy S4 the Spigen Slim Armor is a wise choice for a case that is protective and compliments the phone very well. I had no choice but to give the case all 5 stars, something I rarely do based on this case meeting if not exceeding my expectations.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This case is perfect for me - it's protective yet still preserves the slim profile of my Galaxy S4, and it will slip easily into a pocket or purse without grabbing or hanging up, but isn't slick or slippery feeling. I like the fact that I can change out the hard shell if I want a different color, and the shells are available separately. I've had a lot of compliments on this case and I have directed them all to Amazon and Spigen.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I bought the matte blue version of this case. First point of note: choose gloss. It may show fingerprints more readily, but it also won't be nearly as slippery. If not for the additional thickness of this case, the bare Galaxy S4 would be easier to hold.Aesthetics are very nice. The edge minimalist lip sits tight against the screen surface. The join areas between the rubber and the plastic on the back are nearly perfect.I don't care for a few things about it. First, the back side is thicker than necessary and adds bulk to the phone. From the camera lens to the end of the plastic is 2-3mm, and the camera already protrudes on the bare S4. I suppose it could be nice if you dropped the phone on a sharp object that hit the back dead center, but otherwise, it's just unnecessary. The handset feels noticeable thicker in a pocket. Someone pointed out the protruding buttons. I don't mind those. They haven't caught on the edges of my pockets. Given how recessed the S4's buttons are, the rubber actually makes them a bit easier to press.It also doesn't fit any of my USB charging or 3.5mm audio cables. The holes aren't big enough. And these are pretty typical cheap cables from places like Monoprice, I didn't buy a bunch of oddballs.The last reason is more basic: it doesn't fit the phone. The case is slightly too long. I can see the metallic lip of the S4 on one side and it's very easy to push back the rubber lip from the edge of a corner. So easy that if the phone landed face-down on a corner, I'm certain the impact would push the rubber back and the phone would hit the ground. I can also feel the case flex and creak inward on those two corners, and when I pull the phone out of my pocket, the levering makes the top side of the case pull away.Online reviews show a tighter fit. My copy may be an aberration. Still, I'm trading it out for Spigen's Ultra Fit with the high-grip finish. For the most common drop scenarios, I doubt this case offers much more protection than a standard polycarbonate shell.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I compared this case against the Incipio DualPro and Spigen Neo Hybrid and after using all 3 I'd say I have a tie between this one and the Incipio DualPro, with the Neo Hybrid falling dead last. What I like about this case is that it looks pretty good and has a firm feel. The material is nice (slightly heavier than the Incipio which you may or may not like depending on the user) and the two-tone finish is attractive. The Dodger Blue color is pretty true to life in terms of how it looks in pictures and in person and is pleasing. This case also has slightly more grip than the Incipio; not much, but it's noticeable. Lastly, I like that the lip of the case around the screen is minimal. While this isn't ideal for protection reasons, it's large enough that you can place the phone face down on a flat surface and it won't hit the screen, but namely I like it because if you have gesture based apps as I do that require swipes from the right or left side of the bezel then this case makes touching that area easier. Plus, it's just nice to look at.Really, where I felt I was let down by this case is just in the overly shiny material. It's a fingerprint magnet the second you touch it and I'm not one who wants to have to clean my case. There really would be no point in cleaning the case anyway because once you touch it, you'll see your fingerprints whether dirty or clean. Incipio's soft touch is really the best choice here, as it'll age a lot better and over the time I've had it looked new the entire time. The Spigen on the other hand just looks terrible when light hits in and you see the smudges and fingerprints everywhere. Plus, because it's a hard, shiny case it'll definitely scratch easier, whereas the Incipio will take abuse a bit better (which I can confirm since I also had the same Incipio case for my last phone for over a year and it still looks new).Overall, though, I felt that this Spigen and the DualPro are arguably the best cases you could buy for the S4 in terms of offering great style and midrange protection. Neither is perfect, though. Go with the Spigen if you prefer shiny material, slightly more grip and virtually no lip around the screen and you don't mind some marginal added weight. Go with Incipio's DualPro if you want a little more protection, a slightly lighter case, and soft touch material. Both are winners in terms of looks if you ask me and you can't go wrong with either in that department. If you want to know which case I'm now using, I stuck with the Incipio.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I got this case for my S4, put it on and it hasn't come off since.  It strikes a nice balance between maintaining the form factor and providing good protection.  And the Dodger Blue color is a lot of fun, I must say.  Fortunately I haven't dropped it but I think it would do fine.  I would recommend getting a Zagg screen cover however.I have the Otter Box Commuter case for this and while that is very good, it does add additional bulk to the product.  No such issues here.  And while you MAY get some scratches on the case, as some other reviewers have noted, wouldn't you rather have the scratches on a $14 case than a $600-700 (full price) phone?  Anyway, my experience with scratches is that it's not the best, but it's not the worst either.  No issues.For the price and what you get, its an excellent value.  Spigen makes good products.  Buy with confidence.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: Okay, I have had several smartphones and at least 24 different cases.  And this one I am the most proud of.I had it for ~six months.  Dropped my phone at least a dozen times (no lie, I'm clumsy).  And this case, to this day, does not show a single mark/scratch on it.  CRAZY.  Btw, I have the metal-slate color.  And I never once had to clean fingerprints off it.  Though, I do take a damp cloth to it at least once every couple of weeks just out of habit.  But I've never once "felt I needed to" clean it.  Then again, I'm a rabid hand-washer due to a phobia about skin oil/grease that stems back twenty years ago to when I was a fry cook at Burger King.  hahah.Seriously though.  I actually cut the back of this case and McGyver'd a kick stand into it.  And even that didn't see to compromise the durability of the case.  I just bought a new phone and even though I'm now bored of the way this case looks (c'mon, I've never had a case this long before), I'm going to buy the EXACT same case for my Note 3.  Heck, I'm even going to get the same color because I already know it's not a fingerprint magnet.  Good job, Spigen.  I wish you made the rest of your cases as well as this one.  Oh, and I was initially scared of buying a case with covered buttons.  I hated this feature on any other case I've had.  But Spigen did a real good job on both the volume & power buttons.  I got used to them in just a week and they have never ever bothered me since.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I have to say that I'm disappointed with this case - I'm a big fan of Spigen/Steinheil products and this looked like it would give my S4 good protection without being too bulky. It does look good and generally fits well.But I think it is probably lacking protection-wise - I dropped my phone with this case on, and my Glas.tr screen protector ended up chipped and cracked in one corner. This is clearly a problem with the Slim Armor case, because I subsequently dropped my phone with three other cases on, and I have not gotten new cracks or shatters in my glass screen protector. And those cases cost about half the price of this case too. So yes, I'm disappointed that this didn't protect my phone as well as it looked like it would, despite the price.You might want to check out these other cases if you're looking to ensure that your phone is protected:+ Poetic Atmosphere Case: Slim, fits your phone snugly and protects it well. reviewText: I don't like cases that much...but in my first month using the Galaxy S4 without a case, I felt like I was often on the verge of dropping it since it's so smooth, thin, and light.  My previous phone was an Evo 3D, which I used for 2 years without a case; but, it was thicker and had a textured back which made it feel much more secure in my hand.So, I decided to get a case...I wanted some drop protection, but not some giant case that made it hard to put the phone in my pocket.  This is a great compromise.  It seems to provide a fair amount of protection without adding much bulk.As others have observed, the case limits the size of the headset jack and USB connector you can use.  The audio jack needs a "slim" connector...I ended up buying these two connectors (I included the term "slim" in my search to help find these), which work fine:B004G3ZTU8B008DWGLA0The Samsung earbuds work fine.  Most of my micro-USB connectors work.  I don't know how standardized they are, but my collection of micro USB cables seem to come in small (like the one Samsung provides), medium, and large.  The small and medium work fine; the large ones don't fit.If you want a slim case, I don't think there's any way to allow the larger audio and USB connectors to work, unless the case was in two sections that allowed the connector space to be open (which would cause other problems).Overall, this is a nice case...it fits the phone well, and I think would protect it in most circumstances.  Having the case be so slim forces the compromises I discussed above, but for me, the trade-off is worthwhile.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I have to admit, I typically never put anything less than an Otterbox Defender on my phones, but the bulk and weight of that product is annoying over time and I was tired of seeing my wife's Iphone covered in a Spigen case, which barely had any additional profile than the original phone. Therefore, I bought one of these for my Samsung Galaxy S4 and placed the Otterbox, which is still a great product, in a drawer. This Spigen case is designed to reduce the impact of drops and falls, plus protects a majority of the device with a hard case. There is no screen cover, but I was so happy with this case I literally picked up ballistics glass for my screen cover. Now, between this case and the ballistics glass cover, my phone is ready for the everyday grind. If I happen to drop it, I am not going to panic.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: [[ UPDATED REVIEW - 7/9/2013 ]]Well, 9 months later, this case too broke like that of the Neo Hybrid.  The fault this time is the molding around the volume button.  Normal wear and tear caused it to break off.  At the same time, the "rubber" has become more malleable and soft and has started to tear.  The natural action of putting it in your pants pocket over time has cased the entire rubber to flex easily and cause the entire case to pop off the phone.  Nearly every time I put the phone in my pocket, the case pops off even with the simplest action of sitting down.Sorry Spigen, 1st time, shame on you.  2nd time, shame on me.  Never again will I buy/recommend Spigen cases.  Not worth their price if they break on you within months.[[ ORIGINAL REVIEW - 10/13/2013 ]]Coming from aSpigen SGP SGP10215 Neo Hybrid Case for Samsung Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slatecase, I decided to give Spigen one last try with this one. Originally when I bought my Galaxy S4, I initially wanted this case but changed to the Neo Hybrid at the last minute. Since the Slim Armor is actually cheaper, I wish I would have gotten this one instead.You see, the problem with the Neo Hybrid is that the outer frame is fragile. The area USB port is just held together by to small 1 centimeter pieces of plastic. These can and will break over time, basically rendering your case worthless. Why do you think that Spigen sells these frames as a standalone accessory?? It's not to give you the option of changing the appearance, it's to make you blow more money on the frames because THEY BREAK!Secondly, the area around the USB port is too small and therefore requiring you to cut the molding around your USB cables if you have standard computer-style USB cables (which are the majority of what I have).This case seems a LOT better than the Neo Hybrid. The rubber molding is snug and fits around the Galaxy S4 super tight.  The openings to all the ports are big enough to where your USB cables/headphones don't need any kind of modifications like that of the Neo Hybrid. The volume and power buttons are nice and defined (unlike the Neo Hybrid).My *only* complaint thus far is that the case itself is slick... SUPER slick. Unlike that of the Neo Hybrid where the majority of the surface was the rubber, you don't have as much of a grip as this one. So be careful!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I usually don't buy cases for my cell phones, as I like to take full advantage of how slim new smartphones are.  For some reason, however, I have had a problem with dropping my S4, so I decided to look into a case.This case is easy to put on the phone, yet it also grips it well, with no danger of falling out.  The volume and sleep buttons are easy to press, probably easier than without the case, yet I don't have a problem with accidentally pressing them either.  The case also provides enough buffer that the lens to the camera no longer rests directly on whatever surface you lay your phone on.  It is a slim case, so it doesn't add much bulk or weight to the phone.  I also like that the case material is slippery enough so that it slides in and out of my jeans pocket easily, but is still easy to grip.Finally, and most importantly, not only am I dropping my phone less often with this case, but it has protected my phone perfectly when I have dropped it.  I've never owned one of those enormous armored cases, but I feel confident that this case provides excellent protection to my phone without looking or feeling like I've placed it inside a tank.One note to be aware of - the charging cable that comes with the S4 fits quite well into the micro usb port through the case, but I purchased an amazon basics charging cable that I have to jiggle to get through the case to the charging port.  However, I blame this on the amazon cable rather than the case.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: Although I originally loved this case after going through 3 cases for all the same problem I have given up.  Customer service responded quickly asked for information and I haven't heard from them since.  The plastic part that holds the case together breaks very easily.  The white case seemed to hold up the best.  At first I thought it was me but not after the last one I bought didn't last a month before it broke and I was treating it gently.  They seemed to get cheaper even the black matte case has a very thin film that was peeling which didn't happen with the previous case.The case does protect your phone if it drops if it you can live with a broken flap then this is the case for you.

reviewText: I had used an Otterbox Defender before this case. I was tired of the bulk of the Otterbox, plus I wanted a case I could remove more easily. I also wanted something more attractive. I didn't like any of the non-black options available for the Otterbox, so I went with this in red.I really like how this case looks. As others have noted, it fits around the front, but just enough so that you can put the phone face-down. I feel like it is on securely even though the overlap is barely 1/8". I feel pretty secure about dropping my phone in this case too. I don't feel quite as secure as I did with the double-layered Otterbox Defender, but I still feel like the phone is protected.This is good because for the first 2 weeks I constantly felt like I was about to drop my phone. The S4 is a big device and I don't have particularly large hands, so this creates a problem for me. I liked being able to slide my hand up the back of the Otterbox and feel the friction as it rested on my fingers. This case feels like it is going to jump out of my hand, so I've had to change my habits a little bit. The shiny coating on the back looks great, but it is definitely slippery.Nevertheless, I like how this case provides slim protection for my phone and I am willing to deal with the slick back. The front is not as slippery, so I put the phone face-down in the passenger seat while I drive. This keeps it from sliding around every time I turn.One other small complaint is that I really have to push hard to get the power button to work. I noticed that there is just an indentation where the power button goes, but the volume buttons seem to have a little extra rubber to push on them. This is a very minor complaint compared to the lack of friction. Nevertheless, I really like this case and plan to use it for a long time.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: It's a really great color i got the metal slate version and it looks great only adding a little bit of weight to the phone but it should protect it from most accidental falls unless it falls face first.

title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: i'm really enjoying my new case from Spigen.  I've owned "kick-stand" cases for all my Galaxy phones thus far, but was sick of the bulkiness, the poor quality build (on what seemed to be every case I got) of the kick stand(s), and (most recently) the inability to easily remove the phone from my jean pockets (because of the rubberization).  So I decided to "un-frustrate" my life and get a simple case.  Came across the Spigen through a 3rd Party review site, and besides the Ottorbox cases, had some of the best reviews out there.  So after seeing how sexy my phone would look in one of these bad boys, I picked one up.The case is very sleek... almost as if they wanted to maintain the original design of the phones outer body even with the case on.  The back is a very smooth hard plastic, but IS bendable to be able to put the case on the phone.  The corners are rubberized, and have saved my phone a number of times thus far. It's a very sturdy case overall, if you're looking to protect from your everyday drops and bangs. Don't recommend any extreme testing of this case, but for the average phone user this thing gets the job done.  The case DOES have a slight raised lip around the screen to protect from face-down drops, but it's not very substantial (which is one of my issues with the case).  It does indeed do the job, as I found out the hard way, but if it were anything but a lower-velocity direct-downward drop, I'm not extremely confident that the lip would do the job.  Another issue I have with the case is the way this lip snaps onto the phone. With an S4, to make sure the case is on properly, you should NOT be able to see ANY of the metal ring that's around the phone's screen edge.  Sometimes, when putting the case on, the case's lip gets caught under this metal edge and does not  completely secure the case onto the phone.  It's solver with a little picking with your fingernail, but its a bit annoying.Besides those two very minor issues, I really love the case and recommend it to anyone looking for a good looking and overall sturdily built case.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I got the black S-view flip cover. I like that there is a flap that snaps the cover closed, but on the other hand, it requires both hands to pry the cover open so that I can get to my phone. I've only had it for a couple of days, so the hinge has not been a problem so far. I like that the hinge and the snap for the cover are the same size so that the phone lies level when you set it down with the cover folded back under the phone. I do have a problem with the matte finish on the black flip cover, because it shows every finger print and grease smear. As I said, I've only had it for a couple of days and it looks pretty nasty already. I wish I had been able to get the glossy white one, but it was sold out when I went to order it, so had to settle for the black. It is good at protecting the phone and covers all sides and corners of the phone, but some of the negatives mentioned above keeps me from being able to recommend it to others.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: If you're looking for flashy or "blingy", this is not for you... If you're looking for a nice clean sleek design, it's very nice and fits like a glove with adding virtually no bulk to the phone.

reviewText: Read the reviews and was hoping for a great case...  Plastic outer shell feels flimsy and is VERY slippery when holding.  Also, doesn't sit perfectly on the inner rubber shell. reviewText: Great fit and finish.  Overall, it would be perfect- if you never swapped batteries.  The plastic near the volume and power has cracked.  I can only assume that this is due to repeated stress when swapping batteries.  If you never swap out batteries, this is likely a great case.  If you do swap batteries, I think you'll likely find that the hard case will crack like mine has. I've had mine for a couple months.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: Spigen has won my heart, these cases are awesome! they fit the S4 very well, give you much better grip than the phone itself, and doesn't add much size to the phone at all. the only con against these is that they do collect fingerprints on the hard, plastic part. those are easily removed with a quick shirt wipe, and I will easily put up with that for the protection that this case provides. I don't drop my phone much, maybe once every few weeks, but this should be sufficient to protect my S4 when those do happen.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I was initially torn between the Neo Hybrid and slim armor cases. I decided to go with the Neo Hybrid initially. The case is nice but the frame is very fragile. I also had to buy new usb charging cables and headphones because most are not compatible with the Neo Hybrid case. After only a month, the frame broke. However, Spigen's customer service gave me a refund. After trying out a few other cases, I decided to give Spigen another try, and I am so glad I did! I absolutely love the Slim Armor case - it is by far my favorite. It is tight fitting and offers great protection without adding bulk to the phone. The only minor drawback is the fact that the back collects a lot of fingerprints. Other than that, I would most definitely recommend this case!! I wish I had bought this case initially because I would have saved myself the money and aggravation that came from having to order all new accessories with the Neo Hybrid.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I absolutely love the black and white Stormtrooper look, but I hate how slippery the white poly carbonate piece is. Great fit and finish though, buttons and cut outs all match perfectly. Most of my Micro-USB cables (Asus Nexus, HTC oval, and Monoprice Slim) push up on the TPU where the cable plugs into the phone, the only one that fits perfectly is the standard Samsung cable that came with the phone.To be honest I really don't like any kind of cases on my phones, but I'm giving this one to my son, who's quite adept at breaking any kind of device (especially ones I care about.) I feel this case will give the phone a fighting chance. That said, this case does makes the phone feel quite a bit bulkier and heavier, but overall it's not too bad considering it should do a decent job absorbing the occasional drop.

reviewText: This case is very slim and looks good. The only thing I wished is that they would have made a Tough Armor model. The Tough Armor is very slim too but it has a little more of a lip to protect the screen from touching on flat surfaces. Because it has more of a lip you can install a tempered glass screen protector without it being level or over the case. The other thing I would have liked is matt colors instead of just glossy ones. This Steel Blue color is the closest thing to a matt color as you can get. All the others are glossy, fingerprint magnets and are a bit slippery. I hope Spigen decides to make some matt colors for this or at least a matt black. With this being said, the case itself fits very well and all the buttons and holes match up perfectly. This is still a very good product, I just feel with some minor modifications this can be a great one.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This is by far the best phone case ive ever owned! This case does NOT abstruct the camera lens on the Galaxy S4 my photos are perfect!Its designed beautifully and is very slim but still it offers strong protection. It is the only case I trust to my new samsung galaxy s4.  Smartphones are an investment and need to be protected accordingly. This slim armor case by spigen offers double protection by offering two layers of protection . first layer is a rubber that goes around the whole device including bumpers of the phone and this helps absorb shock.second layer is a beautiful  plastic that gives the case strength. The plastic is cut leaving the rubber bumpers exposed so if the device is dropped it will land on the thick rubber and absorb the shock of impact. If your spending 600 dollars on a smartphone dont trust your device to just any case. This case really offers everything. Its sleek slim design will not give extra bulk yet its strong and perfectly made to absorb impacts if you drop your device. I did drop my new device on cement and it simply bounced off the thick rubber bumper absorbing the impact to my device and my device was just fine and it hit hard on the corner . thanks to my slim armor by spigen I was fully protected. This is not your regular phone case. It was designed to fully protect your device. It looks wonderful and does not give extra bulk. I love this product so much I bought one for my husbands device. He also loves the slim armor case.its the only case he chooses to use now too. Im very impressed with this product and HIGHLY recommend the slim armor. This case will not disappoint!  It feels great in the hand and looks beautiful yet it offers full protection for your device. This is a must have product! Simply awesome! Slim armor by spigen is all I trust my device to . Ten Stars spigen! Great product
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I really like this case for my S4. reviewText: I got this case for looks as I'm not clumsy with anything I own. Blue is my favorite color so when I saw the dodger blue I had to get it. I like the case a lot except for the one MAJOR problem.....it is a fingerprint magnet to say the least. Never in my life have I owned a phone case that needs to be wiped with a soft cloth after handing it every time just so it looks decent. I also have never owned anything where fingerprints stick to it so much. Sometimes just wiping it they wouldn't even go away, I had to put a tad of water on the soft cloth. Also it scratches so easily. It was just more of a nuisance  than anything so I contacted Spigen and I'm sending it back for a refund! I really wish Spigen would improve the plastic shell for the slim armor cases! If you don't mind your case looking like crap with fingerprints everywhere or having to wipe the case with a soft cloth constantly then you'll love it!

title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: You know how your phone is thin, lightweight and beautiful? So is the Slim Armor protective case from Spigen. I had thought about getting the folio case, but had read reviews that complained about the front cover being in the way when you want to use the camera. And I thought, why would I need to cover this screen? It's made of Gorilla Glass 3, super tough stuff. The folio case doesn't protect your phone from drops, so what's so great about it? How about the Otterbox? It's similar to this case but more rugged, and better built to withstand impact. It also has those wonderful port covers built in to keep out dust. Well, I have the Otterbox and, while it's all those things, it's also heavy and bulky. Remember the first line in this review? Thin ... lightweight ... beautiful? These are all things the Otterbox is not. Enter the Slim Armor. Barely larger than the phone, this case is ideal. It's lightweight and as elegant as the phone itself. The front edges extend just beyond the edges of the phone, adding just enough lift to keep your screen from touching a table top. This also makes it easier to swipe side to side without your finger stopping against the case's edge (which happens with the Otterbox). On the back, your camera lens is thankfully recessed so it's protected when you lay the phone on its back. The two-piece design fits together beautifully. The case is easy to slip on or off the phone, should you need to. I've had three other cases for this phone. When you have the best of the best phones, you want the case to be best of the best, too. After hours and days of shopping dozens of cases, I can confidently say the Spigen Slim Armor is everything a GS4 case should be.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I challenge you to find a better case on the market for the Galaxy s4. I bought this and paired it with SPIGEN's Glass t.SLIM screen protector... PERFECT COMBINATION! Total phone protection against pretty much anything except water! Spend the money on a quality product and be happy with the results. The combination of the two products has saved my phone on many occasions!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This really is a nice case. It doesn't add very much bulk, but provides enough protection from occasional drops. I bought the white one and it does get fingerprints. It's pretty glossy but it doesn't bother me. I just like the form factor. I have several other cases (UAG, SGP Smart View, Samsung protective cover) and I'm usually coming back to this one. It just looks good on the phone and it's not bulky. The buttons could have a better tactile feel, but I've gotten used to it. There's a very slight lip around the front that should protect the screen. I have a tempered glass protector that's on it's way which will probably reduce the lip to nothing. If you have a plastic screen protector or no protector then the lip should suffice. I'll probably buy some different back covers to switch things up.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This case looks great on my white S4 and fits snug.  It offers protection for the screen when placed upside down, which isn't something I normally do, but this is important to know for some. The case is slick so be careful when resting it on a couch, table, etc...it slides easily.  I ordered this case and an Otterbox to compare, figuring that I would return one of them but I have decided to keep both cases because I couldn't decide between the two.  This is a great case.  It fits good in your hand, it doesn't increase the size of the phone, allowing it to still fit in your pocket.  I highly recommend this case.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: there weren't any reviews for the VIEW version of the case, but I went ahead and bought it anyways. A little pricey at $50, but I gave it a shot, and I'm pretty impressed.The case fits nicely with both cameras and the rear flash, no issues with those. However, the rear camera is slightly obstructed when you fold the front cover all the way back, which is sorta inconvenient. But it wouldn't look great to take a picture through the viewing window anyways!Speaking of the viewing window, it is see-through plastic. The product description wasn't very clear about this part. Not only is it see through plastic so the phone isn't exposed there, but they also provide a screen protector for this part of the case! With that little screen protector, and a full one I bought for the whole phone screen, I'm still able to answer calls through that window like you're supposed to (although it might be a little less responsive with all the screen protectors, it works).The front cover has a nice cover thing for the home button on the front, that both protects the button and responds nicely to presses. The side buttons are also protected, but they are a little less responsive than I'd hope since the black hard plastic around them is pretty hard (good for protection though).The front cover *sorta* clicks into its place when closed, enough that it doesnt fall out of its position but not enough that it's very hard to open. I wish it also stayed in it's fully open position in the same way, but unfortunately it doesnt.The folding cover does lay flat on the back side as promised, and it's pretty good. It gets a bit annoying when texting though, since you're holding it closed with one hand.Protection wise, it does the job!EDIT: I forgot to mention, the case covers the LED on the front of the phone that your notifications would cause to flash. I'ts too bad they didn't leave a small hole for this, but it's not that big of a deal to me.

reviewText: After almost a full year of everyday use even having dropped my phone once or twice.. or 30 times this case is still holding up amazingly. reviewText: This case is so fantastic that I bought two (black and white). I love how it feels in my hand and the buttons are very tactile. There is next to no lip so if you drop your phone face down, there is a good chance you might crack your screen. That said, you can place it face down and the screen won't touch the surface it is on. Any other type of drop should be covered by the case. 2. The downside to the black case is how noticeable the fingerprints are (due to the glossy finish). I try not to let it bother me (I am a little OCD about my things being clean) and it isn't that bad if you don't notice that sort of thing.Also, only buy this case from Spigen. Do not try to get it cheaper elsewhere because odds are you will get a counterfeit. I ordered from another seller and sure enough, my case was not authentic. reviewText: Where to start?? I absolutely love this case. I love the color and the way its so vibrant looking. The feel of the case is ergonomically correct.The rubber part of the case is very hard but still spongy enough to absorb shock. The rubber is so flawlessly cut, I have OCD and the way everything is cut and lined up absolutely perfectly makes it that much better.The case covers just enough of the front of the phone to raise it up to lay face down without the screen touching. However, if the phone falls face down, it offers very little protection.I do like the fact that the very sides of the phone case show the color of the case when looking at the screen. The case really is slim and barely adds any extra bulk to the phone in hand. The case is two pieces which is cool because u can buy the different color backs to change it up.Given the price this was listed for, I thought for sure this was going to be a fake. Sure enough, it came with a verification number and it is a genuine Spigen case. It came in the Spigen hard case with the 3 jelly buttons and the product brochure.The 3 jelly button colors are black, orange, and white. The purpose of these are to help the Home button be readily accessible due to the case creating a mm raise above the phones original Home button.I use a the black jelly button because I have the S4 black mist, and it is cut out perfect as well. I can still see the chrome trim on all sides of the jelly button evenly.The jelly button has a mild stickiness on the back of it. I've removed  this button several times just to see if it left a residue, which it did not, and I noticed the jelly button didnt seem to lose any stickiness and remains in place fine.I should also note that I use a micro cloth (not included unfortunately) very frequently (ocd kickin in) to wipe the smudges from the screen clean without regard for the jelly button and it stays right in place every time. Never has come off in my pocket or cleaning or any other way without me purposely taking it off. (I was surprised)if I have to say one thing I dont like about the case, its that the volume rocker and power button are protected with the hard rubber which makes the feedback hard to feel. Especially on the power button. For me tgis is not a deal breaker.I highly recommend this phone case to anyone.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: If you want a slim and beautiful, yet protective case for your Galaxy S4, this is the case for you.  I'm very picky about the case I want on my phone and read hundreds of reviews on various covers from Spigen, Otterbox, and Incipio.  I first bought an Elago plastic cover because it looked good (an eye-popping red) and was cheap (less that $10).  However, I wanted a more protective case during my daily train commute to work, where a careless bump from another commuter is all it takes to drop my phone.PROS1.  Aesthetics - I got the white Slim Armor to go with my white Galaxy S4.  Simply put, it looks stunning.  The black on the case accentuates the look of the phone overall.  It is thin and seems to add "muscle" to the phone's looks instead of "fat".  I'm considering getting the case in blue as well.2.  Function - I was worried about some of the review stating certain headphones and microUSB cables won't fit.  Thankfully, I did not run into that issue.  I have the Beats By Dre Tour earbuds (which has a flat "head" instead of a pointy one like the OEM earphones) and if they did not work with the case, I would have had to regretfully return the case.  I also use the OEM charger, connected to this dock:Patuoxu Dual Desktop Chargerhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00CMNJ6LM/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_hst_1Even with the case on, it still fits in the dock (you just need to remove the inner adapter on the dock).  Absolutely fantastic design.  Not sure if it will fit other docks but I'm happy it fits on mine.  Also, I've read some reviews about the buttons not functioning properly.  I have not run into that issue; both the volume rocker and power buttons respond quite well when pressed.3.  Protection - The Galaxy S4 is a feather light phone, and for some people (myself included) it might be a bit too light.  The Slim Armor adds just enough weight to make it feel perfect in my hand.  The top and bottom of the case are rubberized, providing some shock protection.  The TPU "liner" I hazard to guess (I haven't dropped my phone with the case on yet) should provide more protection from drops than a simple plastic case.CONS1.  Lip - As others have pointed out, the "lip" on the front screen is minimal, virtually not existent.  I personally don't mind this (a thick "lip" would seem to make the screen more difficult to use) but it might be an issue for others.  I had a Belkin cover on my iPhone 4S and the lip was at least three times bigger, if not more.  I would have preferred the lip on the Spigen case to be a little bigger (1 or 2 mm) but its better that they erred on the side of too little rather than too much.2.  Fingerprints - It has a glossy finish, which makes it a fingerprint magnet.  I have to wipe my phone multiple times a day with a micro fiber cloth because of the screen, so it isn't that much of a hassle to have to swipe the case clean as well.3.  Price - As good as this case is, I think the pricing is a bit steep.  I'd like to see it go for $20 but even if it is at the higher end of my price expectation, it's still well worth it.  FYI, I know at the time I purchased it that there was a sale from another company (with Amazon as the distributor) but I saw some bad reviews and didn't want to worry about a fake.Overall, this case is fantastic.  It's not the thinnest case, nor the most protective but rather a perfect hybrid.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This is a wonderful simple bumper case. Very happy with the quality, fit and finish. Love the 2-piece design with the inner rubber and the outer hard shell. Buttons are easy to operate and everything works just fine. Highly recommend.

reviewText: I love this case. It's sturdy. Which is wonderful for a girl like me who drops her phone, oh, ten times a day or so..
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: ...and this Slim Armor case cushioned it like a baby. And thank goodness, I paid $600 out the pocket for this phone. When I say I researched the hell out of smart phone cases (namely OtterBox and Spigen), I'm not joking. I'm a girly girl type of woman, but I'm not at all big on colorful, bulky cases. I love the thin, sleek design of my S4 so I wanted a case that would protect my investment, yet would be slim enough to conform to the original design of my phone. I love the toughness of the OtterBox products, but they are way too bulky for my taste; the thought of holding a brick to my ear was not appealing at all. The Spigen Slim Armor seemed the most obvious choice. It comes in different, rather bright colors, but naturally, I chose the unassuming black color. The edges of the case are rubberized to protect it from bumps and drops and it absorbs shocks from those bumps and drops. It comes with dual protection because it has a rubberized inner case; the outer case (the part that comes in various colors) is a hard plastic (polycarbonate shell).I would say the only downside is that the lip ( and various edges) of the case juuuust covers the edge of the phone. I wish it covered a little more, but I guess that's where a screen protector comes in to play.This is an excellent product. Read the reviews...well over 1,000 of them and almost 5 stars. And it's CHEAP.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: Great Case. I had a Otterbox when I had the S3 which was extremely bulky. This case fits my S4 perfectly. Not bulky at all and snaps right in. Ive never dropped it but seems like it would protect it pretty good. No complaints about it at all.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: This is a great case.  it really is.  but although, its extremely small for being an otterbox replacement, its still too big for me.  Its just too bulky to handle and although I like the thought of the case actually snapping shut, it is too difficult to open.  When its shut, I do feel like i could toss the phone out my car window and it would still be fine, but thats not the case I'm looking for...  So know that it is small for cases that FULLY protect your phone, but its still a good bit more bulky than other cases..My only real gripes are:1)  The hinges on the phone continually dig into my hands when holding it..  I wish they were shielded better or something..  They are sort of sharp.  this got annoying.2)  The case is too hard to open - already mentioned this..3)  I think the hinges cause some of this, but I wish the case were a little more aerodynamic, or pocket-dyanmic rather..  It doesn't slide in and out of your pocket very well..  I had the matte black finish.  Maybe the gloss finished ones are a little better..
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I read all the great reviews and decided to try one of these. The case was a nice color of red (which is hard to find), but when I received it I realized that the color was painted on rather than the color of the actual plastic. This might work for some people, but I know it would get scratched up no matter how much I tried to take care of it. The color underneath is white, so if you like white scratches on your red case, maybe this is the one for you.It was also very very difficult to get to fit correctly on the phone. No matter what I did there was always a sliver of the silver bezel showing somewhere around the screen. Sometimes way more than a sliver. As someone who takes the case off fairly regularly, this just wasn't going to work. Ugh.

reviewText: This case looks terrific on my S4, the bright red back matches the color's of my workplace and the fit and finish are excellent. Many of my coworkers ask about this case when I pull it out. This is a two piece case that is made so well there is hardly a feelable line between the red hard case and the black tpc along the top and bottom which is remarkable. The only minor drawback is that my very old cassette adaptor's cord in my car is a little to fat to fit into the headphone port, but all my other headphones and headsets work fine.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I was given this by my brother.  The construction is of good material and workmanship. My S4 fit snugly inside.  The only complaint I have is that although it's not as slippery as just holding the bare phone without any case, it's still more slippery than I expected from this kind of good material and workmanship. Be careful because your phone can still slip out of your hand.  Also, I wish it had a kickstand.  Other than that, the design is really professional.  1 dropped star due to slight slipperiness.UPDATED:I have the following cases:1) Spigen Galaxy S4 Slim Armor2) Beyond Cell Tri-Shield Hybrid Hard Shell/Silicone Case with kickstand3) OMIU(TM) Protective Frost TPU Skin Case Cover with Kickstand for Samsung Galaxy S4Pros and Cons as below.1) Spigen Galaxy S4 Slim ArmorPROS:-Not as slippery as the other two.  When I first got this (because I got this one first before receiving the others), I thought it was a little slippery.  But after trying the other two, I have NO COMPLAINTS about slipperiness!!  Dropping to 1 star due to lack of kickstand.-Smaller form than the Beyond Cell one, but slightly larger than the OMIU one.-Extremely good materials.  Feels like it's expensive material.CONS:-No kickstand (I sent the manufacturer an email about it.... let's see if they introduce a kickstand or not).-Because it isn't rubber or silicone, fear tells me it may not protect the phone as well as the Beyond Cell one.  But, I haven't done any drop testings yet.  And, I have insurance through Verizon so I can replace the phone for $100 if I break it by accident so this is a moot point.2) Beyond Cell Tri-Shield Hybrid Hard Shell/Silicone Case with kickstandPROS:-Has a decent kickstand.-Thick and feels like it might protect the phone if dropped.CONS:-Feels slippery.  As a test side by side with the Spigen, the Beyond Cell one slipped out of my hands.-Bulky and larger-Hard to take this thing off the phone.  I had to undo pretty much all the connections.3) OMIU(TM) Protective Frost TPU Skin Case Cover with Kickstand for Samsung Galaxy S4PROS:-Has a kickstand (but a very cheap kickstand that won't last very long in my opinion)-Small form, even smaller than the Spigen.CONS:-Materials seem really cheap.-Slippery than the Spigen.  This one also fell out of my hands before the Spigen one did.-Hard for me to plug the USB charger cord in.  This thing blocks it slightly so I have to push the cord slightly harder in.  I feel it might break my USB port.  Also, when transferring files from my phone to computer, because of the nature of the USB port blockage, I've had the stupid USB connection disconnect once, in the middle of file transfer!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Dodger Blue (SGP10205)

reviewText: I found this case to be of utmost quality in construction and materials. It fits the phone like a glove and feels like a polished product with appealing lines and a comfortable (if slippery) feel in the hand. My only complaint is that the hard-plastic back, which has a glossy finish, gets greasy and covered in fingerprints over time, so I almost compulsively have to wipe off the back. If it were a textured back, I probably would have given this case five stars. Still, I highly preferred this case to the Spigen Neo Hybrid--I think this is the superior case by far and it's amazing how much protection they've fit into such a thin shell. However, I  ultimately preferred the UAG Composite case for its textured back.

reviewText: I purchased three of these cases as they are an excellent value, have a low-profile, provide excellent protection to the phone, and are easy to put on/take off my phone. I take off/put on the case on my phone multiple times each day as I charge my batteries in an external charger. My first case lasted about 10 months before the hard plastic shell around the two volume buttons on the left side of the case first cracked, then broke due to stress over time. I recommend that you insert/remove the phone with care given to the area around the two buttons on the left side of the case as this is the weak point of this case's design. Overall, this is an excellent case, but I wish the plastic around the buttons was stronger.

reviewText: This case is super-sleek; very thin, form-fitting.  The back is soft-touch, it doesn't feel like it'll fly out of your hand at all times.  The case has a bit of a lip on the front, meaning if you place the phone face-down, you won't scratch the display...the aluminum buttons on the side are perfect; they feel like they're a part of the phone.Something to look out for with this case...it's not very protective.  The case is a combination of TPU-like material and polycarbonate.  Unlike the Slim Armor cases, which have a polycarbonate insert, the "shell" here is essentially the "bumper" around the perimeter of the case.  It's very sleek; but it won't protect the phone from anything other than a short drop or light bumps; if you're looking for a rugged case, definitely look elsewhere.  The other thing to watch for is the cutouts for the charging port and headphone jack are fairly deep and small; anything other than fairly slim plugs will NOT fit using this case.  A headphone extention might work; but anything but slim-profile USB plugs won't fit.

reviewText: I really love the way this case looks. In my opinion it is the best looking case. Its also very slim. I do find this case on the slippery side. It also adds some width and height to the phone. The power and volume buttons are easy to press and easy to find. The micro usb port cannot be used with any charger. title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Ingenuity means: The quality of being clever, original, and inventive. Some of the issues that others have complained about are true, the charge port cut-out will only accept the genuine Samsung USB plug. That's fine for me because it makes the case look that more stream lined anyways, and makes the case hidden in plain sight since most who see it think the case is the phone only. Plus OEM USB cords are a dime a dozen on here and eBay. As far as the issue of the bumper coming off and getting loose after awhile, that is where it took some cleverness to fix it. I just used some plain ole plumbers glue. You can get it at pretty much any hardware store. You have to use a thin, kinda firm, plastic bristle brush like the kind for art painting, and be careful not to put it on too thick or too close to the openings- yet as much as you can cover the outside of the insert with. Just be careful not to let it get on the outside of the bumper or back of the case. Take your time. The plumbers glue I used is called "Weld On" 773-ABS is the item number, but I suspect any PGlue made for plastic pipe welding will do the trick. It does exactly as the name implies in about 7-12 minutes, It "welds" the bumper to the case making it one solid case that still goes on easily. Other glues crack off or separate like super glue for instance, but since this dries like hard bonding plastic and is used to seal plastic water drain pipes making them water proof, it fits the bill on the bonding side perfectly. Pros: Bumper trim no longer gets loose and is less prone to come off in your pockets. Cons: you can't switch out the bumper if you have several colored ones and want to switch it up. So each colored bumper has to have its own insert. Moot point if you only have one of course. I really like this case because it makes my S4 look really classy and doesn't make it look cheap like some cases can, and is perfect for light protection. It doesn't really add any bulk to the phone, and it feels great in your hand. Personally I think the case should have been one piece anyways, thank goodness for plumbers glue!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The Spiegen Neo Hybrid case is sleek, beautiful and fits the Samsung Galaxy S4 perfectly giving it the look of the iPhone. It has however, two significant flaws that may persuade some to buy a different case entirely. The first major drawback is the size of the cutouts for headphone and mini USB connection to charge the phone. The second major drawback is the fact that the case is so flat, when you lie the phone down on any surface, screen up, the speaker is almost totally covered rendering the ring tone almost inaudible. There are various work-arounds that users such as myself have adopted to cope with these short comings which I will elucidate in this review.First, I never place the phone on a flat surface because when I do, I can't hear the phone ring. Spigen could "fix" this problem by adding two small "bumps" on the rear of the case which would elevate the speaker about a millimeter off of hard surfaces allowing the audio from the phone to be better heard. I have made a habit of putting the phone down so that part of it is elevated allowing the audio from the speaker to be heard. Imagine how it would sound if you placed your thumb squarely over the small speaker on the back of any phone . . . try it and see if you can hear it ring - now you know how it will sound when you put in in a Spigen case on a flat surface.The other problem - which is major, the cutouts being too small limiting usage of headphones and chargers has several work-arounds which I will share.The cutouts for both headphone and Mini USB are just a tad too small to accommodate most chargers and headphones. The home charger that comes with the phone fits great however, it has been a struggle to find a car charger that fits AND charges as fast and efficiently as the home charger. Even theSamsung  Standard Car Power Charger [CAD300UBEB/STD] OEM Samsung car charger didn't fit the cut-out and with only 750mA output, is just too weak when compared to the 2A (2000mA) output of the home charger.Some have suggested enlarging the holes in the Spigen case using a file or a drill however, this is the wrong path to take, in my opinion. The band which surrounds the Spigen case which comes in many colors from red and white to silver metallic is gray plastic which is painted, so if you file it or drill it, you will expose the ugly gray plastic just under the paint (see my customer pictures). Another negative consequence of modifying the cut-outs is the possibility of weakening the structural integrity of the case. If you make the holes larger you can weaken the case by making it more likely to crack when dropped right where you enlarged the holes. The better solution is to reduce the size of the plugs you intend to insert into the phone to either charge it or plug in headphones. I have tried many chargers and extension cables that would do just that and have discovered a few that will work with the Spigen case after modification. First off, I searched for a car charger that I could use to charge my Galaxy S4 that had sufficient output to charge it while it was being used in the car and could be plugged into my phone while in the aforementioned Spigen Neo Hybrid case. The answer I discovered is the Anker 2-Port Car Charger with Mini USB cordAnker 18W / 3.6A (2.1A + 1.5A) Car Charger with Built-in Micro USB Cord for Android - The First and Smallest Adapter to Deliver Simultaneous, Full-Speed Charges to iPads and Smartphoneswhich can be easily modified to fit into the Spigen case. If you follow this link and go to my review of the product, I have posted the instructions and several pictures showing how this can be done. The next problem was finding a short extension cable that had a plug small enough to insert into the headphone cutout which would allow me to use any headphone or speaker without difficulty. I bought six products that supposedly had very narrow plugs and unfortunately, every product I purchased had a plug that was just too large to be able to fit into the cutout available in the Spigen case. The headphones that come with the Samsung phone do fit however most others will not. I did discover however that there were two products that I could grind down using a Dremel Tool and/or cut down using an X-Acto knife  that would allow me to customize the plug so that it would easily fit. the two are:Your Cable Store 1 Foot 3.5mm Stereo Headphone Extension CableandStereo Audio Headphone Extension Cable 3.5mm 6in inch.I used a Dremel tool with the grinding wheel attachment at low speed so as not to melt the plastic, to decrease the size of the front portion of one of the plugs and an Exacto knife on the other so that it would fit inside the headphone cut-out of the Spigen case. After grinding/cutting it down to size, I used a coat of JB Weld epoxyB Weld 8265S Weld Compound - Epoxy Twin Packto smooth it out and add some additional strength to the plug and then used flat black paint so it matched the rest of the plug. I shall post some pictures above so you can see how the finished product looks both in and out of the case. With these modifications, I can use any headphone and the Anker 2-Port Car charger with modified plug works great when I need to recharge the phone in the car.Some people have said that they had no problem with the size of the cut-outs but I have trouble believing that unless they only used the stock headphones and the home charger. I purchased six car chargers including the OEM Samsung unit, all with smallish plugs and none of them fit into the micro USB cut-out of the Spigen case. Then finding a charger that actually charged the 2600mAH battery of the Galaxy S4 is yet another story. I loved the case so much that I went out of my way to make it work, I hope my suggestions are helpful to others.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I switched to this case from an s-view flip case and I'm very pleased. As another reviewer has mentioned previously, the slot for the micro usb port doesn't allow all chargers to fit. I sometimes use left over chargers from my BlackBerry, so it's a little thicker and requires the case being removed to charge at night, but I'm sure an inexpensive oem charger specifically for my s4 will work, but just be aware.Update 9/12: After asking a question specifically about whether anyone had found a non Samsung charger that would fit. Was advised to use a utility knife and cut the end of the plug 1/8" and it actually worked. Be careful not to cut too far back or you may disconnect the plug inners. Totally solved my problem, it all fits!
