reviewText: Great phone case all around. Slim and durable. Very tough and looks stylish. I like this case better than my otter box.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is a very slim case for the S4. It provides minimal protection. (If you're expecting ott3rb0x type protection this is NOT that.)  Overall, it is a slim/form fitting case. It doesn't add much in terms of weight or bulk AT all. I treat my electronics better than a newborn so I don't need phone armor. : )  But if you are rough on your devices, I would suggest looking at more robust cases.  Overall I do like this item very much but I do have ONE major wish.  The color bands (bumper like part) should be sold separately.  So you can change colors or replace a cracked damaged one at a reduced cost. That would be my only gripe with this item.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The case is quite bulky and feels cheap. Also, it was messing with the touch sensors on my screen and getting commands automatically even if i was not pressing anything. Had to remove it and get a different one.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Two ugly Bubbles  in the back after less than 3 months very disappointed for 30 bucks I paid for them :(
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: [May 17, 2013]  White on White never looked so good.  Laser Precision design.  Fits perfectly.  I love the colorful sticky home buttons that came with it.  Good quality and drop protection.The packaging that the case comes in is premium quality too, so right away I knew I was getting a precise quality product.  You wont be disappointing, I waited for 3 weeks while this case was on back order, it was worth the back order wait, and it's definitely worth the $29.Not every USB charger will work with the case; but at least the original Samsung USB cable charger fits perfectly.  I just figured out i can use this case with a belt clip holster I bought a few weeks ago and it fits well--coincidence.  Here is the holster info:Maxboost Shell Holster Combo Protective Case for Samsung Galaxy S4 SIV with Kick-Stand Belt Clip Holster - Fits Any Version for Galaxy S4 S 4 SIV S IV includes Models for AT&T;, Verizon, Sprint, T-Mobile, International UnlockedSPIGEN need to sell the plastic caps separately maybe half off.Someone gave this a bad review something about "paint" coming off the casing?  What?There is no paint on these cases for it to come off in the first place!!  I think they reviewed the wrong product, i'm glad I didn't listen to them.[July 28, 2013] Update!!!  So, about a couple of weeks ago I began noticing that paint IS coming off the plastic shell.  I was wrong; I didn't know this actually has a layer of paint on it as someone commented earlier.  Luckily my white doesn't look too bad mainly because I have the white case (white paint over white plastic).  Also the thin piece of plastic (where you'd put the USB cable) is now broken.  With such a fragile outer plastic shell I can't imagine why this case doesn't come with an extra plastic shell, or at least the option to purchase them--after all it's a great idea that could add the diversity of color selection. I'm thinking of just gluing the darn plastic shell to the rubber casing--heck, why not.  I still love this case; but, after 3 months I can't say this is a top notch quality product.  I'm down grading to a generous 4 stars.[Update July 28, 2013]: I just notice now we have the option to purchase the shells.  They're priced at ~ $11; at this late in the game and due to the inevitable paint chipping and thin plastic piece breaking this price is just too high.  It should be for $3 to $5, more people would then buy multiple shells and Spigen would get more sales while restoring their reputation.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The product was not of my liking. I was looking for a case with metal outlining it, like in the description name, but when i received it, it was all plastic, no metal at all (or aluminum). I did not think it was worth the money i spent on it.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The case itself is solid. Makes the phone easy to grip as well as gives you a nice flat back. Feels very similar to a large Iphone5. I also like the lip around the case that prevents you from accidentally hitting the touch sensitive buttons towards the bottom of your phone. My gripes with the case would be the headphone jack hole is pretty tiny as others have mentioned, as well as if you use this case, you won't be able to use a dock or even some 3rd party chargers/connectors.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I have to give Spigen another 5 Stars!!Best phone case I have found to date.It's sleek, gives good phone protection. Has a good grip to it, won't have to worry about it slipping out of your hands.Thanks Again Spigen for the perfect case!!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: It's a very minimal case that adds almost no weight to the phone. In my case, it just wasn't right for me. I felt like it wasn't going to protect the phone as much as I wanted.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: By far the best case for the S4. Feels incredible in the hand and is extremely solid. The button "extenders" on the case makes the power and volume buttons a lot easier to press and gives it a more satisfying click. The jelly button not only looks great, but makes the home button better to press as well! I hear a lot about people having problems with inserting cables but that could be solved very easily by ordering new ones or shaving down old ones. Take a razor blade or a Exacto knife and cut into the rubber surrounding the micro-usb and the problem is solved! Fortunately all of my cables fit perfectly. Hopefully they start to sell the plastic bands separately..
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I really wish I didn't have to return this case.It feels amazing to hold. It looks just as great. The buttons work flawlessly. The build quality and materials used are all top-notch.But here's the kicker: none of my headphones (Sennheiser 598, Audio-Technica ATH-M50, and a pair of cheap Sony earbuds) fit in the headphones port. Also, none of my USB cables (all from Mediabridge, and Amazon Basics) fit because the slot on this case is just big enough to accommodate the OEM Samsung USB cable that comes with the phone, which is very slim.I hope SPIGEN releases an updated version of this case. If they did, I would buy it in a heart beat.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I wanted protection but not the added bulk of many cases. This one completely encases the phone and it fits very well.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This case not only is durable. Rugged. Its stylish and protects the device from spills, mishaps, and the ooops. I have bought one for all our devices. The metal buttons makes the device feel like the original phone. The color makes people go "where did you get that?" The price is even better!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Best case for the Galaxy s4 hands down! just be careful when taking the phone out of the case, due to it's thin design which is awesome because it isn't much bigger than the phone itself, can break if not being careful, I've had mine for a month and it still is beautiful, I get a lot of comments on how beautiful it makes my phone look! buy, you won't be disappointed!

reviewText: I bought this case because I enjoy the style it has and I really like that it's a very slim case. Even people that don't like iphones, do like the way they look... so this is the case for you. Protection wise I cannot speak of because I have not dropped my phone. I guess we will have to see.

reviewText: i purchased this case together with my S4 and since i received this case i have been using it, this is a great protective case and also it looks pretty nice, i like the square shape it have.

reviewText: This case is so cool, it gives good protection and looks awesome at the same time adds very little bulk.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: So I finally received my case after it being delayed. I will be honest and say that I was a tad bit disappointed out of the fact that it took almost a whole week to ship, but I'm glad that I received it regardless. I am re-doing my review now that I finally have it. I also want to thank their customer service rep, named Aaron for keeping me informed on the status of the order, and also for upgrading my shipping to priority.I am really satisfied with the case. I ended up getting the metal slate and it looks really nice on my black galaxy s4. The case feels really sturdy while retaining the shape of the phone. As far as protection goes, I haven't dropped my phone yet, but I do have confidence that the case will withstand drops and keep the phone safe. The back of the case feels really nice also, nice and matte-ish. The case will however, add almost an inch in size to the phone, but will not make it feel bulky, just a tad bigger.Overall very satisfied with this case. What's even better is that I got it for 50% off when I ordered it! Thank you SPIGEN.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: If it was about quality only I would rate this case 5 stars.  I have not had the same problems as others regarding headphone jack.  Spigen either fixed this problem or I have OEM sized headphones.My biggest problem is with Customer Support.  I have attempted to contact Spigen Tech Support twice about this product.  After 4 weeks I have still not received any response.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I received the case not too long ago. Overall the fitment is decent and it stays attached. Two issues I had with the case are:1. The rubber along the back is tough to keep flush with the phone when putting the ring on the outside. This could be due to number two though.2. The case has started to warp. The rubber has distorted after owning it for such a short time.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: one drop and the plastic part just shattered.  I am not happy that I have to now spend 10 bucks on a replacement plastic piece.

reviewerName: Clyde O. Stephens ""Old Fart Ex Tex""
reviewText: My son is very happy with the Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for his new Samsung Galaxy S4.  This is the third case I have bought for this phone and the only one he continues to use.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Love this case! Sleek, comfortable, the black and white contrast with my white S4 is very nice!I love that this case gives my S4 an almost iphone kind of shape.  As much as I don't miss my iphone, I did like the shape of the phone much better than the galaxy.  So this case kinda gives me that back. :)The back has a soft velvety type feel.It's true about the cutouts though - very precise and nothing besides the samsung issued cords and heaphones will fit (which is fine with me because I don't use anything else).  But for people who like to dock or use other non-samsung accessories, you might have an issue.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Right up front I'll tell you that I love Spigen products.  I've owned many of their cases and written glowing reviews of them all.  This case, unfortunately, falls way short of my expectations.The biggest problem is that you can't plug anything into your phone with this case, except the original Samsung micro USB cable and the smallest of headphones.  I don't know about everyone else, but I've been acquiring micro USB chargers for years and they're scattered throughout my house/car/office.  Not being able to use any of them with my S4 while wearing this case is extremely frustrating.  It means I have to carry around my Samsung OEM cable with me everywhere I go.As for the headphones, I use either Shure SE315's or Sennheiser HD280's and with this case, the plug won't fully seat into the phone so I can't get any audio.  Seriously?  So now I have to buy a little pigtail, or use a pair of Apple Earbuds?  I don't think so.And so, I'm returning the case.  Buyers beware!  Many of you won't care about these problems, but some of you will and you'll want to steer clear of this case.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Absolutely love the case. Looks chique and does a great job protecting the phone, despite its thin exterior. I originally purchased this case simply due to the thinness, but it holds up really well. Very pleased.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: though it isnt the best case for protection, it is definitely one for style/looks.looks as good as it does in the pictures.

reviewerName: Custnam "HE Loved Us Enough to Die For Us, Lo...
reviewText: I preordered this about the same time I preordered my Sprint Galaxy S4. It came yesterday and I must say it is AWESOME!! It fits perfect, looks amazing, and actually makes the buttons even easier to press. All the cutouts are perfect, and all the ports/ speakers/ camera holes all line up perfect. It has an iphone look to it, and I mean that in a good way. I got the Infinity White one for my White S4. It covers all the corners, and I have confidence it will hold up if ever dropped. It is actually 2 separate pieces, but they are suppose to stay together. It also comes with 3 different color home button protectors. (White, Black, and Red)I installed a white one over my white home button. It makes an awesome looking phone even better. If your looking for a nice case it is worth every cent. I might just buy another of a different color. I also added some pics to the customer images. Sorry my S4 is my only camera so I had to take pics of the case only.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I really loved this case! I'm SUPER satisfied with my purchase. The only reason that it's not getting 5 stars is because the case can be a tad bit slippery at times. Nonetheless, it's worth it and for a nice price!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Perhaps it was just me, but I expected this case to be 'somewhat' firm. Instead, it's all very flimsy and essentially feels like you're wrapping a large rubberband around the case. The painted aluminum finish part is very cheap feeling and the back is as well since it's like a wind sale type of material that can flop around a little and seems like it'll loosen over time. The overall design isn't too bad and former iPhone fans (or those that like the look of an iPhone in general) will probably like that this makes your phone when placed face down look like a large iPhone. Unfortunately, the shape of the casing and cheap material make for a case that feels awkward to hold in my hands and the way the case wraps around the front at a weird angle gives the front a mismanaged appearance from the rest of the case. Also, as I expected, it doesn't offer any real protection aside from scratches and small bumps. This case is definitely just for style, but for $30 I would have expected higher quality feeling case, such as the Slim Armor also from Spigen.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I have owned a few cases for this the Samsung s4 which is not a particularly good looking phone(in my opinion), for a high end phone it should have a different back cover not made of plastic, but with this case it looks beautiful, I have received many compliments and also many people asking me where did I get this case. The only complaint are the narrow slots for connections, it only let me connect whit the original cable and won’t fit any other charger or desktop charger.

reviewText: Bought this case after viewing YouTube videos of it and i really liked the looks of it. I was looking for a slim case that looks good when on the phone and this case fit the profile. After about a week or so though, i dropped my beloved GS4. Although the phone had zero damage, the case did not fair too well. This case is two separate pieces, one hard plastic and the other rubberized. The plastic cracked with the impact and broke on the bottom, after this, the plastic piece was coming off all the time. Now it was useless for me and i bought a $10 silicone case that is doing me well. Other things i did not like was the opening for the aux port and the charge port. They are too small!! If you are looking for a nice "looking" case that isn't a functional, this is your case
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is the first case I've bought from Spigen and for my Galaxy S4. I actually found out about this case because my friend got one and I thought it looked and felt great!The case somewhat reminds me of an iPhone and I used to be an iPhone fan. The case feels great in your hand. It is incredibly thing which I love, because the phone is big enough to begin with, I don't need it any bigger. reviewText: I liked the look and feel of this case. But the rim broke in my pocket. Just in the course of my normal work (office indoors)day.  I had not dropped the case or anything. With the rim broken the case is useless.What good is the style and feel of a case if it doesn't protect.

reviewText: Arrived ahead of when predicted.  Great presentation.  Followed directions per placement.  Fits tight, holes line up, all is well.  Replaced my white home button with the black included.  Only negative, which required me to buy a Qmadix USB Charging-Data Sync Cable was the hole size for micro-usb on my card charger...The hole in the case does fit the  Samsung charger/cable that came with the Galaxy S4, but I wanted to continue to use my car charger.Light weight, but protected.  Fits in the pocket well now too.A great buy!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I love the case it feel high quality and it looks awesome! I was concerned about it being in two parts at first but once you put on the second part its basically one piece you can remove and replace it as many times and you want with ease. In addition the ability to buy different color rings makes it like a whole new case!I had a problem with my ring and Spigen was quick to get back to me and sent me a replacement amazing product amazing customer support!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This case is very sleek and keeps the flat look and feel of the phone, which I like.  It also has a very premium feel to it.  I would recommend it
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The GS4 is a nice phone, this case makes it much better.  Besides the many rantings of people on the net concerning the ease of breaking this phone, my daughter dropped her GS4 once and it rendered it useless.  In a dimly lit room the screen looked like a fancy light show.This cover provides a lot more protection to this phone than what Samsung sent it out with, and it looks great as well.This cover will also fit on the phone with a Qi back cover - though VERY snugly.  It took a bet of stretching (with my hands only) to get the cover to fit as nicely as it does with the non-Qi cover.The Qi charging is not affected by this cover.All of the Sammy provided gear still fits (usb cable & ear buds) with this cover on. Excellent job Spigen!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: ...but the finish is flaking off.I love this case, probably the best I've owned in terms of protection vs size and form. It fits my GS4 perfectly and looks like it is part of the phone. It provides adequate protection for my phone and I love it. However, a few weeks in and the shiny finish on it, not the color, is flaking off on spots. Not sure if I got a flawed one or if this is something that happens with these.I am still happy with it but am a little bummed about the flaking. 5 star case but I have to give it 3 for the flaking.PS. adding an after market wireless receiver works with no problems with this.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is a great case overall, the lines are clean and the buttons work really well. The design gives the case a premium look and the phone is easily inserted into the case. The exceptions for this phone occur after you have had the case for a while, the most obvious as others have pointed out the cut outs are picky about they size of micro usb and headset jacks that it accepts (i have had to cut some rubber off of the micro usb/headphone plugs. Also the TPU or back black portion of the case tends to warp when the phone heats up at all, the TPU becomes floppy and separated from the phone. I purchased the silver and didn't have any issue with the paint peeling off of the band as others have stated. I have only semi dropped it a handful of times without anything happening to the phone itself. Over it is a nice looking case but has left me wanting to seek out something else without these flaws.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Nice protection soft cover and plastic ring surrounding the soft cover broke near the charger section very thin pieces of  plastic i did glued several times still
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I really love this case. It looks so good and you can change the outside to a different color. So cool
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I was surprised how nice this looked in pictures but not in person.  Before I even opened the case I could tell the edge was separated from the back.  It was not broken, it simply wasn't connected in a sturdy manner and I now get why so many people have this complaint.I went with the UAG case instead and it is so, so awesome.  I would definitely recommend that one instead.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I loved this case for about 2 weeks. It looks good, makes the phone easier to hold, and provides good protection. However, the third time I took it off to put in a spare battery the bottom of the plastic band near the charge port broke. It wasn't abused, dropped, or mishandled, the plastic is just too thin there. It's too bad, becasue I really liked it, but now I feel like I threw my money away.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I really wanted to like this case,Really good looking, somewhat good design, and the buttons are great.I however don't like how flimsy the base black plastic is, I'd say it's comparable to those flimsy silicone cases you can get for pretty much every phone out there.Also, the outer shell is flimsy, and sadly not sturdy enough. The part that wraps around the micro USB port broke. I haven't even had it for 3 weeks and the case is almost unusable. Sad thing is, I'm really delicate with my phone cases too, so this never should have happened..... :/This is my first experience with Spigen cases so I have no idea what their other ones are like, but if you're looking for durability in this case, look elsewhere.I went ahead and got the Urban Armour Gear case for my phone now, and I'm loving it. Had a UAG case on my Galaxy S3 originally and got my brothers hooked on them also. Check them out. Crazy durable, great looking, and a very good value!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Awesome product. Didn't purchase this for myself, but for two of my friends. This product is very sleek, and protective.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Ever since I got this case I always get compliments on my phone, most even say it makes the phone look more expensive and just gives an overall better look. Will definitely be ordering more colors soon.

reviewText: With my S3,  Seidio was my product of choice. But with the S4 Spigen got me. I have the slim armor, slim armor view, and the neo hybrid. And the neo hybrid is my favorite. It's super light weight but still give good protection from drops. The slim armor view gives the best. While the front facing lip is there its thin. The included jelly bean home buttom stickers are a valued bonus.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I bought this case to replace a Spigen Ultra Thin Air, which failed to protect my new S4 from damage when it was accidentally dropped on the pavement, suffering several chips in the glass at the corners of the screen and several bad dings on the bottom edge of the phone. The Air case unfortunately has almost no raised rim, and does not cover the buttons or ports.The Neo Hybrid does much better, having a snap-over rim which firmly locks the rubber casing around the body, and is extremely protective against drops (I have dropped it once, got a ding on the rim corner but phone was safe). I only wish I had bought this case instead of the Ultra Thin Air in the first place. Lesson learned!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This case is very nice, but your paying almost double than what you would for other cases.  I makes the phone slightly wider and taller than the other cases but its no thicker than the thinnest snap on cases.  I also have a Rinke slim and this is equally as thin. I did notice that talking on speaker phone is more difficult as the microphone is now buried inside, but speaking into it with it near your face is fine.  Definitely worth it if you want full protection while maintaining a minimalist look compared to the other cases that turn the phone into a brick.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This my third case from Spigen, love it , well made , good design , saved my GS4 more than once
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Nice case thats way better than an otterbox commuter. I highly recommend this to anyone thats looking for a case with protection but less bulk than the commuter.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I purchased the metal slate color for my Black Mist Galaxy S4 and I'm impressed that the case color is pretty close to the phone (though not exact, but it's hard to tell).The case has a solid feel with all-around direct contact with the phone, and because it's made out of TPU and plastic it slides in and out of pockets really easily. The cut outs for the camera, LED flash and back speaker are cut perfectly, but the cut outs for the headphone port and microUSB port are a little small; the microUSB port just fits around the stock cable and the headphone port won't fit thicker jacks.The front of the case has a slight lip and the phone can be placed face down but NOT IF YOU HAVE SPIGEN'S GLAS.TR. While the case fits perfectly around the rim of the Glas.tR if applied correctly, the Glas.tR for GS4 is almost exactly as thick as the lip of the case leaving you with a single, flat surface.The back of the case is very plain, and could be argued as a little boring. Still, it feels nice to the touch and I have no real complaints. However, if the phone is placed face-up on a flat surface, the back-speaker sounds a little muddled because the back of the caseis almost perfectly flat. Not a real issue though.I have the Glas.tR, Metal Slate Neo Hybrid and Aluminum Home Button Sticker and together, they look fantastic, and give a classy feel to a plasticky phone.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: It is beautiful.It lived with me for a good 9 months until the plastic guard around the edges broke.I'm not exactly hard on my stuff, but the plastic bumper after 9 months broke at the charging port.The color is still very strong, no areas show visible wear even from extended abrasion from the pockets of dickies shorts.Its a great case. If it is ever on sale I will gladly purchase another one but ten dollars is extortion for a plastic bumper.If you are a minimalist deciding whether or not to purchase, it is a good case and if you treat it right, it will last you a long time.[i never dropped this too, so results may vary...]
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I thought the price was high until I realized how much money I keep spending on cheaper cases. No matter what case I try I also end up back with this one. The buttons are really nice, even better then without the case. The case is also very slick and gives the S4 a nice sturdy feel. I only wish they sold the colored strips separately.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Really liked the build quality on this case, i did had a previous Neo Hybrid, but it was bought on the launch and had some issues with the bumper, now this one looks like it's sorted out, and i think it's a great case, with good protection and a slim body
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Design is awesome. Beside, it can protect your GS4 safely.The only thing I am not satisfied with is that it gives a bulk to GS4.People may be confused it as Galaxy note.

reviewText: I would recommend this case! its so slim and fits amazingly. Makes the phone look sleek and elegant. Love it!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The case is nice and fits my phone without the bulk like most other cases. After using it for one month the TPU portion of the case is now loose and does not sit flush on the back of my phone. No big deal, it's still a  nice case and I love the options of being able to purchase different color frames.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I pre-ordered this this case back around the time the Galaxy S4 came out around April/May.  Approximately 5 months later, this case is broken.While the case looks good and very polished, the outer "frame" is the piece at fault.  To keep the case in 1 solid piece, the weak spot is the area around the USB port.  The "frame" is held together by 2 tiny threads of plastic.  Well this past weekend, 1 piece of that tiny thread of plastic broke off.  Not thinking it was a big deal, 3 days later, the other one broke off.  Now the frame is unusable and I just have the "rubber jacket" surrounding my phone.  It's important to note that I have NEVER dropped my Galaxy S4 thus far and it only fits in my pants or jacket pocket.  I've never abused this case.Why do you think that Spigen sells these frames as a standalone accessory?? It's not to give you the option of changing the appearance, it's to make you blow more money on the frames because THEY BREAK!Also to note, since I'm reviewing this case is that as other reviewers have mentioned, the main issue with the case is the area around the USB port.  The plastic frame is too narrow for standard computer USB cables.  The only way to make them fit is to use a knife and shave the cable itself to where it is small enough to fit in the USB port.  I have performed this mod on probably about 8 or 9 USB cables I use around my house, work and car.As I said previously, the case *looks* good but it's not sturdy at all and now I am in the process of looking for another case on Amazon.  Stay away from this one.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Excellent fit and finish for the S4.  Gave it to a friend when I sold the S4 and they are very happy with it.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I have tried several cases before this and this has been the final choice.1. This case perfectly fits the phone, no loose ends and unprotected sides.2. Does not make the phone bulky3. Unlike the other soft cases available in the market, this have an interesting technology where in the soft case is sealed with a bumper that makes the case feel soft and keep the phone well protected.4. Improves the phone grip and style
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is an excellent looking case with very good protection. Several people asked me where I got the case from. The case does not add a lot of weight while still protecting very well.The frame for the case is quite tight and difficult to put on. After taking the cover out and putting it back on few times, the frame broke. The replacement frame is quite expensive at $10 unfortunately.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I usually get a case on a phone just to have a piece of mind knowing that if I do drop it, nothing serious will happen. With the GS4, however, I didn't feel like I needed a case since the phone is all plastic and all of the parts on it are relatively cheap to replace. My main problem with the GS4 was the cheap, slippery feel of the back cover. I wanted a case that would keep my phone thin while improving the general look and feel. This case does just that. The materials used are all premium. The colored bumper is slightly slippery but that is not an issue for me. My biggest concern was the back TPU part of the case. I'm used TPU cases before that have been very grippy. So grippy that they attract all of the dust and lint in my pocket. Luckily, this is not the case with this case (no pun intended). The back has a nice, soft touch feel to it. The cutouts on this case are absolutely perfect. Everything matches up like it should. The headphone cutout is rather small and is designed for straight plugs. I have an L-shaped plug that didn't fit. I ended up trimming some of the plastic off of the plug (not the case!) and viola, it fits perfectly. Those audio plugs have too much plastic on them anyway. In general, I think this is an awesome, sleek, and beautiful case. Get this one!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is a very nice case.  The phone fits in the case securely.  The volume and power buttons touch and response is excellent.  Spigen has gone the extra mile with this case and it shows their dedication to quality and craftsmanship.  I cannot believe how little bulk this case adds to the phone.  It is very slim and easily slides in and out of my pants pocket.  I had previously purchased an Otterbox Commuter case for my phone, but it did not fit well in the case and the volmue and power buttons touch and response was horrible.  I did a lot of research before buying this case and am extremely happy with my purchase.  I had also looked at the Spigen Slim Armor case, but found that the plastic backing on the case did not fit well with the TPU portion of the case.  I very highly recommend the Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for the Samsung Galaxy S4.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This case it's by far the best I've ever bought for any smartphone I've ever owned. Buttons feel as if they were one with the phone, the case just fits perfectly on the phone not allowing any dust to get in it. Really worth every penny.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: GREAT COVER LOOKS SLEEK, I BOUGHT THIS TO MY UNCLE AND HE FEELS THAT HE HAS AN IPHONE, IT PROTECTS THE PHONE FROM SCUFFS AND BUMPS. ALUMINUM HARD EDGES AND POLIPROPILENE INNER PROTECTION, VERY RELIABLE AND DURABLE
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Amazing case. The dimensions thickness wise become identical to an iphone 4 (haven't compared it to a 5, don't know if they're thicker). The only difference there is the edge that sticks out to keep the screen off flat surfaces. Other than that it feels simply amazing, much better than it did with even just the phone. Some people have complained about durability, to them I ask, what in God's name did you do to the rim? I've removed it and put it on about 50 times since buying it several months ago and had no issue. I've dropped my phone from 5 feet onto concrete multiple times and managed to chip/dent it a little, but nothing problematic.Other than improving the feel of the phone, the buttons are AWESOME. They make it SO MUCH easier to press power and volume. If you've used a GS4 without a case, you probably know what I mean, especially if you have big hands like me. Favorite case I've used out of 4.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I like the look of the case on my S4. reviewText: Wow what a great case!!!this thing is so perfect in every way. reviewText: One of the best cases out there but they break easily IF you change batteries on a daily basis. I already broke 3 of them but I'm still happy with them.  So if you don't change batteries like me then these are great!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I ordered this case with the Satin Silver frame, which to me resembles aluminum.  The back of the case is flat, which along with the frame makes it look almost like a large iPhone to me.The TPU shell and plastic frame are first assembled, then the phone is snapped into it.  It's a perfect fit, and all of the openings in the case line up perfectly with those on the phone.The edge of the case around the screen is slightly raised, which gives it some protection when laid face down.The only fitment problem I have encountered is that the opening for the earphone jack may not be large enough to accommodate some brands of earphones due to the width of the frame and structural considerations.  The jack on the Samsung earphones that came with the Galaxy S4 fit perfectly through the opening, but the jacks on the MeElectronics and Sony earphones I have are both slightly too large and will not fit into the opening.  Not a problem for me because I like the Samsung earphones with their three button operation and decent sound.All in all, this is a very attractive, high quality case that I am proud to show to others.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Just love it.This one you should buy.Fits perfectly, and doesn't adds to much weight or size to your S4.I want it in every color available!Thank you

title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I ordered this case or my hubby's Galaxy s4. We both have had Spigen cases before and we always keep coming back to them after trying different ones out. I like the slimness of this case and the material it's made of. Also it's not bulky at all and makes the phone look one sexy piece of equipment. He constantly gets compliments on the case and loves the feel of it. The case allow easy access to all the buttons and ports. Looks good, feels good, no issues. Definitely a good buy.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: It looks and feels great. I heard about non OEM chargers not being able to fit in the slot to charge the phone, but  I have no experience with that issue because i only have the one charger that came with the phone.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I bought this case when it was $29.99.  I bought it because I thought it looked awesome, and for the price, I expected a high quality piece of equipment.  Overall, what I got was a disappointment.In the pictures, the outer edge of the case looks like it's metal.  Metal would be a great idea for the edge of a case because it can absorb and redistribute shock while preventing the phone from twisting or deforming in a way that would cause the glass to break.  I was a bit disappointed to find that it's just plastic.Instead of being a single piece of flawless plastic, the outer edge is made of 4 pieces of plastic that are joined together in such a way that the seams are visible.On the back of the case, the rubber bulges up around the camera and LED.  The rubber is thick enough that this is not done to protect the camera, but rather that the shape of the phone was not taken into consideration when designed.  All the other cases I have, from expensive to cheap, account for the contours and don't bulge out in the back!The power and volume buttons, however, are crisp and feel great to press - I wish the phone's buttons were built like this from the factory.  I think this is not worth the $29.99 I paid for it.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I assure you this is a great sleek case that works well!! It's so sleek, it looks like it's a part of the phone, and doesn't look like a case at all. I just received mine, so it's still new, but so far so good. No problems, and it fully protects my entire phone, and I like that. It even protects the edges, and has a little lip so it doesn't touch the table or any flat surface when it's face down. It's top notch and great quality that I think it will last for a long time. There are even silver buttons that cover your phone's buttons so no part of your phone is exposed except the cut-out openings for the earphones, the charger slot, microphone hole on the top and button, the S beam, camera, and speaker. I haven't used any third party charger, but I will say that I tried using a pair of Sony earphones with the L shape plug and they worked fine. I know some of the complaints were that third party accessories didn't worked because of the sharp cut-outs, but I haven't tried any. Also when putting this case on your phone make sure you put it together first, then onto your phone. Don't put piece by piece onto your phone, watch the video first because you may break it in the long run if you don't put both pieces together first.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I have loved Spigen for a long time and used many of their cases with no problems. this one broke after a few months which was quite surprising since I have never dropped the phone... maybe a quality control issue here because I have not had a problem with my new one I bought from somewhere else.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Case shipped really fast! Fits on very snug and tight. Gives the phone a more sleek feel. Definitely the best case I've bought for my Galaxy S4
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Good product...  Only works with USB cable samsung original.SLIM case good protection screen down.Shock absorb.Interchange bisel5 colours
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Very well made case fits perfectly. Buttons feel great when pressed just like without the case. The only thing I was worried about was my ghost armor around the edges. But the case does not even touch it so there is no peeling issue. Feels great in hand. I do not have to worry when I take out the phone out of my pocket anymore. Just like other reviewers wrote I wish Spigen was selling the plastic pieces alone. But maybe the will start, let's hope so. I have also tried Otterbox Commuter but felt to bulky. Summing up amazing case over all I would recommend it to anyone. Absolute must buy !!!
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Excellent case, it really makes the phone look more chiseled, and I love how it feels when I hold it. I HIGHLY recommend this to all Galaxy S4 owners.

Fits perfect for my S4, the cut out fits perfect everything looks good. I got a lot of compliment on my phone. I highly recommend this phone.

I have several other jacks from other phones and my favorite LED 6ft automatic shut off charger from verizon it did not fit. Disappointing. reviewText: This is a GREAT case.  It fits the Samsung S4 so beautifully.  Makes it looks so great.  So polished.  People look at your phone twice.  From the cosmetic standpoint, this is one of the best cases you can get for the S4.The one downside is that the phone doesn't cushion falls too much.  Its very little protection.The second downside is that when plugging in charger, depending on the charger you are using, you will have to wedge the charger through the case into the slot.  This can be annoying.  As long as you have a  charger that doesn't fight the case, you are good.

reviewText: Not the most protective case out there, but its super thin and makes the phone look really nice. I have dropped my phone a few times from about waist high and the phone is fine. The only problem is the color band around the phone has chipped and you can see white marks on it. So its really noticeable.  If you drop your phone a lot dont get this case, but if you drop it, its better than nothing.

The case itself when you handle your phone or drop it on the table gives comfort to the phone at the impact is dampened by the case itself,  Really great quality. reviewText: The case looks nice, and is snug around the phone.  Headphones did not fit into the phone with the case on, and the camera lens is exposed.  Also, when I take the case off the back of my S4 comes off half the time.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I think this case looks awesome and adds minimal bulk, which is very important to me.  I mean, one of the things that attracted me to the S4 is its sleek look.  Why would I want to cover that up?!My only complaint is that with this case on, I find that the power button is a little too easily pressed.  I carry my phone in the front pocket of my jeans, and have had the phone get accidentally get powered off while in my pocket on a few occasions.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is by far the greatest case on the market for the Galaxy S4.  Solid, perfect fit, fantastic style that looks like part of your phone rather than something you've installed, keeps phone nice and thin while providing full protection front and back, and I also love Spigen as a company.  All of my mini USB cables fit just fine in the USB cutout, the OEM Samsung one as well as many other brands.But it is true, the headphone jack is far too small for probably 95% of the headphones you have.  This is very unfortunate.  And although all of the videos and writeups regarding this case mention the "interchangeable case surrounding", what no one tells you is thats only hypothetically true as Spigen doest sell them separately anywhere.  So what good is the ability to change the outer color if you cant buy other colors to replace them with?  You can only get alternate colors by ordering an entire second case.  They may have as well just sealed and adhered the outside bezel to the inner black, soft case.The overall quality, solidity, fit, almost OEM like appearance and lack of bulk are so perfect though, I find it impossible to give the case less than 4 stars, just be aware that there are a few design flaws on an otherwise beautiful item.  Since I got my GS4, Ive been through about 4 cases so far.  This one is a keeper.  I doubt Ill ever buy another brand again.BUT BEWARE!!:  There are many counterfeit versions of Spigen products on the market.  I got stuck with a fake one from an Ebay vendor and helped Spigen to get that jerk shut down.  Ive since bought only from Spigen directly.  This can be done from their website itself, their Ebay store or their Amazon store.  And what is fortunate, all of them include free shipping via first class mail, or you can pay for expedited shipping.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I bought this for my girlfriend, who is extremely clumsy. Her GS3 was dropped in the toilet, and she had been through 4 cases (some of which were very expensive) by the time I got her he GS4. She drops her phones like it's her job, and she throws them in her purse and on tables like they don't cost $700... But, invest in a good case and most worries disappear. This case is really attractive, it gives the phone a squared off look without adding significant bulk. It's soft touch, and the two-tone looks good with the Red that's exclusive to AT&T. I didn't notice it effecting the use of buttons at all, however her headphones won't plug into the port. Oh well. She has dropped the phone twice with this case on, and luckily there isn't a single issue so far.... Now if only I could make her phone water proof
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This is a very high quality case, that fits the Samsung Galaxy S4 perfectly.I hate to strip it of 1 star as the ear buds that came with the S4 do fit as does the charger mini-usb connector.Unfortunately, I have a problem using any kind of ear buds as they are uncomfortable for me.I am unable to use my Sennheiser PX-100 headphones as the connector base is too wide in diameter to fit in the hole in the case.I had read reviews indicating that it did fit some headphones and not others and I was hoping mine would work.Researching the problem, some have suggested to use an adapter likeB0013RTHEO(Cellet Slim 3.5mm Pin to 3.5mm Input Mini-Jack Adapter for iPhone). I have just ordered it and will update my review to let everybody know if that works or not.Besides the issue with the headphone jack, this case is awesome. The packaging and instructions give the feeling of a high quality product, as does the case itself. All Galaxy S4 features are usable with the case, including the power button, volume rocker, min-USB charger and all the sensors that need access.UPDATE 7/19/2013----------------I received the Cellet Slim 3.5mm adapter and it fits into the Neo Hybrid headphone hole so any headphones can be used.While I was waiting for the adapter, I saw on sale (for only $3) and ordered the Duzign Mirage Snap On case for the Galaxy S4. Its cutouts for the headphones and the mini-usb charger connector are wide open so any type of headphones and chargers can be used. It also has a hard shell and is slimmer than the Neo Hybrid, giving it a nicer, sleeker look. I liked the quality so much that I ordered a second Duzign case for my wife's phone. It was no longer on sale, but it is still a great case even at $8.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I bought this case for my Samsung GS4 and I've had it for about two months now. I like the way it looks, it adds very little bulk to the device, and it is comfortable to hold. I have Infinity White and, so far, the frame seems resistant to staining, so it still looks very clean. I am moderately careful with my device, but I have dropped it a few times from short heights, and it has not sustained any damage. I will say that the frame seems to have weakened as a result of a fall from the bed onto carpet. While the case still looks and fits well, the frame seems to be more elastic than when I first put it on. It feels like it would be extremely easy to snap and that another fall (even from a short height onto a soft surface) might break it. The upside is, the frame can be purchased separately (SPIGEN SGP Samsung Galaxy S4 Case Protective [Neo Hybrid Replacement Frame] [Infinity White] Bumper Replacement Frame ONLY for Galaxy S IV Galaxy SIV i9500 - Infinity White) and it comes in different colors, so it serves as a backup plan and a customization option. I do not plan to drop my phone much, especially on a hard surface, but after some use, I would not expect this case to protect against hard falls. If you tend to drop your phone off your bed, a couch, or chair onto carpeted areas, you should be fine with this case. However, if you often get out of the car and your device falls out of your lap onto hard ground, or you drop your phone from several feet off the ground, I wouldn't expect this to fully protect your phone.[ETA] The frame snapped at the USB cutout. I am not sure when it happened exactly, but it was not a result of a fall because, I haven't dropped my phone at all since my review.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: This case looks amazing and fits well. I love this case. Its a little tough to get the phone in and out of it. Also it is very hard to find a belt holster that it fits in and works with.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Let me begin my review by first saying that I am somewhat of a case whore. Before when I had my S3 I had 12 cases for it before I sold it. Now with my S4 I have 6 now. I'm the kinda person that really loves my phone outside of a case, but am too scared to actually carry it around like that, so I am constantly looking for a case that offers reasonable protection but maintains the slim profile of the device. For my S4 I have an Otterbox, 2 incipio cases, a Poetic atmosphere case (highly recommend), and another cheap one. I don't like the bulk Otterboxes add, and I don't like the boring-ness that super slim cases add. I want something stylish, but also thin and protective (very tall order I know).As usual I was browsing the dark recesses of Amazon when I stumbled across this amazing company with their great customer reviews and their awesome looking cases. I found this one. Immediately the red and black contrast caught my eye. Then I read the description and was hooked.A case that keeps the device slim, but is still stylish AND has the capability to change frames to change the color and look of the case. Freaking amazing. I immediately, bought the case with the red frame included and also ordered an extra Silver frame with it.First order of business;Shipping and handling: As usual the item showed up in two days which was two days before the projected arrival date by Amazon.( I always pick USPS priority shipping, never more than three days and only 5$). It was an extremely padded box filled with bubble wrap and my new beloved case.Everything was in pristine shape and no complaints. Never had any issue with damaged items from Amazon.The Case: I must say, Spigen's marketing department really has it down. Aside from their attractive logo and colorful cases, even their packaging for their cases is attractive. The Case came in a a round clear plastic box adorned with Spigen logos. I kept the plastic box cause I thought it was cool. Usually I throw away packaging for stuff right away.The case is two pieces: First the rectangular plastic frame that wraps around the rubber inside sleeve. The frame by itself feels flimsy and easily breakable but once you put it on the phone around the rubber sleeve it feels very firm.The case is easily removable, and switching frames takes all of two seconds.Word of advice: when attaching or removing the case from your phone keep it in one piece. What I mean is; Put the frame ON the rubber sleeve the way it goes, THEN put your phone inside them both. It's much easier. Just but the top of the phone in the case first and press it down, then put the bottom in and press it down. It is much easier than puttin on the rubber sleeve first THEN adding the frame. Then you run the risk of breaking the frame (though I haven't broken one yet.)The case molds to the phone very well giving a nice tight fit.There has been some complaint about people not being able to use their headphones with this case but I haven't experienced that problem. I have several sets of Skull Candy earbuds, my Samsung OEM headphones (the best), and some Beats by Dre headphones. They all fit just fine. I could see somebody having a problem with headphones that have a ninety degree jack though.As for the charging port cutout, it also fits perfectly with the OEM charger. Some chargers by other brands do not fit though. I have an old LG charger that I use at work and it's USB plug doesn't fit, but as I have three Samsung OEM chargers it's not a problem for me.The only ONLY complaint I have about this case is that the frame is just a little too thick so I can't use it with my Samsung Smart dock that I use at home. Not really a big deal though.All the buttons on this case click really nicely and almost feel as if they are made of metal since they give such a nice defined click when you press the power or volume buttons. That was one thing I hated about Otterboxes, is how hard you have to press the buttons to get them to work. NOT a problem on this case. It feels as if your clicking the actual buttons.Also, one big reason why I insist on using cases is that I have a habit of setting my phone down alot. I don't ever set it screen down (unless it's in a case) and don't like setting it down on it's back without a case because it sits right on the camera lens. I'm afraid of scratching the lens up and not getting nice clear pictures like I do. That's something I wish Samsung would have though of is to make the lens just slightly recessed so it doesn't scratch so easily. Anyways, this case DOES give it clearance of the camera lens but a few millimeters, and when you set it face down it has plenty of clearance from the screen. Very nice.A quick word on durability and I'll wrap this up:As I stated above, my first impression of the plastic frame was that it seemed flimsy and easily breakable but it is much stronger than it looks. I have already dropped my phone is this case several times. Once of a desk onto linoleum and another time from about shoulder high onto concrete. Neither impact broke the frame. Though the drop onto concrete did make a little cluster of pinpricks on one corner. Only noticeable if your looking closely. I thought for sure a solid drop would break the frame but it isn't so! Much much stonger than it looks. And, if you DO somehow break a frame all you got to do is order a new frame for $9.99Conclusion: I must say, Spigen really nailed it with this case. ESPECIALLY for the price. $16 is incredibly cheap for this high of quality case. They could easily charge 40$ for it and I personally would have paid it. The extra frames do cost $9.99 each but they are worth it as well, especially since there are so many colors. I have nearly all the colors except white. I plan to get them all.I really hope that Spigen comes up with more case designs for the S4. They are a great company that doesn't charge an arm and a leg and stands by their product. I already ordered their other S4 casethe "slim armor" and it too has interchangable frames. Very nice.As I said in the title, Great company, Great Case, Great price. What more can you ask for?
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: Case looks great on the phone, and creates the feel that should've been present straight from Samsung. reviewText: Mine broke while I was inserting my phone. The metal frame is incredibly flimsy! I'm amazed they were able to find a metal that could break so easily.Update: The broken part has been replaced and so far, no breakages.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: I purchased roughly 5 months ago and about 2 months ago the bottom around the USB port cracked and a piece fell off. Last week, the entire outer frame finally broke and fell off. What a waste of $20! It looks nice but that's about it. I never dropped the phone or anything else so I can't vouch for it's protection. It's hard to fit non-Samsung chargers into the USB port. and some headphones into the headphone port. The paint around the bumper chips VERY easily. I carry it around in a purse and items like lip gloss and lighters seem to scratch it easily.If I would have known this case would last 5 months, I would have gone elsewhere. I've gotten $5 cases that last years. I guess I can see now why they offer a replacement frame for sale. What a joke.
title: Galaxy S4 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy S4 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10215)

reviewText: The bumper on the case broke within a month or two of ownership. I normally have the same single case for the entirety of having my smart phone for 2 years. It's so strange for it to break this easily. They should have made it out of softer plastic.
