reviewText: Bought this case for a friend and she loves it. The back isn't slippery so it adds more grip to the phone. And the gold border looks amazing
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This phone looks great and is fits amazing on my iPhone i purchased the gold variant and it looks stunning with my gold iPhone. Its a little tough to get on but thats because of the snug fit. classy look and clean profile!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Like many others, I am a case snob. It's not that I need a ton of different cases to go with my outfit, I just like a really nice case that is thin AND protects my phone completely. This case fits the bill!The thinnest cases I've found are the hard plastic ones that do not cover the top of the bottom of the phone. I have two of those, and don't use them often b/c the top and bottom of my phone gets banged up a bit when I put it in my car or desk. Hence I like the cases that cover the phone completely.This case is the thinnest I have used of the full cases. If you're like me and you HATE those cases that look like military armor and seem about 1" thick, then this case is for you. I use a magnetic holder in my car, and it's important that the back material is thin so that the magnet can attract hard to the small metal disc I put between my phone and the case on the inside. No problems here.Some have complained that the plastic band around the outside is flimsy. Hogwash. Once you snap it on, it's not going to be flexing in different directions. Plus, the plastic band is sleek and shiny and very classy looking. The color really pops out on the band, much more than the pictures show. Also, the metal buttons look really nice.If I can find out how to buy different colored bands, then this phone would truly be da bomb! If you like thin but full protection (sounds like a condom ad) then this is the one for you.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I have spent so much money on cases. I have gone through different case variations from Elago and Speck. This one is the best. Fits snug, looks great. Feels good in the hands. I am always careful with my phone so I don't plan on dropping it but I'm sure the phone will be fine. Highly recommend this case. First Spigen case and I am super happy with it.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: It's a two piece case.  The black portion is separate from the colors band around the outside.  Material are a rubber like main case and some kind of metal-like colored band that snaps around.  The rubber-like main case is not super grippy like a TPU. So far, I like it a lot but I'm a little bummed that the headphone jack hole doesn't fit some of my more standard "L" shaped headphone plug-ins. It will fit a standard headset w/o a problem.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I love this cover, it pairs perfect with my Spigen SGP 10087 Aluminum Home Button and my Spigen Nano tempered glass screen.  It complements the sexy sleek style of Apple's iphone without  cluttering it and actually does what it is supposed to, which is to protect my investment.  I'm very happy with this product and would definitely recommend this case to anyone looking for a case.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This case is awesome. I have got so many compliments on it and I'm a guy!! It's pretty protective but I would recommend a screen protector since there isn't much lift above the screen to protect it. Great case though.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: It looks like it should have been part of the IPhone in the first place.Feels so much more secure (less slippery) with this new case.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Although it is not exactly expensive at $20 but considering that most cases only go for $8-$15, this is like the above average kind and the quality seem to be so as well.The case feel well made, the back of the case provide a really comfortable feeling while holding or grabbing the phone, non slippy but not rough either, just as really smooth feel!So far I have dropped my phone a few time by accident and this case seem to protect it very well, the fact that it is a full wrap around design prevent edge damage. While all 4 corner of the outer hard rim suffered damage, the phone are OK.The back of the case does get scratched up over time, however it is not really visible unless you put it under the light.Overall great case, in fact I bough a total of 6 for me and my friends!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Best of about 7 iPhone 5/5S different cases I have tried over 14 months. The red plastic rim provides excellent holding strength for the inner softer section, and it shows NO wear after 2 months of use (including a few not-nasty drops, it still looks new).  Only slight negative is the opening size for the lightning plug - it is larger than the Apple plugs, and even large enough for most generic versions.  But, the decision to keep the mechanical strength of the red border and not leave a larger full-bottom opening means that some adapters will not work.  Even the official Apple 30 pin to Lightning adapters will not fit.  But most Lightning to USB cables do fit.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Ditto to other reviewers in that it is a very slim and cool looking case and probably the best one out there in this regard.  The metal slate color looks more like real metal even though it is just plastic.  My only issue is that the backing is a little more slippery than I would have liked.  Would still recommend.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: First things first, just got my case after what seemed like forever. Anyway, when I received my case, I had noticed that the packaging looked scratched up! That definetly made me feel as if my case wasn't too carefully handled..I opened the packaging, and only to realize that there was in fact, a stain on my case!  I had to use hand sanitizer, and a tissue to wipe it off. Definitely starting to think otherwise of this product and company.The good parts about this case, is that as I put this case on my phone, it fits nice and snug, as other reviews had said, and the anti shock patterns built into the back of the case is definitely a plus in my book.But UNFORTUNATELY, good things don't last long.  There is MORE bad news on this case. After using this case for no longer than a few days, i realized that the buttons are not "clicky" as other reviews claim this product is. This case, also ruins my signal more than i expected it too. This phone now makes my phone even warmer when i run high usage apps, resulting in even lesser battery life. The supposed "anti fingerprint backside" now has scratches from minimal usage, and being slid back into my pocket a few times. The aluminum band FEELS as if It will break, if I take it off even once. Finnally, the anti fingerprint backing does need to be wiped, in order to be "free" of any visible fingerprints.I am very self aware about all products I buy for my phone, and really, I have to say I am disappointed in what i wasted $30 of my hard earned money for. Products with this high of asking offer must be top of the line. Unfortunately it is not seen in this.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Love the design over all. Feels a little slick to hold onto in your hand. I never dropped it or anything and somehow the yellow paint on the bumper chipped. If it wouldn't of chipped it would have got 4 stars. Here's a hands on review video I made:[...]
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I love the spigen cases. I have quite a few of them. However, this one is a piece of garbage. I never had a dropped call or signal or internet interference with a case until I got this hybrid case. I put it on, it held i guess well enough. THe material seemed solid enough for a bit, but at the same time felt a bit cheap. It pretty much offers no protection in my opinion. Also, consider the signal interference and whatnot when purchasing. I never had that issue with a case before. I would suggest alternative Spigen cases, such as slim armor or tough armor.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Very high quality case! I am one of those guys that looks for hours and even days when it comes to looking for something like a case to protect my very costly Iphone. This was the best case I was able to find after looking at reviews on Amazon, Cnet, and other websites. My wife and I both have the 5s and we got different cases and I am amazed at the quality of this case. I have dropped my phone 6 times and not one single scratch is on the case and the metallic surface still looks new.  I am very rough with my phone and this holds up well. A common complaint of other cases for the 5s is that the dual flash is blocked by the lack of a large hole cut out on the back of the case but this one is not a problem and the best part is the hard rubber back is easy to grip and soft enough to absorb an impact. The only issue I have with this case is that the only headphones and I mean the only headphones that will plug in is the Apple ones that came with the Iphone. We have ports to plug into the car stereo and to the sound system inside and the hole for the headphone jack is too small.Another plus is the metallic surface has not chipped yet and looks very nice.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: From the reviews, this is a great case and I believe that this is a great case as well. However, I cannot give it a good score because my case came broken. If the case wasnt broken, it would have gotten a perfect 5/5.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I was looking for a case that I could use for business travel, this is a good choice. Overall, I really like the aesthetics of the design.  It helps preserve the thinness of the 5s.  I believe the protection is adequate and perfect for carrying the phone in your pocket.  The backside is not tacky and provides a reasonable grip.  The Tough Armor (have one of those too) case design allows for a better grip but the compromise is that it's bulkier than the Neo Hybrid but hugely improved over competitor's "Tough" cases.  I've seen some of those that look like bricks!  This is ideal when you're putting the phone in pants pockets.  Buttons on the phone appear to be metal, are of nice quality and provide a contrast to the color of the frame.As others have noted, the lip could be just a touch higher to provide more screen protection but it's OK as it is.  I'm sure the small lip helps preserve the thin design.  The cutout for the headphones is round, so I can imagine it's design will limit usage to select headphones.  Get bluetooth headphones and it's not a problem.The cutout for the lightning connector fits for Apple and Rocketfish so that worked for me.The one and only true flaw I see with this is that unless you have a longer nail, the mute button is hard to access.  The cutout around it is small.Some may prefer a cutout on the back of the phone to show the Apple logo on it and you'd think it would be easy enough to do since it's not much different than the cutout for the camera and flash.  I don't mind that it's covered.Overall, I'm pretty happy with this case and would recommend it to anyone looking for a slim profile case.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: After spending way too much time looking at cases, I finally decided on this one. I lean towards more minimalist cases versus the full-protection Otterbox style cases, but I also want some protection as well. This case delivers on my preferences, and looks damn good too. It adds very little bulk to 5S. It really feels like you have no case on at all. I really like the color choices, but I went with the Metal Slate. You can also order separate 'surround' peices in difference colors as well.I probably would not recommend this case to someone who is accident prone, but for those like me that 'baby' thier phones, this case adds a little protections and a lot of style.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: it is so perfect.. my dad loved the color and how sturdy it is..
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This is a great case. Really protects the phone and doesn't add on the extra bulk. I did have a wet instal screen protector on it and it distorted that so I switched to a dry instal and it worked great.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Love it for my Iphone 5, has great touch of elegance and is also very slim. It only brings a mm wider for protection, but it doesn't chance the slim view of the phone at all. The champagne bridge can be replaced by another one if it is scratched, and the cost is affordable
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I liked this case, but it was too slippery for me, so I sold it to someone else.  I like something with a bit more grip.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I purchased this for my iPhone 5s and it fits really good. The only problem I have with it is that its so thin that you can't use any kind of hard screen protectors because it will go past the thin lip of the case leaving your screen exposed.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: The buttons on this case are not technically a part of the case. I removed this case once and I lost the volume up and down buttons as well as the power button...its a shame, I really liked the look of the case.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: My son has had this case for a month and a half.  He loves the look of it, very minimalist.  Not sure about protection, but it keeps scratches away.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: THe case itself was okay. I thought maybe it would be like the Slim Armor Case I got, both being made by the same manufacturer. Mostly my fault for not reading the details. A little too flimsy for my tastes
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I had the Poetic atmosphere in white, and was very happy until the color changed after a month of usage. So I gave this one a try and actually like it better because the rim color doesn't fade away.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Always get compliments on this case & it's sleekness. Definitely my favorite iPhone case ever. Does get chipped up very easily though.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Well that was fast.When I first received my Iphone 4s two years ago, I spent nearly $100 on various cases big and small (Incipio, Case Crown, Otterbox, Ballistic) to find the perfect case. Interestingly enough, I ended up using my first one the most and probably could have saved a lot of money.After I ordered my 5s from ATT online I came onto Amazon with a specific type of case in mind. I wanted:-something that was thin and wouldn't take away from the thinness of the 5s-a case that would still offer enough protection despite being low key and thin-had some protection on the front if for some reason i placed the phone down on the screen-does not interfere with putting on a screen protector-stylish with cool colors (the fact that this has interchangeable bumpers makes it even more desirable)-does not pick up crazy amount of fingerprints on the back-fits snug but isn't impossible to remove or put back on-cutouts are perfect and buttons etc. aren't difficult to use when case is on-has stellar reviews on Amazon and won't break the bankSo that's not a small list of requirements, but they are all things that IMO should be expected of a quality case worthy of a quality phone.After looking through 2-3 cases I came across this one and loved the look, reviews and the price wasn't too high. So I checked out youtube for some reviews and was sold after 10 minutes.I've been using this case for about a week or so now and can't imagine going for anything else. 5 stars.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Excellent case. The fit is perfect. Very sleek and low profile, while giving excellent everyday protection. If your looking for a non bulky case that will still offer good protection from light drops and look good this is it. Only down side is it is not easy to take off.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I spent more time researching cases than I would like to admit after buying a bad clear case in an office supply store that sounds like maples. This is the case that I finally settled on, and I believe it was a great choice.The only problem with this case is if you have fat fingers, you will trouble flipping the mute switch. That's the reason some reviewers mentioned this problem, while others said it was no problem for them. It's the size of your fingers. I'm torn between giving this case 4 and 5 stars, it's really 4.5 because of the mute button issue.There's one more thing I would like to say. Reading the one and two star reviews of this case, it is clear to me that these people have purchased counterfeit versions of this product. The manufacturer specifies to only buy the product by them and shipped by Amazon, not a third-party seller. Inside the package is a URL and a code that you can use to verify that you have a genuine Spigen case and not a fake.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: When I first opened the package it felt so flimsy in my hand that there's no way that it was going to protect my phone.  I will have to say that once the phone is inside of it, it sort of transforms it and it now feels more durable than before the phone was in it.  Now to be fair I still don't think that it will provide the kind of protection that I am looking for when it comes to dropping your phone outside in the driveway but for normal everyday not to drastic falls it should hold up pretty well.  The case fits the phone like a glove and you barely feel a difference in thickness with it on and all the buttons and openings are perfect.  For those looking for a little more protection like I am, Spigen is coming out with a more rugged version called Tough Armor for the iPhone 5 the first week of August.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I've used Spigen cases before and always impressed. This one is the best yet. Sleek look and feel, yet resilient. (Had it less than a day and dropped it showing to a friend!) Beautiful product for a beautiful phone!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I bought the infinity white for black iPhone 5 and put it on with the white jelly bean button. It feels great in the hand and looks amaaazing. Excellent protection and I recommend it . Excellent packaging and excellent price
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Great case as always! Been purchasing this case for my iPhone 5 & now the iPhone 5s! Also purchased this case for my Galaxy S4 and also my Nexus 5 as well! Love the color scheme! Never really had a problem with these cases! Only one time had the button fell off, and that's because I take off the case once or twice a week to clean it out and clean my phone off. Works great with screen protectors, doesn't lift the screen protectors up like some other cases...Also works great with any tempered glass screen protectors as well. But keep in mind, the thicker the screen protector, the less of a "lay on the table" design you take away. I had on a Spigen Japanese screen protector, the regular plastic kind, and it left a settle "lay on the table" design for me to lay my phone flat down on the screen! Now once I added the Spigen 0.4 slim tempered glass screen protector, it left no room left. So when I lay my phone flat down on it's screen, the surface always touched my tempered glass screen protector. Which I didn't mind, cause when I do lay it down, i only lay it down on surfaces that won't scratch my phone, but I want to point that out to those who just lay their devices down on any surfaces! So warned!Pros:- Very sleek & slim (great stylish design) the gold matches the iPhone's gold very well!- buttons feel great when pressing into them- great that you can buy different color bands/bumpers- not slippery (at least for me it's not)Cons:- Can't use with charging docks or music/speaker stations- Volume & power/sleep buttons are silver and not gold- headphone jack & lightning cut-out can't fit "certain" third party cables- needs a bigger "lay on the table" design- camera cut out on the rear should be matching band too (personal preference)- price is a little high for a case that doesn't protect your device that well from drops (Otterbox commuter & defender on Amazon is around $20-$25)
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I'm used to using the LifeProof for a long time, but darn it.. people are having a hard time hearing me unless I open up the bottom flap where the charger goes. Plus they just don't as streamlined as it did when they first came out for the iPhone 4.. just my opinion. I bought this after reading a lot of reviews, and I really ;ike the feel of it, and how well it fits. I do need to get a screen protector for. I'm still up in the air as far dropping it from a few ft. Lifeproof saved the phone many a time from drops. I'll update this after I've used it longer
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Slim and protective. Looks sharp. I have had hundreds of cases. This one it the best. The white band looks fantastic on the white iphone. Metallic buttons feel great. Closest thing to a naked iphone feel. Spigen is top quality and this case is simply their best ever.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This case has two major problems.1) the case is very slippy. It is very easy to drop the phone2) after a week of normal wear and tear, the back of the case looks all scratch up!!!.  I never seen a plastic back that looks this bad after just a little use.It's a waste of money!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: The case is very slim and protects the iphone quite good. The case gives the iphone a certain form of distinction! I have had several cases from other manufactures, and nothing even comes close!. This one is the best yet. The Infinity White band looks great on the white iphone. All the buttons are responsive and function as stated. The case also feels sturdy and has a great grip in your hand. Spigen makes top quality products and this case a proof! I would definitely recommend this case to anyone!!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I prefer Slim cases and this was just too big for my taste.But if you are looking for a  protective case this is the way to go.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I have purchased just about every type of case for me and my girlfriend. This is probably the best one I have found. My two primary goals when buying a case are that it is sleek and looks cool. I don't really expect any case to hold up to a serious drop but I just want it to give my phone a chance. At the very least prevent a few scratches and dings. What I really like about this case is that it comes in two parts. One piece is almost like rubber (better than rubber because it's not sticky) and acts like an inner shell. The other piece is a clear coated outer shell. The outer shell not only enhances the look of the case, but it also provides a cover for the volume and power buttons. I'm not going to test it with any drops, but if I were to guess I'd say having two pieces will help it cushion a fall. I think it has been noted in another post that the bottom of the case is not completely flush with the lightning port. It is quite possible that any 3rd party cables will no longer fit. I have a 3 in 1 cable I purchased from Amazon that no longer fits. Standard cables do fit along with the EZOPower cables. love the case!!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Awesome case, very protective, high quality and very stylish...
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This thing is great, dual protection and great presentation for the beautifully designed iPhone 5s. The back of the cover gives you a good grip and the openings are large enough for headphones and chargers to plug in.  Volume buttons are also easy to press because they're raised along the edge of the case, only the ringer switch needs a little digging to reach, and that's fine by me.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Hands down one of THE BEST cases you can get for your black iPhone 5 or 5s. It's durable, slim, and good looking. I've dropped my phone a few times with this case on and the case still looks great. My phone is still in perfect condition. The only downside is that they sell the frames for such a high price on their own.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I'm really liking this case.. The phone is well protected, the ports are well accessible, the buttons are easy to press and provide feedback, there is protection in case you lay your phone on the table with the screen facing down, and best of all, it keeps the device thin.I had no issues with the Apple branded Lightning connector, nor did I have any issues with the AmazonBasics Lightning connector.My only complain is putting the case on and taking it off. The plastic part (bumper) that goes around needs some force in order to install and feels like it's going to snap. So far, no issues though.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I own six cases for my iPhone 5s and now I can stop looking.  This is to me the most perfect of two worlds, the world of slim and the world of protection.  It is slim enough to store in my Sena phone holster and is just overall a great looking case. It is a two part case and you have to be careful installing the outer ring and another great feature is that you can order extra decorative bumpers in your favorite colors (which I did) and I can truthfully say that I have finally found the perfect case for my phone.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This case is the slimmest case of it's form factor. For reference, it's a hair slimmer than the Belkin Grip Candy Sheer. It fits very tight, and there's no movement of the phone or the lip of the case. This case provides lay on the table design, but not enough if you use a glass screen protector. This case has good sized cutouts. Lightning port seems large enough to accommodate 3rd party connectors; however, I only use OEM ones. The camera cutout is just perfect. No aluminum is showing. The "metalized" plastic buttons give great feedback and an audible click, but all three buttons rattle. This case has a simple, elegant design that, in my opinion, looks better than any other case out there.There's two things that keep me from giving this a 5 and calling this the perfect case:-The lip: The lip would be sufficient if you used a plastic screen protector, but if you are like me and use a glass screen protector (non-slim variants), there is practically no "lay on the table" design. The glass screen protector is flush with the lip.-The buttons: The buttons rattle! All three of them! Also, I have the metal slate version, and the silver buttons stick out like a sore thumb. I feel like they should have made the buttons rubber or TPU like the Neo Hybrid EX Slim bumper version of this case.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I have changed cases I don't know how many times. Otterboxes, Belkin, Air Jackets, ghost armor, silicone, hard candy shell cases...and finally the search is over. The is by far one of the best looking, better built cases out there. The shell is stiff enough to protect the phone but no to rigid that I will crack on impact, secondly there is a nice raised lip on the front to keep the glass protected. The bumper just makes this case pop, a simple two tone color really sets this case apart. Unlike other cases that get flimsy and weaken over time, the outside bumper holds everything nice and snug. Metalized buttons are a nice feature and offer great feedback. The buttons are very responsive. The lightning and headphone jacks are sufficiently cut out. The speaker and mic cut outs are also large enough that pocket lint and dust doesn't get trapped. I am super happy with this case and just placed an order for 2 other colors just to swap them out. At around 20.00 depending on color. These cases are a steal! The jelly bean home buttons aren't really my thing. But the packaging SPG uses is pretty legit. Quit reading and just buy it already, you won't be disappointed.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: i dont like this case i bought for my iphone the buttons pop off. i recomended  no one buy this case it was good for the note 3 but not the iphone.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Bought 2 and 1 was defective.  Make sure you order from Amazon or Amazon fulfillment. Spigen has the worse customer service to there "100% satisfaction guarantee" And they want to charge you for returning there defective product??why??Update 30 days later.Amazon refunded both. One TPU ripped and the other one the frame buttons fell out and lines on the back of the TPU. This is low usage and no drops.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: iPhone 5SFits perfectly, and that's saying a lot for cheap cases.This is possibly the best fitting case in this class, including Spigens other offerings.I do think the price is a bit bloated for the quality, I would expect to pay around 10USD for thisOverall, I like the design of this case but do prefer Spigens Slim Armor in terms of quality and finish.Pros:Fit- excellentTPU material- doesn't look or feel cheapControl buttons- while plastic, they are painted with a shiny, metallic look and cover the existing sleep and volume buttonsPort openings- unlike Spigens Slim Armor case, This case does have a larger charging port opening. This allows it to fit the Amazon basics lightning cable with ease. The Slim Armor does not, so while they may look similar, they are quite different in this regard.Button cutouts- alignment is excellentFace frame height- the bumper goes all the way around, the heigh off the phone face is not massive, but it is enough so that your glass isn't rubbing any surface on which it may be laid.Cons:Paint plastic bumper- This could have been done better. It doesn't scream cheap chinese, but it does declare it in a moderate speaking voice. The finish could have been much better. Slim Armor wins hereMetalized buttons- Also a Pro, but the Con is the paint WILL wear and chip off. These buttons won't look good forever, and using real aluminum or a better finish would not be that much more cost prohibitive.Slim Armor wins here too.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This is a great case. It went on easily and actually looks like the phone without a case. It didn't add a lot of bulk either.Pros:- Price- Fit/Function- StyleCons:- Like original phone, it doesn't add a lot of friction to the grip like some of the silicon models do
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: It is great amazing case. It fits the phone well and easy to assemble. It saves lots of time and money.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I love this case! It is so sleek looking, and as some of my friends have said, they thought it was the phone, as if nothing were on it. It's extremely light weight, and the front bumper is just enough to place the phone face down without worrying if it's protected or not. The reason for the four stars is because of how long it took to get to me. It was about 6 weeks before I received it.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Slim case that I feel is equal to the OtterBox Commuter. It's nice that you can change the bumper to your liking.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Great fit. Great protection. I love the look and feel of this case. The soft rubberized plastic (or whatever it is) hugs the phone and protects it from short drops and the colored frame with the chrome-looking buttons make it look amazing. Those buttons are very well designed, too.My only quibble is that the outer band's audio porthole is too small for some of my audio plugs. My car is ancient - it has a cassette player and no audio jack inputs. The cassette audio adapter I purchased has a large input jack that will not fit through the opening in the case. I imagine that some headsets will also not fit.I only wish that Spigen had offered the frames separately when I bought mine. I would have liked to switch between colors.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I am a case snob.  There.  I've said it.  I have had Otterbox cases (Commuter and Defender), Speck cases, and others.  This case is, by far, my favorite and the best I've owned.  The fit is outstanding (as long as you get the genuine product and not a Chinese knockoff).  I have dropped my iPhone a couple of times with this case on and have no damage to the phone (the case has some nicks and scratches).  The slate grey color is great, but I have also ordered other colors now that Spigen is selling them as standalone add ons.I highly recommend this case for anyone who wants a thin case that offers some protection for their phone.  Here are my only caveats--if you are a klutz or are hard on your phone, this case won't help you.  If you constantly like to switch cases, this may not be the case for you.  I tend to put a case on and leave it on.  If you constantly take the case off, I could see where this one would start to show some stress--the good fit also means its not the easiest to take on and off.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I liked the case so far. It looks pretty good on my iphone 5s. I would recommend this to anybody who are looking for a good and nice looking case.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Of the 5 Spigen cases I have, this is my 2nd best.  It is lightweight, sleek, and good looking.  Comes in two parts so I'm certain that if I dropped my phone it would protect it. Buttons are easy to press.  Good job Spigen!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: The Spigen Neo Hybrid is a great case that offers surface and corner protection without bulk - and it looks great too. However, it's a little bit tricky to get on (try leaving two pieces assembled before putting on phone). And I don't particularly care for the feel of the rubber, either - more plastic-y than soft-touch - but it's not bad. I wish Spigen offered the colored bumpers for sale separately, as well. But, all in all, this is one of the best cases I've had on any phone. It has a perfect fit and the metalic covered volume and power buttons are a really nice touch.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Seriously! I've bought a ton of cases for each iPhone I've owned, and as far as the look, build, durability, weight, and protection, this case is THE BEST. I got the iPhone 5S now and was worried about a case ruining the aesthetic... but this Spigen case makes it look so sleek and protects it so well.I'm ready to purchase a bunch of color bumpers to give my phone different looks.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Well, I must admit, people notice the case and they definitely like the look.  So the case definitely passes with stylish points.  The inner rubber is flexible and pliable and absorbs a lot of shock.  I think one of the best features is the slightly raised lip such that if the phone is face down (or lands face down) the actual screen never makes contact with the ground.The angled flush with the camera/flash is definitely a plus as it feels smooth as compared to other cases where it is a sharp edge.  It just feels better when you are fishing out your phone from your pocket/purse and you don't scrape your finger on any rough edges.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I have spent over $60 trying different cases(about 7 total) and finally came across this $22 Spigen Neo case.  At first, I was held back by the price as I normally don't spend over $20 for a case.  I usually buy Amazon Warehouse deals but went ahead and dished out the $20. My goal is to write good reviews while protecting my iPhone with only the best out there.  Well, I have FINALLY found it!  This Neo case is the king of cases!  It adds protection, no bulk, and my favorite feature....Tactile buttons! The metal slate is really cool.  Some users complain about the headphone jack and yea its a little small but I use Sennheiser HD 219's with no problem.  DJ style headphones should work fine.But, beware during install:  The "bumper" that goes over the TPU portion is very delicate.  This is definitely a case you don't want to remove/install too many times.  Inside it has very little "clips" that snap on to the TPU, on mine, I ALREADY broke half of two of the ridges.  It still holds, but I won't be removing it anytime soon unless I really have too.  I'm afraid i'll finish breaking them.  Read the instructions before installing.  I really hope Spigen warranties this part cause it too delicate for such a pricey case.Another cool thing about this case is it has a small lip that doesn't touch the screen protector.  You should have no problem having different size thickness screen protectors.  I currently have a Skinomi protector on the front and nothing on the back with no problem.Out of all the cases I've tried, I give this 9.5 out of 10.  My only "con" is the price which does not compensate thin, flimsy clips that hold the case to the TPU.  The outer bumper is VERY slim but its still a bada$$ phone case.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.The home button add-ons are okay.  I personally dont like them as they tend to press while in my pocket.  Mainly because the lip is very small so the home button add-on sticks out.**9/17/13 UPDATE**Still love the case but noticed something buyers should be aware of.  The outer shell/bumper feels like it'll break if you squeeze it too hard.  Another thing, I took this case apart to show my coworker what the inside looked like and the power button broke off.  Luckily I was able to pop it back into place.  I hope SPIGEN will sell the bumper/shells individually as I feel these will break if frequently removed/installed(I sent them a email about this and will update if they respond).**10/04/13 UPDATE**I received my replacement case on Monday after sending the broken one in last week.  I couldn't be happier with Spigen's customer service.  All emails were answered and the replacement arrived super fast.  Check out my other case reviews and pictures on Spigen products.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I picked this case, not only because I've had great experiences with other Spigen products but because it's a very minimalist case that does not hamper the looks or use of the phone.  It has just enough "style" with the colorful frame that allows you to set the phone screen down without the screen touching anything and adds a decent amount of protection with the rubberized back.  Access and responsiveness of buttons is the best of all cases I've ever used.  The volume and power buttons are covered but remain just as sensitive as without a case and they look good to boot.  I've since bought different colored replacement frames to use with the rubberized back and found that all of them are made well and function as they should.  I recommend this case to anyone that wants protection without bulkiness.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: i just purchased this case along with the Spigen Slim Armor.  I have the Neo Hybrid on my iphone 5, I really like the bumper looking fitting that slots over the black shell case. It keeps the sides of the case firmly in place with a nice feel.  The lip over the glass screen protector brings it flush to the lip of the case, not the safest option but I trust that the glass screen saver is there to protect the original glass of the iphone.  Both cases are excellent but I prefer slimmer cases (I previously had a thin Seido slide in case) but after installing a glass screen saver the Seido case no longer fits.  My daughter has the 5S and is using the Slim Armor.  The Slim Armor feels a little bigger and bulkier than the Neo Hybrid, but both fit well and feel solid. No accidental drops yet so I dont know how durable they really are.  I was concerned that my after market car charger would not fit into the charging slot but no problem at all with either case.  If you have a BodyGuardz glass screen saver,  the Neo Hybrid and Slim Armor both fit very well.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Good fit and the metal like buttons are nice. Adds very little bulk. Plenty of height around screen so can face upside down without contacting screen on a table or similar. The edges are a hard shell where as the back and rim around screen are a firm rubber. The rubber is not as "sticky" as silicone so it will still slide around a little when sitting it on the dash of the car or similar but it does provide some "traction". I wish it were a little more "sticky" like silicone but it I am ok with it and it doe not get scratched up and have a feeling this case will last forever unlike silicone cases. Great quality all around. Ports big enough for all my chargers/accessories.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: Very nice case at decent price point. Slim and sleek enough not to add bulk to phone. Feels like good to the touch also.Offers good protection also!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: To begin, I'm not a big fan of iphone 5 cases and I would spend enormous amounts of money (~$100) over cases but I saw the reviews on this case and I was like, I'll get it a shot. I never really liked Spigen but whatever took my guts and bought it. Once it arrived it well packaged and just as you except a well made product. The case is beautiful, very slim, feel like more of a bumper than a case yet again its a case. The black part of the case is very soft and has a good clean finish to it. The black part does also attract finger prints but not contagiously. If you buy a anti finger print screen protector, you'll love it even more.Pros: Soft,Slim profile. Very shock absorbent, stylish, button are super responsive to the case(no delay between case and buttons)Cons: If you own a bigger size headphone jack, it wont fit. (Beats,Bose,Logitech works fine) The back is little finger print sensitive, but not enough to worry.Overall I highly recommend this product. It worth the price and if you don't like, you could give it to a friend and they would love it.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I like the case a lot but after the first week I had it the lock button on the case fell off!!!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: One thing I wasn't expecting when I received this case is how form-fitting it is on my iPhone 5. Doesn't add any bulk whatsoever yet is very protective. It's already been put to the test (accidentally) from different heights and passed all of them. My phone has been dropped while talking, off my desk, out of my pocket...not a scratch or a ding and barely any on the case itself. Just follow the instructions on the box when putting on and removing the case. They are there for a reason and I know that it may seem tough at first, but when you follow the instructions carefully, you'll get the hang of it without feeling like you're going to break the frame that goes around the rubber piece.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: This case is sleek and the best I've ever had.It fits very snug and doesn't increase the profile of the iPhone much.Good protection for what I'm looking for.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: good looks, good protection(not otter-box) thin profile, loving the look of buttons.I chose this case, after numerous cases. The previous case was poly carbonate which looked great and provided decent protection but left with bunch of scratches, I had bumper case which looked and gave least amount of thickness added to the iphone 5 but didn't provide any back protection. This solve both problem bc the back and even front are protected with scatch resistance soft rubber that looks good and easy to keep clean.I chose white and I placed white home button on my iphone looks & feels brand new again with ios 7
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10360)

reviewText: I have just received this item like an hour ago (it's 1:43 PM 10/10/13) and I felt compelled to leave a feedback due to a lot of the negative reviews and how people were mad because they didn't get their cases by the estimated delivery date, I totally understand your frustration but I gotta say it will be worth the wait and your money, this is by far the most beautiful elegant protective case I have ever owned for a cell phone ( and I owned PLENTY of cell phones in my 30 years), this has a very compact profile but yet protects your phone completely, The edges are raised a little so when you put your phone face down it won't scratch the screen, it is so compact that you won't even think you have a case on your phone until you hold it and actually feel the case, I know some probably did not receive their cases yet but be patient because it will be worth it.I am submitting photos I took of my phone in my new SPIGEN Neo Hybrid case, it is the Satin Silver so people can see that it has all the cut outs for the ports and that it looks awesome, don't mind my screen protector, it is one of those defective once that was a tad taller than the screen, I am waiting on the new ones to arrive.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This case is amazing! Ordered 2 different colors. It fits great on the phone and I love that I can change the border color easily. I also love that it doesnt add any bulk to the phone which is good becasue this thing is big enough already!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I've dropped my phone many times and this case has absorbed the impact. I've dropped it from over waist high down to concrete and the case got a little scuffed but my phone is just fine. It's easy to put on and off. It fits the phone perfectly, allowing access to ports and the stylus.The colors of the black and silver make the phone look sleek with my black Note 3. I've come to love every Spigen case I've had so Spigen is always my first choice now for phone cases. The case doesn't add too much bulk - It's worth it for the protection. The lip on the top of the phone is great so if my phone lands face down the screen doesn't get scratched.I would highly recommend the Neo Hybrid case for any phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I bought 2 and gifted 2 to colleagues. Best case in my opinion in terms of style, function, and slim form.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: It's just blends in with the phone...as if it's not even there.  The s-pen is a bit harder to get out but I wager that is so with a lot of other cases as well.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Still a great case, however I no longer use it as I found a similar case that doesn't annoy me the same way this one did. I loved the case, slim, comfortable and amazing protection for how small it is. However the cutouts for the headphones and charging cable were just too small, was always a pain when not using Samsung charger, and some headphones just don't work.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The build quality of this case is tremendous. Looks great, feels solid. I'm not drop testing with my Note 3 in the case, but I feel confident that it will protect the phone.The case has a thick back, so the phone won't fit in my charging cradle when it's in this case. Annoying. But the case is surprisingly easy to remove. The case also makes it harder to remove the stylus.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The Note 3 is already huge and this case just made it too bulky for me. I used it for a day and removed it. It is nice quality, but too bulky unfortunately.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The styling of this thing are absolutely perfect, Very easy to get on and off of my phone but no worries about the phone falling out of it accidentally. Only adds a little bit of extra size to it overall.Haven't dropped it yet, but I dont have very high expectations of the phone fairing very well from a full on ear level drop.Not a positive or negative, but the silver plastic bumper is more of a matte finish if that helps anybody out.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: My brother brought this case for himself through my account. The boy loves it, protects his phone just the way he likes it!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: LOVE LOVE LOVE this thing. It adds some pretty good protection to the phone without making it bigger than it already is and I was also surprised to find out that the black part of the case was not the material I thought would be a lint magnet like my last case of my Galaxy S3. Well worth the money. definitely a must buy.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: this provide a decent amount of protection and it looks great!i kind of dislike the back because of the finger print. etc
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I would give this product 5 stars, but I have a major problem with the volume button sensitivity around the case edge. If I press just below the volume down rocker, it will change the volume. Unfortunately while in my pocket this seems to happen all the time. Additionally, it wasn't that easy to get on/off and because I have extra batteries, I'm not really a fan of doing this. All-in-all I do like the case and will continue to use it because of it's great looks.NOTE: if you have a 3rd-party USB3.0 cable it might not connect with the case attached. Works ok with the OOTB Samsung charger.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I have had this case on my phone for several months and I am satisfied with it. Only a few slight scratches on the painted surface so far but it has delivered the expected protection for my phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love the style of the case, but the first time I dropped it the outer plastic piece broke and I could not find a replacement for just that piece.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a well built case that fits well. Getting it on right can be a little tricky, but just be patient and work it in and get everything lined up. When something fits this well, it's going to be a tight fit.A little bulky in comparison to their slimmer design, but this offers more protection against drops.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Yes at first it is a little difficult to get use to taking it off and on to power cycle the device but once you get the hang of it's no biggie. It doesn't add bulk to my phone. The small lip on the back protects the camera and the raised lip on the front protects the screen when face down on a table. I like how it adds a pop of color to my phone. I've dropped my Note 3 several times and this case has held up but I do recommend a screen protector if you're clumsy like me. I wish they sold the metal rim separately so I can interchange the color.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case is a little hard to get on at first but fits nicely. The case feels like a very sturdy case without all the bulk. I like it a lot.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: looks good, protects good
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I tried another case on my Note 3, but this one was by far the best out of the two! It is slim, and not too tacky. I was afraid I would have a hard time getting it in and out of my pocket, but it is smooth enough to get in and out easily. It is also just sticky enough not to slide off counters, tabletops, etc. Also it looks sexy!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Very good minimal case - not much protection but just the right amount for little bulk - it should be considered a bumper case - with a back - it really is well made. My recommendation is to put the device as such into the fully assembled case - and not take the rim off - it is harder to fit the rim back on after the device is placed in the rubber inner.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This case i got for my wife. It's a very nice case, not big and heavy but just right she said sometime she forgot she has a case on,  witch is good  since the phone is note 3 and it's big by it self.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: great case
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This case feels a little cheap, but it looks very nice on the note 3. It has a decent amount of protection. Proabably enough to keep the Note 3 from scratching or denting when bumping it against something.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I am very picky when it comes to cases. I dont like bulky cases because they add weight and size increase. I came across this case and read reviews and read nothing but negative comments about how they took forever to ship their product, etc. My item was shipped that day!!! I had it two days later. This case is AMAZING! The picture they use looks exactly the same as the product and was not enhanced or anything. I don't know why people have had bad luck with them in the past but I can assure you this product is simply beautiful! Def worth the money!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great case for the note 3. So easy to put on, doesn't add to much bulk to my phone, I still have access to all the ports. The cut outs for the headset, usb3, speaker, mikes, and S-pen are lined up perfectly, also the volume rocker and power buttons are extended so they work without any issues.I love the look and feel of the case, a tip for anyone else getting the Spigen Neo Hybrid case put it on fully assembled it will fit much easier than taking to two pieces apart.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I replaced my Otterbox case with the Neo Hybrid (Champagne Gold). Loved the former case, but it was heavy and not "stylish". My Spigen is lighter and adds some understated bling to my superphone. Already dropped it in the parking lot right on a corner and it kept on ticking, no problem.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great fit, great look. Not ultimate protection, but paired with a screen protector is enough for me.You get what you pay for and I'd buy this case again and again.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is my second case from Spigen.  I used their very slim case before which was nice up until I dropped the phone and it landed on the edge of the screen.  Glad I had one of their screen protectors!  (It broke, but the screen isn't damaged at all)Went for something a little more substantial but not too bulky.  Very sharp.  Love the yellow/orange.Update:Polycarbonate "ring" broke after a few drops, unfortunately Spigen doesn't sell just the ring for this specific case, unlike many others.  Had to buy a whole new case instead.  The TPU portion of the case will just go to the dump since it is basically indestructable.  What a waste.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I like the case alot. Feels solid, looks great, good feel. Only wish would be the back would be rubberized or sticky for better grip. Other than that no complaints. Received in one day.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Once you get a Spigen, you won't want to get anything else. Simply the best cases out there in terms of aesthetics, protection and feel.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case is great looking fit well and has done well on drops.  I would recommend this case and get again.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: It's a fine looking case but the hole for the headphone jack is not big enough to fit my ATH-M50s, my Grado SR60i's nor my cheap Phillips earbuds. Every time I want to listen to music i have to peel off that corner of the case to the back. Not very classy at all and the buttons are really hard to press at that point.On plus side the plastic bumper seems to stand up well to scratches. After one month of use there are basically no blemishes.The case has a nice balance of slipperiness and friction.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: After much searching and debate, I decided to order this case and the Urban Armor Gear case because I just couldn't decide.Well now I've decided, and this case isn't going to cut it.What I didn't like:Does not provide a solid grip for the phone.  It's just a little too smooth and slick. The back looks like it's rubberized, but it's pretty slick.Front lip doesn't provide very much protection if you set it face down.Top right corner of the black under layer doesn't exist, so that corner of your phone is only protected by the plastic band.BIGGEST COMPLAINT => The buttons for the power and volume rattle. They are plastic pieces attached to the plastic band, but they are loose so the rattle when you move the phone.What I liked:Very slim, so you don't add a lot of bulk.Very Stylish and modern looking.Large cutouts for port access.This is a very minimal case, which is what I wanted, but it feels too flimsy to offer any real protection.I'll just throw it on Craigslist for what I paid. I'm sure it's right for someone, it's just not me.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Fits great and keeps the phone nice and slim with the looks of elegance. I would highly recommend this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I order this case ASAP,...BLACK -SILVER on BLACK SAMSUNG GALAXY Note S3 look AMAZING...! Every time when I pull out my phone everybody asking about it ...?!!! CASE LOOK SLIM,MODERN, and ATTRACTIVE! BLACK AND SILVER color, make kind off more special phone..!DESIGN PERFECTLY TIGHT MACH TO PHONE..! I didn't drop yet but I believe that it will keep phone safe..This case for sure is for somebody who is in motion and phone going true many activities,.....To bar or dinner I will keep it  in WALLET  case type..!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Little bulky but a great case. Looks good on the phone. Watched a couple reviews on this cover and it is another good cover from Spigen.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great value for the price. But it can be a little slippery if your hands are a little dirty, oily, or wet. Very beautifully constructed.  I use a glass screen saver from iLoome (would highly recommend) and this case is a tight fit ad if perfectly made and cut to fit a Note 3 with an iLoome screen saver.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Giving this 5 stars because the quality is great. I would recommend this to anyone who needs a slim case that has good protection and is stylish.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love my Note 3, but protecting it was a must.  Given the size of it, I wanted to get the smallest/thinnest case available, but a case that also was functional.  After some research, I decided on this one.  So far, I love it.  I unfortunately dropped it once, landing on the top left corner, and the phone was fine.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is one sexy looking case and equally matches the sexiness of a naked Note 3. The phone goes in the case pretty easily. Just put on the TPU inside case and snap the bezel in place and you're good to go. I'm going to list a few pro's and consPros:Sexy looking case - Let's face it, this case is sexy as hellAll the cut outs are perfectly aligned. I'm not sure if I can add this as a pro since I think it should be standard that all cases have aligned cut outs but I'll add this to as a pro since I've used cases that had horrible cut outs.Protects all parts of your phone. Protects the back camera, all 4 corners, top and bottom and screen of your phone. It looks and feels like it can definitely take a few drops or two.A flat back. This case is one of the few cases that actually has a straight flat back. Most cases round off to a flat back but this case is straight up flat. It's really a personal pro since not a lot of cases do this.Cons:The snap on bezel. The bezel is where the sexiness of the case comes from but it's made of plastic. Once you drop your phone, it will damage the bezel and will leave an ugly dent or crack. Speigen doesn't sell the bezels separately so it isn't really cheap to just replace it.Slippery. Since your hands are mostly going to be holding on to the phone via the bezel and the back, this case isn't the best when it comes to being "grippy". I like to hold my case naturally without much tension. With this phone, I feel like it might slip out of my hands if someone bumps into my lightly or something.Overall a great looking protective case. I'm not a fan of how slipper the case is but I think I'll get use to it.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Absolutely love the look and feel of this case.  It is sleek and good looking.  So much better looking than the otterbox.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This case is protective and doesn't take space. I mean you have to trade security against the look of a naked phone but, you know you can drop it and it will be history. I feel secure with this product, is not slippery and is an elegant classic look, is lightweight and protective. I installed sliding the phone in the whole body of the case (I didn't separate one part of the case and attach the other after), I read some reviews before and I followed them. All the ports are free for functional use. The charging port will work good if the original OEM Samsung AC charger is used (the after marked are short). Plus is an investment. Just think about it.  The shipping was speedy fast. And the packing is perfect. Don't look elsewhere. This is the one and this is the place!!!!!!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: A very attractive and slim case for my Note 3. A tad bit tedious to take off but still deserve 5 stars. I completely recommend it and it is one of the best out in the market.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I wanted a case that didn't add to much bulk to my already huge Galaxy Note 3. This case provides great protection while still keeping a slim profile. I love the rubberized feel to the case. The edges are slightly raised around the screen which allows me to place the phone face down while still protecting the screen from scratches.Spigen makes a great product and I would buy another one of these cases in a heart beat! The Neo Hybrid is definitely the case to own for all Galaxy Note 3 users!PROS:Rubberized case helps you grip the phone (no more drops!)Great protection while still keeping a slim profileSpigen quality craftsmanshipSmart buttons on the sidePerfectly placed holes for charger - S-PEN - etc.CONS:None that I can think of! - Get this case!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Very slim a elegant. Almost looks like no case on the note 3. It makes it a bit wider and with such a large phone...i didn't like that at first because back is sooooo smooth a soft. I found that my pinky knuckle fits perfect over the charge port which allows stability while holding it. Very smooth but that port for charging is placed well for balancing. I am still order a bunker ring to try with it. Good job on case...perfect fit.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: fits well looks great and no problems taking on or off. Have gotten a lot of complements and a real bargain.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This hybrid case is very nice, snug and a very durable case for the Galaxy Note 3.  It keeps everything away from the device (fingerprint, dirt, etc.) yet allows for a very comfortable and easy hold.  I recommend this to anyone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This has to be the best phone case I've ever owned. Works great with my wireless charging as well. Dropped my phone a few times already with no problems what so ever.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Here's a more common sense review. I ordered the Dante Red case, while apperance wise it looks great, the red looks more like red with a slight orange hue, but looks good. My only complaint is the case makes the phone slippery! The smooth back and the ultra slick painted outer ring makes the phone more prone to being dropped. Either the back case or the outer ring should be "grippy" to aid in grip. That's the entire reason Samsung went with the faux leather back. I considered painting the ring with a matte color or plastidip. Who knows... But consider apperance vs usefulness....
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I've had this case now for several weeks now.  When I first put it on, I was amazed at how nice it looked.  Granted, I don't think that this case will protect the phone to the level that I would like, but I purchased this product knowing its limitations.  The unit I received fit perfectly.  I was surprised that this case wasn't as bulky as I thought it would be.  I think a lot of people are having fitment issues because of improper installation.  I've seen numerous youtube videos of this case review where the reviewer would take the two pieces of the case apart before installing their phone.  They would install the "rubber" part on the phone first and then try to fit the "metal" aluminum portion over the rubber portion.  DO NOT DO THIS!  It is important that you keep the two pieces together when installing your phone into it.  All you have to do is drop the phone into the case the way it comes.  The case is a little bit slippery but I've never had problems with dropping my phone.  I've had other people comment on the case, thinking it was actually part of the phone and not a case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Case fits great and looks great on my note 3 just what I was looking for edge protection and a beautiful cover. Cut outs in all the right places large enough for the usb 3.0 charger plug, just great really pleased.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Case came on time. Probably the best looking case for the note 3 at the moment. Feels premium and doesn't add much bulk. Fit is perfect and easiest to put case on with both pieces already assembled. Gives the phone a heavier and sturdier feel. Love it so far!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love the look of the case. But I think i spoiled myself with using the phone without a case for so long that this case adds to much bulk. That's just my opinion. It's still a great case just a little to wide for my liking.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Epic fail Spigen. Shame on you. Why didn't you make it with aluminum? Especially for the price. The rubber case part is very well made. Anyhow...do something about this. For those looking for a great case check out Luvvitt.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I have been using this case for 6 weeks now, and I can say that it fits perfectly my Samsung Galaxy Note 3. It seems sturdy without adding too much bulk or weight to my phone. So far, I am extremely pleased with its looks and its performance.I love the rubber lip around the screen: I can leave my phone upside down without fear of scratching its great screen.And... it looks sexy, I've had some nice feedbacks from people who saw it.Yes, cases for Android are getting better every day, and that's good news!Don't miss this one if you wish to protect your Note 3.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Awesome case in everyway. I loved it so much that I bought it in white and red. It provides great coverage while not increasing the overall size of the phone. I highly recommend the case. The only thing they need to do is let you by just the outside bracket in the color that you want. The inside black holder is the same for all of them so to keep buying that if you want a different color outside bracket makes no sense, but I know it's all about making money so no it is definitely not a deal breaker in anyway; just a suggestion and observation I sent to the Spigen Company as well. I am not disappointed in my purchase at all, I personally Love Everything About This Case!!!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a great looking case and very minimalistic. One thing that could be improved is that fact that it doesn't improved the grip of the phone. The back has a not grip but one would think so from looking at it.

reviewText: I have seen a few negative reviews because of the delay in shipment. Mine too took a while from the promised date (I ordered it prior to release date).
