All the holes align well, there are enlarged buttons on the outer surrounding for the power and volume buttons. I had no trouble taking out the S-pen or plugging in the charger.  Material quality feels excellent and overall fits the phone very snug. I would highly recommend this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love the sleek look that this case brings. It is not bulky at all. The contrasting color adds to the sweet look of this case. The buttons are very easy to use. There is no interference with the camera and the stylus is easy to retrieve. I have use this case yet, but see my review for the Spigen SGP10453 Neo Hybrid Case for Samsung Galaxy Note 3. I had brought two case so that I could change up.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Excellent case. The matte black back looks so much better than the Galaxy Note's  plastic faux leather back. The rose gold casing is beautiful while not being "gaudy", and the bump on the sides protects the screen pretty well from drops. My only complaints that keep it from being a give is is slightly bulky, I had trouble plugging in certain headphones and usb plugs. But still a very good case
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Although this fits really well for the Note 3 (Verizon) it is a 2 piece design. Full part goes over phone & second part snaps over edge of the phone giving you the red look to the phone. The red is very bright (not like shown in image) also slippery & this case added a lot of weight to my phone. I do not like how heavy my phone is now at all. My husband bought a case from Verizon for $32 out the door and it added 0 weight to his phone. I went and got one and am sending this one back. If you do not mind a heavy phone, this is perfect for you. If you like the Note 3 to remain light, look elsewhere for a case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Best case ever!!! Just buy it!!! Thin, slick, and super stylish! I love this case super legit, the best everyone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Nice looking case, but will stick with the otterbox. This was exchanged due to shipping issues but would have been nice if i got this first. Design is nice and lightweight.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I have had lots of cases for the Note 3, from UAG & Otter box to just a $5 clear plastic cover and everything between. This one is superior to all by far, based on my needs of a case of course. This case adds the shock protection you want along with the front lip to allow the phone to be placed screen down on a surface without actual screen contact. All buttons and cut outs form to phone perfectly. It is definitely sleek looking and without a doubt, the smallest footprint of a case for this phone. It barely increases the size of the phone and most people don't even realize its a case, they think that its my phone. I get asked all the time, "Why don't you have a case?" I like that. Some people complain about the install, but if you install it as 1 piece and start with putting the bottom of the phone in first, its easy. The only downside I've found is that if you have bought any cheaper charging cords off of amazon or ebay for the Note 3, the base of the plug that connects to the phone is larger than that of the charger that come with the phone. These cheaper usb cords may not be able to fit in the charger cut out on this case as mine for my car does not. I don't fault that to this case as the Samsung charger fits just fine. All in all, my search for the right case for my Note 3 ended when I bought this. Its a great case at a great price!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: very slim and fits perfect. Have to take off when plugging mp3 but not a big deal. doesnt feel bulky. happy with the amount i paid.also comes in great package
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Bought this case for my husband.  It looks very nice.  Slightly larger than other cases, but protective and stylish.  Worth the money
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great case! Great material! I have never used a case for my phones before and I was afraid that using one with my Note 3 would make it feel bigger and cheap; however, although it does feel larger and heavier, it makes it look cool, it feels solid, well protected.The only thing I don't like, although not enough to not give this case 5 stars, is that the dust allocates at the edge of the screen. Not a big deal.My Note 3 now looks more premium, as the phone it is!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Those looking for an everyday case that adds negligible size and heft to your new Note 3 - this is probably the case for you.  Looks great, extremely easy to attach, cutouts are razor sharp and precise, buttons work like a charm and it provides the right amount of protection for my daily needs.  I carry my phone with me at all times and it gets heavy use but I should say that I'm relatively careful with my devices and don't ever put them through Otter Box/Lifecase type abuse.  The red is a bit "muted" in person compared to some of the online photos, but it's still shiny and adds nice color to the device.  I also bought a Spigen BOUNCE case as backup but I don't see myself switching out as often as I originally thought due to my satisfaction with this case.  A+
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Everything about this Spigen case screams design genius and elegance. The buttons and ports are machined perfection. The colored bumper offers great contrast to the black of the TPU and will add a level of exceptionalism to the Note 3. My only gripe is the extreme slippery feeling TPU material. It is VERY difficult to maintain a secure grip fir me.... As I am not a 'grabber' of my device but more of a 'glider'. I like to side my device up and down in my hand during one-handed operation and where the Spigen Bounce or Slim Armor case offers a nice level of resistance to my fingers the Neo-hybrid will side completely from my grasp. Still though this case is second to none in terms of design, but there is the trade off to live with.  Others have said that the protection is andi comprised with this case, or the fit is not as secure as they would like. I am in staunch disagreement with that position, the case doesn't give me any concerns with the protection it offers the over sized Note 3, and the fit is latex glove tight
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The look and style is great. I took off a star for it being too slippery especially from the back.

reviewText: Excellent ! Super fit looks really good on note 3 only the thing is makes your note 3 little bit bigger should thin the rubber

reviewText: This item is as advertise, I was a little disappointed with this case, It looks good is fits great but for me it doesn’t protect the phone that good I will give it a 3 out of 5 for looks I will give 5 out of 5. title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: YES! This is my summer go to case as Otterbox is my winter ( I dropped my phone in the slush) case. Very form fitting, super slim. All buttons are accessible as is the pen. title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Decent case I guess, fits well and would offer some basic protection if dropped on the corner.  I like the metal slate color as advertised/purchased but it doesn't really contrast from the main part of the black case.It adds very minimal bulk to the phone, which is nice on the Note 3, but I think for what you get, it's a bit overpriced.Would be better if it had some kind of non-skid coating/rubbery material on the back to keep it from sliding around when it's on a table or flat surface.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I'm not exactly sure what people are doing wrong who say this doesn't fit right. To them I say, operator error. It fits absolutely perfectly and looks amazing on my phone. By far the best case I've found yet for the Note 3, and I've tried a lot. It looks sleek, feels good in my hand and gives the phone a more "square" look to it, which is exactly what I was looking for.DON'T try to put the rubber on first then the bumper, you'll fail. Put the whole thing on at once. This is a beautiful case and since it's shipped by Amazon now, I got it within one day using prime. Finally found the case I was looking for. Well done on the quality.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: first a note on the packaging for this.  There is literally 3x the amount of plastic and weight to the packaging of this and the product.  completely unneeded in this day and age.Case is really nice looking and very well made - exact fit, etc.Looks like it would provide decent protection.Side buttons work perfect - as good as no case or netter.Like many cases, the headphone opening is too small for many many cables.  Cables are starting to change for this, but many existing cables will not fit.  And this case would be harder to modify with a tool make biggerThe sides of this case (the colored part) are way too slick.  the back, rubber, is better, but still slick.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Wanted a case that didn't add to much bulk to my Note 3 so i opted to get this one.Pros:- Stylish and fits really well with the note 3. The openings for the camera and stylus were perfect- Does offer great protection in case of accidental drop-page-  If you have a Qi wireless charging capabilities installed on this phone. The case won't block it, Qi wireless charge worksCons- Theres no proper grip so it can easily slide from your hands- The volume controls and power button are encased with another push button which is annoying those button pieces can easily get lost while taking off the case-  The middle external frame ended up breaking after 3 months which makes the whole case useless now. For the price I wish the quality was much betterOver all 3/5. It does offer great protection but does a major flow if the middle external frame is breaks it renders the whole case useless. As you can see from other reviewers have had this problem,
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Very stylish and not bulky, but grip is non-existent and there have been reports of the paint finish coming off eventually.  Mine didn't fit snug around the edges, which apparently is also a common problem.  It'll do nicely as a spare case, but I no longer use this as my main case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Looks great on my phone and is easy to remove if I need to take off to replace the battery or memory card.  It does not look like it will withstand a bad fall but should offer just enough protection for indoor drops and it is not one of those ugly mega phone cases, I hate.  I like the yellow one but think the red one would be nice too.  headphone jack may not fit all headphones, as the hole is narrow but I have not had an issue with what I use.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I was really looking forward to this case for my Note 3 and it did not disappoint me. The phone fit perfectly snug.  I love the red color on just the sides (with a little bit on the back near the S-Pen).  The case barely adds any bulk to the phone.  All the holes line up nicely.  The back is smooth which some people may like, but I think adding a texture to it would help it feel less likely to slip from the hand. Same with on the sides.  They could have added some kind of non slip texture to the color on the sides where you grip the phone, or something and still kept a sleek look.Overall, I'm very happy with this case and recommend it.  Although it is at a premium price.  I bought several brands of cases for my note, and even though this is the most expensive, it isn't my favorite case.  I prefer the Caseology Slim Fit Flexible TPU Case for under $6.00.  Just my preference.  But I still like this one.  I', the type who likes variety and this is still going to be used.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I bought this case twice. Yes, twice with two different color. Not because I change my mind about the color. Rather, I found a same problem with this case, no matter what color.First one I bought is gold color. Everything works fine except the power button not sitting perfect like the volume button. The power button side of the plastic ring will not sit completely into the slot of the silicone case. No matter how you install the phone into the case, same result. Maybe I've a defective? So I return the gold color and order a white. Expect same problem with the power button not sitting 100%. I'll still buy from Spigen
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Case is very well made. Most people can't tell there is a case on the phone, they think the phone was made this way and compare it to the Iphone style because of the metal-looking frame. Case is all plastic and TPU, but is well engineered and manufactured. The buttons work wonderful. Plenty of room to put your finger and take the stylus out. The only downside to me is the price, no plastic case should cost twenty dollars, especially having in mind that the manufacturing price is less than a dollar probably. Other than that, good job on making it. Buy it, you won't regret it.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I purchased a couple different styles of Spigen phone cases and this is my least favorite. It makes the phone more bulky and smoth edge is slicker to hold.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I've had no problems with this case. It doesn't add size to the phone. Its truly a sleek looking case. I use it in conjunction with the MIME USA glass screen protector and I do feel like my phone is protected. No installations problems at all for me. I took it directly out of the pack and in went my phone. Everything fit perfect. Love this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a pretty nice case, so far I haven't dropped my phone so as far as the protection part goes I don't know yet.  It fits very nicely, and all the buttons work properly.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Really pleased with this case.  The Note 3 is already a rather large phone, and I don't feel like this case added too much extra bulk, all while still offering great protection.  I actually I find the phone easier to hold/use with the little extra thickness.  Installation was easy, only thing is I wouldn't follow the installation instructions provided.  I found it was easier to snap my phone in while the case was "put together" rather than put the phone in the TPU piece and then try to pry the hard bumper over that.overall, really impressed with the case, and I like the Metal Slate color a lot.  Only downside was my volume button was a little loose.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: beautiful case. It protects the phone and its very slim. love the color and it allows easy access of the s-pen
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Ordered early morning (like 4 AM CDT or 2 AM  PDT) on the day this case supposed became in stock and available, which was 10/7/13. I was expecting the 1-2 bus. day time around time for processing plus USPS mailing time like everyone else, so basically about a week for delivery as per Spigen's standard shipping policy in the domestic US. I was excited when the a shipping label was created on 10/11 and expected delivery early week of 10/13. However, like most other people only the label was created, but the package was never received by USPS. What this meant is that my account was charged the $24.99 as in Amazon's eyes the order was completed. However, after checking tracking status, even today, it still says USPS doesn't have the package.Sadly, no sorry for the delay in shipping or any kind of proactive correspondence on behalf of Spigen was sent to customers who bought their products in good faith. Any half-way decent and reputable company does this to reduce customer dissatisfaction, because sitting, waiting, and not knowing what is happening with the prolonged order process is worse than knowing what is really going on. It was up to me to contact Spigen on 10/14 due to their delays, which is atrocious customer service BTW. I have better luck with sellers from overseas on eBay who are more proactive and better at providing customer service than Spigen. However, brownie points are awarded to Spigen with a response the very next day (10/15).The reason for the delay, they claim, is due to a final quality check from the manufacturer and they aren't even in stock at their warehouse yet but are expecting them sometime this week. How does a company sell a product on Amazon that says it is in stock, when it isn't. Then, create a shipping label for a product they physically don't have yet. Finally, collect money from Amazon customer's because the order process is marked as complete when this label is created or after a certain period of time in which the order was created, whichever comes first.The bottom line is that I was counting on this product to help protect my device that retails for $699, now my phone has been naked for nearly 2 weeks too long. I am usually very careful on purchases online, but this has been the worst purchase experience I have had through Amazon or the internet in the last 15 years. I simply can't wait any longer. The kicker is that I can no longer cancel the order through Amazon as they have finalized the order despite the fact that the order is far from complete. I filed a complaint through Amazon, due me being charged for product that has never shipped and for Spigen selling an item they claim to have in stock when they clearly don't.I would normally go back to Incipio, but currently they are pre-order only basis with an estimated ship time of 2 weeks. Hey, at least they are upfront and honest. I would suggest to anyone that they look elsewhere for their Galaxy Note 3 Case needs, because in my eyes Spigen is not handling the "unexpected" delay very well from a customer standpoint. This was the first and most likely will be the last purchase of a Spigen product unless they create great customer service overnight.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Due entirely to its size, this is my least favorite Note 3 case. I have large to extra large hands (at least in the opinion of most glove manufacturers), and no issue with the size of the Note without a case. With this case, the phone is too wide and bulky for me to operate comfortably with one hand, and the rectangular edges don't fit well in a pants pocket. That being said, it did fit the phone well, the lip over the face was unobtrusive, and I very much liked the feel of the buttons.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Good case at a fair price. 4 months later case is holding up great with some minor signs of wear. Case has survived some pretty nasty spills on the ground and only suffered scratches. Mine didn't break like some of the other buyers claim. Build quality is good and case is so slim most people didn't even notice it was in a case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great case that is very slim and works well. I've dropped the case several times with no damage to the phone or the case. Like others have pointed out, the easiest way to put it on is as one piece, put the bottom in first, then push the top on. Would definitely buy this case again.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Love the case! I get so many people asking me what phone I have and case. First time I get compliments on a case I have for my phone. Best case I purchased. Comes in different colors and it's great. Doesn't attract finger prints and feels comfortable when holding it. It can be just a but bulky but it's just fine and that slightly added bulk adds good protection for impact. I would buy another one if they only sold the bumper pieces separate to have different colors. No complaints here though. A must buy!!!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I totally love this case, it makes my phone look slim and it feels great too, and it is really easy to get the spin out.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This case makes me feel like I'm Robocop or Batman or something.  It's so slick, gives great protection, and the buttons are so easy to access.  It adds a bit of bulk, but not too much.  The back is sleek and sophisticated.  The only problem i have with this case, is the back is fairly slippery.  not a lot of grip there, especially in cold weather with dry hands.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I ordered the Spiegen case and Spigen Glast Slim screen protector, when installing the screen protector, it was flawed, and wouldn't seat right, so i attempted to contact the company, only to find after an hour of looking there was NO customer service available, finally on Yelp i got a phone number in south Orange county Ca. so i called...  got their answering recording, stating they were open weekdays from 8/5, but it was 2pm on a week day, and no one was there??,  after 6 days, i received a email from them, but the seller had already replaced the screen cover..  i don't trust or even believe there are a legitimate company, and its a Buyer Beware order!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I really wanted to like this case. I read a bunch of reviews and notice that some people were complaining that the case doesn't fit properly. I read that you need to put the case on as one piece, not two like the instructions indicate.I have spent the last 40 minutes playing with this case to try and get it to fit properly and I just cannot do it. I have tried to put the case on as one piece and as two pieces, no go for me. Others may be able to do it, but it just does not work for me. I really do not think it should be this difficult anyway. I will give it another day and try a couple more times, but this case is most likely going back to Amazon.The case itself is actually quite nice. A bit slippery but it would seem to do a good job protecting the Note 3 if you happened to drop it from a normal height. It was packaged well but with very limited instructions, which normally would be fine, it is only a case after all. For me, since I cannot get the case to actually fit properly (The right side is not fitting correctly, so the face of the phone is actually above the case lip), so if it did drop, and happened to land on the face, it would probably break.I will update if I ever do get it to work.***12-18-2013 Update***I remembered today that I changed the battery door on my phone a few weeks ago. I purchased the Samsung OEM battery cover that allows you to charge the Note 3 using a Qi Wireless charger. Although it does not look any different than the original, the new back cover is actually a tiny bit thicker than the original. This explains why the case will not fit. I have also read some other comments on other sites that seems to confirm this conclusion.  So, it is not the case at all, it is the new wireless back that makes this case unusable for me. So, if you do go the wireless cover route, know that cases like this one will no longer work. I am adding more stars to my original review since I really do like this case and want to use it, but I do not want to give up my wireless charging.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Good quality case that does not add any additional width to the case. Does give the phone a little more weight to the phone, but the one thing that I love is that the soft layer is raised a millimeter or two so that if you lay it face down the phone is not resting on the screen itself. The champagne gold bumper accent gives it its own uniqueness and protection.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I purchased this case and I must say I am very satisfied with my case. I have not dropped my phone at all since putting this case on and it even fits into the belt holster I purchase before this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: After looking at reviews for this case, I ordered it. It is a great looking case, the gold/black case looks similar at an iPhone 5S, except in size. Looking at the encased phone, my Note 3 appears well protected all around and on the phone's back. Unless an accident happens to the screen side of the phone, it is impossible to know how much this case would protect the face of it.I originally liked the Samsung S "wallet case", but I did not care for the additional flap on the face of the phone, since I want to be able to see the entire screen of the phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Case looks great and feels great.  The silicone (black part of the case) feels sturdy, not like that silicone that stretches out over time and your phone slips out.  The surrounding frame looks and feels great.  the side buttons feel like you're pressing the actual phone buttons, I really like that.  Some people talk about fit issues, I had no issue at all.  Does not add a lot of bulk, phone still feels sleek.  Easy access to al ports...except (this is the issue I had) the headphone jack access.  headphones for the most part are fine, but I use a line in 3.5mm cable and the plastic around the cable is to thick and is held back by the case.  Probably not a problem for most, but just something to keep in mind.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love this case. Makes my Note 3 look amazing couldnt be happier. I got the Dante Red colour fits perfectly. NFC still works perfectly as well, all my headphones fit and it doesnt obstruct the spen. Love you spigen
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The outside rubber is very cmooth. It is slippery, It looks great, but if you have normal sized hands, I felt it did not give me enough grip to feel comfortable holding a nearly $1000 phone.I bought the Hyperion for 1/4 the price, and it is superior. Unless of course your a pro Basketball player and have a 15 inch hand span.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a nice case.  It looks nice on the phone and keeps your phone looking trim, thin and polished.  Not bulky in any way.  The well for the S Pen is decent size for larger fingers.  Nice detail on all the edges and cutouts.  It is slim, sleek and very form fitting while still offering full surround protection with added "enhanced shock absorption" for those accidental drops...UGH! hurts just thinking about them.There is only one reason why I did not rate it a 5.  The sleek material makes the phone extremely slippery in your hands.  I wish the manufacturers would remember that this is a HUGE phone.  Because of its size, it is extremely easy for it to slip out of ones hands. Now again...this is a nice and very attractive case.  It really is.  But as I hold my phone in my hands, it feels very slick/slippery and offers no grip whatsoever.  It feels as if it is going to slip right out of my hands.  Even some sort of small, embedded (inconspicuous) rubberized grip strip on the sides of the case (maybe under the power and volume controls) would serioulsy make a huge difference.  It would have been absolutely perfect if it offered some grip.  I would have even ordered it in more colors just to style my phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This case fits the phone perfectly and makes for a very small profile.  Make sure when you put the case on, you put it on with both the bumper and main case together.  Doing the main case first then the bumper is a sure fire way to make the case not fit properly.  I would say the only thing you may have to worry about is the case feeling a bit slippery, but not as slippery as a naked Note 3.  I just wish Spigen would start selling the bumper part separately and in different colors.  I would love to see a bumper in green!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I saw this case when considering the purchase of a Note 3 and, honestly, this contributed to my decision to get the phone.  A great phone can be ruined by a bad case but a great case really improves the device experience.The case feels like it's really well made, it feels great in the hand and the yellow is a nice deep tone rather than a canary yellow.Installing it was a breeze.  Tip; Do not disassemble the case into its two components.  Leave it assembled and snap the phone in. Done!The colored bumper is made of a slick plastic to I will have to be a little more careful when holding the phone.  Coming from a grippy rubber case on my Note 2, everything does feel a little less sticky but the back has a rubber feel so there is still some traction available.  I'm not too concerned about it.The phone looks great in the case and it's not bulky.  If you're used to using a Note series phone, this case won't feel any bigger in the hand than the phone itself, in my opinion.One minor quip is that the ports for the stereo jack and the s-pen are a little deep.  It takes me more effort to get the S-Pen out and the stereo cable in my truck won't quite snap in with this case on it.  I'm going to just get a new cable.  They're cheap enough.Anyway, get this case. I don't think you will regret it!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: My son got one for his S3 and talked me into buying this for my S Note.  I LOVE IT!  It's well made, but the best part is the back to it.  It's so soft.  I don't know if it'll protect any better than another brand or an even cheaper one but it looks beautiful! To protect the front (glass) on my phone I put on a good screen protector.  Overall, I love it.  If you only want something to protect your edges and back, go with something cheaper, if you want something that protects the edges,looks good, is well made, and feels wonderful get this product.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case is very nice. It protects the phone well without adding much width to the phone. The note 3 is a pretty slimline device. My only complain would be the depth it adds. That can't really be avoided though, without risking protection of the device.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Awesome case!!!!!! Very stylish but it protects the phone. Very slim amd it slides right kn pocket. Best case i have bought so far for my phone
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great looking case, fits perfect. The hard plastic outer part of the case adds a small amount of bulk. On most phones this isn't and issue, but for me, it just makes the phone a tad too big for my hands.All that said, this is an excellent product, very high quality.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This was my favorite case for a long time until I got the Trident cyclops.Neo Hybrid is one of the better looking cases out there. However the sides are a bit glossy and not as grippy as I would likeThe case will pprotect from minor bumps ad scratches but I'm not sure if it'll protect the Note 3 completely from a fallWhy I went with the Trident cyclops.  The cyclops may weigh even less than the Neo Hybrid case and protects it way better
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a really nice case, really nice. I had a Caseology case and thought it protected well, although the few drops I had weren't anything major, but dropping a $700 phone is scary anytime lol. The Neo Hybrid is a two part case, and to fit it correctly, I put the rubber, or TPU part on first, then popped on the bumper or outer shell. It fits just fine, and man with the black Note 3 this case looks and feel about $50 more lol. It's really sleek... I can't explain it really. I wanted the red but I felt it would have been too red. Protection wise, seems like it would survive a good fall. You have two pieces working together to help protect your major investment. It has a lip on the front of the phone and a little lip for the camera. ONE MAJOR THING THO! The charging port with this case on only seems to accept usb 3.0 cords that have the same build as the cord that came with the phone. Cords that have those fat, thick ends won't even connect. For example, I bought a cable from a company called CableMatters and while the cable worked, was pretty thick, just an overall SOLID usb cable, it just didn't fit with the Hybrid case on because the end was too thick. There's a few cables with those smaller ends on Amazon that you can buy if your Samsung cable messed up (like mine did). Check Elite Tech on Amazon for one. Compare the two companies and you'll see what I'm talking about. I'd probably give it a 4.5 if I could for that, but a 4 doesn't do this case justice.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This gets good reviews online, but for a phone as big as the note 3, this makes the phone too big and slippery for me. It is well made though.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case is slim and light but still provides good protection to the back, sides and corners of my phone. I think it looks very sharp. I left the back case of my phone off when I put this on to help make it slimmer. I also got a wireless charging receiver for my phone and it works through this case.  It's not super easy to put on our take off but I don't plan to do that very often. But the reason that it's difficult to remove is that the case is so form fitting and slim, so worth the trade off to me. The buttons on the side feel like they are part of the phone - they are appropriately responsive and not difficult to press at all.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a sleek, elegant case for the GN3. I have no complaints about the fit or finish, I installed the GN3 with the plastic ring in place as recommended by other buyers, and this worked very well. The fit is snug and secure. I had previously installed a Verizon branded  tempered glass screen protector, and the edge of the case matched up very well with the edges of this protector. There is nothing wrong with this case. I bought a case designed for beauty and elegance, and that is exactly what this case is. However, I need a little more protection. I need a slightly deeper inset for the screen to protect it when face down. I need a grippier surface on the edges. The plastic bezel is very shiny and very slippery. The case is quite thin, maintaining the sleekness of the GN3, but in combination with the glossy edge surfaces, it means that picking up the phone from a table or desk requires a very firm grasp. The case slides very easily into and out of a front pocket, and thinness is a virtue in this respect. However, going back to my need for a grippier edge, I took GREAT care when removing the phone from my pocket to avoid losing it on the way out. The buttons are very functional, and the pressure needed to activate is just right.In summary, if you need a sleek and fashionable case that will enhance the elegance of the GN3 while giving fairly good protection in gentle use, you can't go wrong with this case. I ended up returning it in favor of a case with a little less elegance and a little more ruggedness. I will review those cases separately. (Otterbox Commuter in Surf Blue and Urban Armor Gear in Rust Orange.)
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: My wife LOVES the Neo Hybrid case. she likes the soft touch feel of the black rubber, its nice that there is a wider opening for her to grab the pen out with her nails and the white side looks amazing with her white phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Best case I've ever owned.  This case gives my phone a great look.  Everyone thinks its the actual phone and not a case.  I also added a tempered glass screen protector.  I've dropped my phone a few times from about 2 ft and it has survived impact every time.  Side buttons are soft and fit perfectly to the phones buttons.  My suggestion is to put the phone in with the case assembled because trying to do it one at a time is a pain.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I wanted a case that would provide some protection for my Note 3 without adding a lot of size or weight.  The Neo Hybrid provides a good compromise.  It provides greater drop protection than one of the folding covers while adding less size and weight than an OtterBox.  I also wanted a case that was attractive and doesn't look like a simple rubber sleeve - the Neo Hybrid satisfies that requirement as well.  While some people have pointed out that the thin outer polycarbonate shell may crack if dropped, and that could very well be true for some drops, I feel that's also a reasonable compromise for the size and looks.  I do agree that Spigen should sell the frames as an accessory (besides drops, some people might want to change colors), but that's not enough to dock a star from it.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: i have one of these for my nexus 5 so i decided to get one for my note 3. well i put it on just slipping the phone into the case like mentioned previously and it doesnt fit correctly. the sides pop out. so i spent $20 on a case thats useless and the button holes dont even line up. i would love a replacement. or atleast someone from spigen to contact me.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love the speech in case if a text my phone and it looks really coolthe color pops out and looks really nice
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Bought it for my dad and he loves it, very thin but very durable. I recommend it for anyone with the Samsung Note3
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: LOVED THIS CASE FOR THE 1ST COUPLE MONTHS. BUT IT TOOK THEM TOO LONG TO PUT OUT THE REPLACEMENT COLOR FRAMES. SO I LOST INTEREST. i GOT A NEW WATERPROOF OBEX CASE NOW FROM SEIDIO. THATS A BEST BUY.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: the fit and finish of this case is REALLY exceptional for the money. Goes on as 2 pieces they line up very nicely together and the buttons on the case feel just as crisp as they do on the naked device, which is NOT common, very nice. The outward appearance of the case is very slick and slim, unlike a lot of the otterboxes and similar cases. That said, it's probably not as iron clad of protection as those cases but I feel that this case could take most drops pretty well. The sleek look, and crisp response from the buttons make this case a real stand out for the Note 3,
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I still have it on my note 3 and holding pretty good, I have also dropped my phone about 3 times and the case has done it's job, so I am very happy with the case, plus it feels very nice on the hand, and I like that the camera don't touch the outside anymore. happy customer here..
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Does add a good amount of protection, but does make the phone look hideous, its in between slim and a thick case. Look elsewhere if you want a slimmer case. I've used the neo hybrid on my previous S4, and now the Note 3, i guess i am done with it. SPIGEN needs to come up with something new for the neo hybrid, how about trying to give a new look and feel to the black rubberized case itself to start with.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Excellent case, and workmanship, plus the case doesnt add much bulk to the very slim note3 gets lots of compliments!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Am always happy when it comes to their products. Love the color and the sturdiness to the case. Great buy
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: It's a beautiful case despite it being cheaply made. It's a flimsy case. I must take the phone out of the case to plug in the USB 3.0 cable. Such a codling case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great case! Doesn't feel too big in hand, Slim Armor is bigger, and looks great. Easy to install and remove.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: i absolutely love this case!!! most stylish case out there for the note3! very sleek it doesnt add bulk to the phone and it just makes your phone look soo sexy lol definitely recommend!!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Like many others who ordered this case I had shipping issues and delays. I left my issues with the seller under the seller feedback, however for the case itself. I have no problems with the case. The case finally arrived and I can not be happier. The case is slim and very nice. The secret to putting the case on correctly is putting the whole case on in one piece and not in two pieces. I tried several times to put the case on one piece at at time the rubber backing first then the outer plastic part and it wasn't fitting right. I was almost to quick to call it a defect looking at the previous reviews, but I finally went on youtube and saw a video that showed how to properly put on the case. I put the case back together the rubber backing and plastic ring and snapped it on in one piece, the phone slid right in no problem, no gaps, no bulges, no issues. All the buttons work fine, all the ports work fine. I have no problems with the case I will recommend this case to anyone, just beware that the product might not come on the date promised and you will not hear from the seller but the case itself is a true beauty.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: A great case for a night out on the town or to just use on a daily basis.  Provides great protection and gets many compliments.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case is very nice and holds the phone tight and doesn't feel like it's gonna fall out.  The reason I give it 3 stars is because when I took it out of the package the plastic down by the charging port was bent and almost broken.  I don't feel like waiting for a replacement and leaving my phone unprotected so i'm just gonna keep it but you can bet i'll never order another spigen case because of this.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I own 3 other cases for this phone and this is the overall best.  Styling makes it look part of the phone.  Slim, with all the cut outs perfect (including the S Pen cutout, which allows easy access to the Pen.  The color ring will likely not survive a fall and it WOULD be great if Spigen offered replacement rings.  However, the primary function of a case is to prevent major damage when you drop your phone, and this provides great protection in a small size.  If you want indestructible, get an Otter Box.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is an obscenely beautiful case. I just cannot get over how nice the cases of Spigen are. The case fits well and offers a reasonable level of protection
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Fits my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 well and matches its gold trim. I recommend it to protect your cell phone..
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Wonderful product, protected mi Note 3 from fall 1 meter high!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I was a little bit skeptical at first after the reading the negative comments about the case not fitting the phone. Actually if fits perfectly and looks elegant, feels well made, and most importantly protects the phone. one thing that I don't like is that it increases the width a bit of an already wide phone, but that is to be expected. other than that I'm pleased with my purchase and would recommend the case to anyone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is probably one of the best Note 3 cases I have seen, they are not to bulky and they hardly add weight to the phone. Plus it gives the buttons a better feel once this case is on.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Nice slim case, first impression was it was kinda cheap. It really don't add a lot of unwanted bulk to the phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Case fits my samsung galaxy note 3 like a glove. Looks good.  Wish the band was textured because it is slick and could slip out of my hand
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: When I first got this case, I returned because i thought it made my very non iphone look just like an iphone.  Back it went, and I chose the Spiegen Ultra Fit.  That case fit the phone so well you could barely tell it was there.  But I learned the hard way that it only protected against scratched.  So after a few months being careful, I dropped it and realized I need more protection. Ordered this case again and its fantastic.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Listen, I love this case but don't expect to drop your $600.00 cellphone and have it survive! Don't follow the instructions-just gently push one end of your Note 3 into the case pieces together, then the other end. Don't take the colored side piece off of the black TPU. And you better have a tempered glass screen protector on this phone now too! I like the one I had installed at the Verizon Wireless Store for $24.99 with a customer discount that brought the price down to $18.74. Do NOT buy the Spigen Glas.tR-overpriced! Believe this Neo Hybrid case is gorgeous (I got the Dante Red) but it is kind of flimsy and I didn't even like laying it on a hard surface, let alone if it was dropped! Also the lip on the front is just about nonexistent, so you won't feel comfortable laying it on its face either. I loved the look, but I caved and put the phone back into an Otterbox Commuter case. I wish Otterbox would make their cases more eye-catching instead of just functional...oh well, that's a different review!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case is protective and fits really well. The issue is I hate the color it's candy apple red just looks different to me. Of course I have a white phone. I kinda hate this
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I included a recap of another case review first, then offer differences with this Spigen Neo Hybrid afterwards.Just like I mentioned in my review of the "Spigen Slim (Ultra Fit) - I really, really don't like to use cases/covers, etc with my phone. I just like enjoying the look/feel of the phone as it was made/designed. This changed when I got my Note 3 because it is just a bigger phone that I just didn't feel as confident holding.When I decided to get a case, I wanted to find 1-2 cases that were lightweight and added minimal size/bulk to the Note 3. I choose:1. The Spigen Slim (Ultra Fit)2. Spigen Neo HybridI will post pictures of the phone "naked" and with each case for comparison.Now for the Neo Hybrid... The case fits fairly well. There was a little more give than I expected once  the case was on, but it was still very snog. It was fairly easy to get on if you follow the directions.However, my major complaint (for my needs) is that this just ruins the look and feel of the Note 3. Yes, I want my phone protected, but not at the cost of making it look/feel like I am carrying around a rubber brick. This is far from the chunkiest case out there and Spigen did a great job of offering a "sleek" case that is also protective, but it just doesn't suit my needs. Besides the blocki-ness of the case, the case was designed well and looks appealing - albeit blocky.If you are looking for a protective case that looks pretty nice for its type, than this case may be fore you. If you want something more minimal, try the Spigen Slim (Ultra Fit) or similar.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: At first, I wasn't a big fan of this case and was quite let down by the purchase.The case feels ok, and fits fine, but has a slight rattle in the buttons (which cover the phone's buttons). The black backing, while made of rubber, is not very tacky. In the past, I have favored phone cases that wouldn't slide around on a table or the center console in my truck. I thought this one would fit the bill, but the backing is still fairly slick and slides off my console. Additionally, at least one USB 3 cable I have tried to use would not fit in the phone with this case on due to impacting the side of the case.That being said, the case has really grown on me. It seems to protect the phone well (I have dropped it several times), looks nice, and doesn't add a lot of bulk to the phone. I have gotten over my complaints, and having compared this case to ones that colleagues have, I like this one better. While initially disappointed, I have come to the conclusion that this is still a fine case for the note 3.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: High quality and very stylish. Unlike many cases that give you good protection this case also looks good.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Looks nice and can get chargers in without issue. I wish my Note 3 was black so it matched the case better.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I have owned Spigen Products before in the past and have had great experiences with their products so deciding to purchase this case was a pretty easy decision.  The case is slim and offers some protection.  All the ports and buttons are very accessible. The soft touch rubber is well soft and offers a pretty good grip.  I would def recommend to anyone looking for a slimmer case that is stylish and has a soft touch rubber back. I have also not just recommended this case to family and friends but I have purchased it for family and friends as well.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Does a good job the case has a slight lip to it protects the screen if you inadvertently lay it down on its screen, It feels as if it should protect it if I let it fall.All in all I would buy it again with no qualms.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a good case. It is thin, lightweight, durable and adds very little thickness or bulk to a very light "big" phone. The only complaint that i have with it is the cutout area around the S-Pen has a sharp corner that makes typing painful unless you file it down. This will leave blemish on the case.I have also ordered the -- Spigen Samsung Galaxy Note 3 Screen Protector Glass [GLAS.tR SLIM] Rounded Edges Tempered Glass Screen Protector Clear / Anti-Chip for Galaxy Note III -- and will see how they go together.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This adds just enough bulk to make the phone feel more secure in my hands, but not so much that it feels like a larger device.  Unfortunately, it's broken on me.  The plastic bumper is fairly flexible...and thin.  It broke easily-- I'm not sure if it was from putting the case back on or from a fall.  Part of the plastic broke by the volume rocker, making the silver button on the case fall out.  Now, when in the case, I can't control my phone's volume unless I get a fingernail in through the groove.  It's a shame.  I've had this for just under a month.The other problem I have is with the headphone jack opening.  I need to buy a smaller aux cable with a thinner profile to get a solid connection for use in the car-- OR take my case off.  For now I've been taking the case off.  But that kind of defeats the purpose of having a protector.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: First off, it takes about 10 days to get here so look else where if you are needed one sooner.  I think the case itself will protect the phone from a drop, but it adds a little more bulk to the phone than I like.  I came from a Note 1 and now it feels about the same width, which defeats the purpose of getting the slimmer Note 3.Pros:-Good Quality ; Perfect alignment-Smooth to the touch-Volume/Power buttons-StylishCons:-More expensive than others-Adds Bulk without necessarily protecting it better than others-Once dropped, the plastic will show damage (applies to all plastic cases though)I want to like the case but I might switch back to my TPU case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I purchased a like new note 3 with a tech 21 tpu case, and the rounded flexiness of it really ruined the feel of the phone. Event though it is a pretty slim case it made it feel much larger and cheaper. So looking for slimmer cases I looked at this one, and the Spigen ultra fit. I was really leaning towards the ultra fit, but ended up going with this due to the balance of slimness, protection, and looks. This feels really good in your hand with the bumper giving it a solid edge. I also liked how the buttons were built in so you aren't having to dig your fingers into a recess to hit them. I was worried they wouldn't work very well, but I've had no problems with them at all.I went for the silver surround and it looks fantastic with the black note 3. It adds very little to the width and height of the phone, and less than I was expecting from the pictures. I would definitely pay more for a real aluminum surround. The only downside to the looks is while the flat black back looks great, it does show fingerprints fairly easy, but I'm hoping that will even out over time.The stock back makes the camera stick up higher than anything else so you feel bad setting it down anywhere. With this case, the flat back and sharp thin surround around the screen give you a nice surface to rest it either way. Definitely recommend this one as one of the best all around case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: When I got my Note 3 I was worried it would be too big, but the phone's design is slim and manageable. I got used to the bigger size quickly.Then I got this Spigen case since I was concerned about dropping my new phone. Well, I'm mixed.On one hand the case is great. A perfect fit and offering reasonable drop protection for the corners and sides. With this and a screen protector I feel the phone is very safe from accidental slips.One the other hand, the phone is quite a bit bulkier now. I miss the sleek phone and several people have joked that I'm carrying a tablet with me. It does fit in my front pocket of my Dockers well, but not so much with jeans.I think the trade-off is worth it, so I can have the peace of mind that comes from knowing that accidentally dropping the phone when getting out of the car or walking between meetings won't destroy my new phone. When I feel the need to have a slim phone the case is fairly quick to remove, you don't need to disassemble the colored plastic surround from the softer rubber material, just peel the entire thing off, both parts together, from the bottom edge of the phone.All the cutouts, buttons (volume and power) and mic/headphone holes are perfectly aligned, and the case is very well made with nice molded lettering for the "13 mega" (under camera lens), "Neo Hybrid" (bottom right edge) and "Spigen" (back, bottom right). The pen is easy to access too, although fat fingers may have a problem getting it out since the cutout doesn't allow a lot of extra space.Overall, this is a well made case of good materials. I'd buy it again and will look at this brand for my other case needs in the future.Update March 4, 2014: I had installed this case on my Note 3 using the OEM back. I will be using the wireless charging back from Samsung and installed it today to find that this case no longer fits. The Spigen case is such a perfect fit for the stock phone that even the extra millimeter of thickness of the wireless back is too much. Sadly, I will need to return this case, however in the few days that I got to use it, it was nice. I won't take away any stars due to this sizing problem, but perspective buyers should be aware this will only fit correctly with the non-wireless charging back cover from Samsung.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: For the promotional price i paid $2 I would buy again in a heartbeat.  Makes the Note 3 look alot wider which is pretty cool. Feels like your holding a tablet with this case on. Alot of protection and red is the same red you see on picture. Wish they made a plastic holster for it but otherwise its a great case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: My coworker who also has a Note3 said that when he saw this on my phone, he had to compare phones, because suddenly my screen looked bigger than his (screen envy!?). This is a slick, sporty, well designed case. As others have said, DON'T try to put one piece on and then the other. keep them together and just slip your phone in.One other note: I use the iOmounts (see iomounts.com or proclipusa.com) which are magnetic car mounts. This mount requires a super thin metal ring to be stuck to the back of the phone to be able to then stick to the mount. I tried it under the case, which didn't stick to the mount well enough. I was able to get good adhesion on the back of the Neo Hybrid to use on the mount and after clarifying with the manufactures, the disk does adhere to this case. Perfect
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: For me I thought this case would be great, but its not really.  Very slick sides and wouldn't put a full seal on.  Better cases out there.  But if you want just something with light protection and very slim this might be for you.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I have looked so many cases for note 3 out there. I've chosen Spigen neohybrid case for reasons. First, neohybrid case isn't bulky like other cases yet it'd look as very protect against drop, and scratches.Second, every buttons, and holes match exactly as should. Thirdly, Spigen makes great looking or fashionable cases.Only reason didn't give five stars were phone feels heavier after inserted to the case. Otherwise it's a wonderful case
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Pros:Looks sleek & flawless. Best 'LOOKING' case.Fits like a glove. Cutouts are perfect.Samsung microUSB 3.0 cable fits fine.Cons:Bulky! Each side adds 3 mm thickness (Now feels way bigger than Note 2)Heavy! Adds substantial weightSlippery! No grip whatsoever.L-shape male connector doesn't fit. Audio jack is sunken deep.Loose & shaky Faux-metal buttons.S-Pen is hard to use because of the thickness.Conclusion: Impractical. Disappointed.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great Case.  It does not add too much to the phone and offers good protection for the sides and back.  It fits snug and looks great. It would be great if they sold the bumpers separately.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I almost didn't buy the Neo Hybrid case for my Note 3 because of all the negative reviews regarding poor fit.  I'm glad the other positive reviews convinced me to give it a try anyway.Bought a satin silver case for Note 3 from Spigen Inc. fulfilled by Amazon.  Came in as promised in two days.  Thanks Amazon.  The case came in proper packaging.  As soon as I opened it up, I fell in love with it.  It is just beautiful; not a single blemish on it.  I knew right away how to install it thanks to all the reviewers who gave the wonderful installation tip.  I just installed the case in one piece and the phone easily popped in perfectly.  Everything lined up correctly; no gaps on the sides at all.  I was going to use this case with either the Spigen glass screen protector or the one by Bodyguardz but their thickness drew me towards Bear Motion's premium glass screen protector instead which is half their thickness at .2 mm.  While a few suggested the .4 mm glass protectors work fine with this case, the thinner one allowed the button to sit almost flushed with the glass protector without needing to install a home button sticker.  The bump from the Neo Hybrid that protects the phone's screen also sits higher.Although this case added some bulk to the thin and light Note 3, the added protection and sleek look more than made up for it.  If your hands are small and are already struggling with holding the phone, I suggest you look elsewhere.  This case simply blends with the phone as if it came with the phone from the manufacturer.  While it's a little slippery compared to other cases, it allows me to easily slip the phone in and out my jean pocket.  The only two things that I wish Spigen would change are the sizes of both the headphone jack and charging ports holes.  The rest of the case can remain as perfect as it is now.  Thank you Spigen for making the Neo Hybrid case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Having tried several different cases, this one proved to be the best. It is a perfect combination of stylish look, good protection, and excellent function. It is not too rubbery and does not collect dust. The fit is perfect and all ports are exposed. The form factor make the Note 3 look a bit like an oversized iPhone 5 - only better, way better, which is not a bad thing at all.  The grip is good and not slippery at all. It also works well with Tech Armor screen protector, creating a perfect seal for the body and the screen. I highly recommend this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Excellent case.  A top quality case for $20!  Does not add too much bulk to the phone, keeping the nice original slim profile of the Note 3.  Like others have said, for installation keep the outer piece on, installs in less than 10 seconds.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I purchased this case for my Note 3 and love it. The case feels like it was meant to be there. The phone is already large so you would think that adding a case would just make it giant. However, it didn't. The case makes the phone feel better.It adequately protects from scratch and bumps. I haven't dropped my phone so I don't know what kind of shock protection it offers, but the back side and the screen lip are great.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I work for an indirect Verizon retailer and we do not carry cases for the Note 3 that aren't bulky so I did my research and found this one. title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Best note 3 cases ever ... here's my only issue though . I've a white note 3 so when I buy the white case shouldn't the entire thing be white not just the outer ring . Yes it should be . Y r we not at least given the option to have an inner she'll that is white and not the black one that they all Comme with . Other than than still the best cases ever bar none . I a c abt getn it airbrushed white most likely .
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: You really have to read reviews and take them with a grain of salt. I bought this case for my Note 3 and it is JUNK. Plastic Bezel and rubber holder for the phone.
