title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: The case broke while I was installing it.  Get Spigen's [Non-Slip] Spigen Samsung Galaxy Note 3 Case Slim [Ultra Fit] [Smooth Black] Rubbery Feel Non-Slip Grip Matte Hard Case for Galaxy Note III - ECO-Friendly Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10441)  case instead!!!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Absolutely love this case bought one from my iPhone if you see the reviews of the left one over there to freaking awesome product works all of the time doesn't add that much balk to your phone very slim but keeps your phone safe trust me I drop my phone all of the time and this always works not a scratch not a dent not a crack not anything if you want a great case that will protect your phone and not add a lot of balk stop reading and buy immediately absolutely love this product will always buy again
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Beautiful case that gives good protection without adding much to the width of the deviceThe only thing that it adds only 1-2mm space above the screen, so if it falls on it's face it might hit small stones.But still I think it's the best choice
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: First of all this case is great and it looks great, see the pictures i uploaded after i popped mine on my Note 3.  Many people seem to be complaining about shipping issues with the company who makes the case vs. leaving a honest review on the case itself.  I believe the reviews about the company and their shipping issues should be separated from the case reviews.  For the record, i got my case about 10 days past the expected shipping date, not really a big deal but glad i didn't pay extra for shipping.  Seems like every time things take forever to ship its when they are shipped through he USPS which is how this was shipped to me.  No option for FedEx or UPS.Anyways...Took me a couple minutes to get the case out of the nice hard-shell packaging it came in, i felt pretty stupid for about 2 minutes but i got it.Took the case out and it comes with a piece of paper basically telling you how to pop the case on and off.  Not very helpful.I was able to get the soft rubberized skin around the phone with no problem, but when it came to snapping on the outside shell of the phone it didn't seem to fit right.  I immediately jumped online to skim through these reviews and sure enough i was having the same problem everyone else was, it just didn't fit correctly.  Or so it seemed...  I played with it a bit more and i heard and felt a snap, that was the magic snap, once that happened it was on my phone like a glove and fit perfectly!I can see why others would say it was defective, i almost gave up on it but its just hard to get the plastic piece on, but it will go on, just play around with it.The case itself is great, feels solid and looks awesome.  All my chargers fit into it fine.I would recommend this product.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I ordered this case when the fulfillment was being handled by Spigen still, and had a bad experience. I still thought the case would be perfect for my note 3 so I was hoping the fulfillment would soon be handled by Amazon, it is and I love the case. It fits well and looks great on my Note 3, plus I received the case in a timely fashion.Thanks
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is a beautiful looking case, especially in the yellow.  The construction is of a very high quality.  The plastic around the sides in not slippery and the soft touch back has a great feel.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Love this case! Bought it months ago and I'm still using it! Very easy to slide on and off whenever I need to remove it, nice smooth matte back casing, and rubber trimming on the front frame.Note: Using an aftermarket charger for this phone won't fit with this case on so I have to constantly remove it when using an AFTERMARKET charger. The OEM charger fits just fine.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: it was very nice I like it I would definitely recommend it to my friends and thanks Floss carter for the reviews also the price is just right
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I really like this case, makes my note 3 look sleeker. Not sure how it would hold up to a drop but rather not find out :) only wish they sold the frame separately like they do for the GS4
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I Don't write many reviews But I could not pass this one up . This is a great case for the person that is looking for a slim easy to handle and looks great. I have had many people tell me were did you get that good looking case . I tell them Amazon and I tell them to go check it out it come in lot's of colors . But if you ask me the silver is really nice looking so go check it out you won't be disappointed with this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Spigen advertises this item as "Thin" and I know the term "Thin" is subjective, but for me it was anything but thin.Lets start from the beginning... The Note 3 is a little too big of a phone. I truly believe a 5" screen'd phone are the perfect size (Nexus 5, Galaxy S4 for examples). That said, I've had this phone for about a month now and I've gotten used to it. I've gotten used to it to the point of holding my fiancee's Galaxy S4 and thinking, "It's small." I know this is just adaptation of the human mind, but it doesn't change the fact the Note 3 is hard to use one handed and sometimes, I need one handed operations. Yes I know there's a mode for "One handed operation," but that just further proves my point that the phone is a tad too big and apparently Samsung knows it.I love the phone, don't get me wrong, but where it stands without a case is where I want it to be size wise.So I opted for Spigen's advertised "thin" case. When it arrived it added so much bulk that the phone felt like a monster. It was just too much for me to enjoy. I have a spot in my Volkswagen CC that was designed to hold phones. The Note 3 by itself fits fine. With the Spigen, it doesn't at all.So due to this I cannot recommend this case to anyone that already thinks the Note 3 is pushing it.If the Note 4 gets any larger I will not own one.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Great styling and people frequently ask my wife what kind of phone she has since this case looks like a part of the phone.I recommend screen protector as well.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Let me start off by what's bad about the case. The main issue I have with the case is that there is zero grip provided. This is one of the slipperiest cases out there.. What's the point of having a slippery case especially on the note 3. The phone tends to want to leave your hand. Second.. the case does add a bit of weight and bulk  to the phone. (Although it's not as bulky as the bulkier cases out there but it's definitely not a slim case either)  3rd and this is a minor issue.  This black and red case i got does not look good with the white note 3 because the black TPU over laps the red bumper and when you stare at the front of the phone there is a mesh of 3 colors which just looks messy.  Now what I do like about the case is how nice it looks. The case doesn't look cheap and has nice quality feel to it. The case also provides a pretty good amount of protection.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: very nice, stylish look, perfect grip but I found it little bit expensive...Basically back cover is simply plastic and also stains on the back cover is hard to clean because of the plastic material ...Specially if you touch with dirty handS ....$10-15 price range would be better for this case....
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This order plus the last 5 orders from Spigen have been riddled with late shipments, and no responses to emails. I keep telling myself that this is just a one time thing, then oh they failed on the 2nd order, it's okay, then the 3rd time my senses became dull to getting lied to.I am done with Spigen for now. I may try them again later on if I hear they care again.The least they can do is send an email saying there is a delay or sorry guys etc. Bad service.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Nice sturdy case with the bezel.  I've always had the holster type cases for previous phones.  I thought I'd give a slimmer one a try.  There is a lot of cheaply constructed cases / covers out there - this one is very nice and slides in and out of pocket with ease.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I love this case it's sleek and the buttons are easy to press and I just love how it makes the phone look. I do agree though with the other reviewers though it's quite slippy in the hand, I've dropped the phone on my face a few times lol because the sides and back aren't too grippy, this doesn't change my love for the case though. I put it on without taking the case apart and I've had no issues with it fitting. I feel the price could be a little cheaper but it's not so bad for the look you get and the protection. Spigen Inc doesn't offer frame replacements so you'll be out of luck if you drop it and break the outer band. However they do offer replacements up to 90 days after purchase, contact them here; http://amzn.to/13Il79hOverall this product is good quality I love it, and if you're careful this case will hold up in my opinion a very long time!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: This is an excellent case for the Note 3, and looks like it is actually part of the phone.  Has just enough grip to keep it from sliding around and stay in your hand, but not enough to make it difficult to remove from your pocket.  It has already survived a few falls, and still looks perfect.  High quality materials, thin design, and good protection.The only negative I have found is that some headphone jacks and MicroUSB cables do not fit well due to the openings around those input locations obstructing the cables. I have had to shave down a few cables, but most work just fine.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Used this first with my Note 3 and it worked well.  However, it has slick sides and lays very flat on the table (screen facing up) and was very hard to pick up for me.  I ended up adding feet (little rubber feet) which helped give it some distance from the table but was still hard to grab.I ended up using the Spigen Bounce case instead.  Not as cool looking but much more grippy.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: I bought this case because it looked sleek and it had my two favorite colors (black and red). It turned out to be exactly what I thought it was going to be like and it feels feels great. It takes just a bit of effort to put it on but once it's on it's a nice fit and all the cutouts are in the right place. Would totally recommend.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10452)

reviewText: Very simple review, but, I love this case ! The whole S-View concept and how they incorporated it into the case blows my mind. This is literally the best case I've ever had, hands down.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This is a great case. Very protective and it doesn't add much bulk. I have ordered several of these Spigen cases and will probably be ordering more.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Great case!  Worth the investment if you’re hard on your phone like I am.  My last IPhone I scratched up by throwing it in my purse.  When I bought the Note 3 I decided I would care for the phone and make sure it always had full protection.  When I ordered the case it was on back order, so I had to wait 5 days.  Once I got it, if the case they send it in is any indication of the protection of the phone, I got the right case.  It was really easy to install, I just pushed in the upper half in and snapped in the bottom in.  I did have to do it twice as it didn’t pick up my s view right away.  Once I got it in and I made sure the phone was securely in the case, I made sure the contact on the back of the phone was completely together.  Calls and s-view worked great.  It does add a little weight, but for the protection it’s worth it to me.  I like that over the Samsung case this one comes with a snap, so you don’t have to purchase an extra magnet.  I originally bought the Samsung case and returned it.  I also like the hinge, since there aren’t any good options out there for a Note 3 case with full protection and a kickstand; this case gets you as close as possible.  The hinge allows you to set your phone up in different angles.  I think the case looks good, I get compliments on it. I would highly recommend this case.  This is my first Spigen and I will be a return customer.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I like the fact that you have the S-View option with this case, primary one of the reasons I bought this case.  But this is my second Slim Armor View case I have went through.  The first one broke in the exact same spot my second one did.  The hinge of the Front Cover splits causing it not to stay on the hinge for the case around the phone.  I feel like this is a design flaw and Spigen on honors their 90 day warranty if ONLY bought on their website.  Since I purchased this through Amazon, I have no warranty.  I will contact Amazon to see about their returns.  I really don't think this deserves one star, if there was an option for no stars that would make me happy!  Looks like I'll be buying an Otterbox, with no S-View!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This case fits my note 3 great. It is a little hard to get on at first but it is worth it.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: THIS IS THE BEST CASE!  IT DOES NOT MAKE MY PHONE TOO BIG AND IT GIVES GREAT PROTECTION!I HAVE TRIED SEVERAL OTHER CASES ON MY GALAXY NOT 3 AND THIS ONE BEATS THEM ALL!YOU HAVE TO BE CAREFUL AND PUT THE CHIP IN THE CASE THEN PUT PHONE IN THE CASE, PROGRAM IT TO YOUR LIKING AND GO . WOW!  IT IS MUCH BETTER FOR ME THAN A OTTER ARMOR CASE.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: They shipped almost 2 weeks later! Case for most part is sleek. One big flaw!! The opening for S-Pen is a little too narrow and hard to remove it. Have to jam pinky finger all the way in to remove the pen. (I won't use a sharp object.)  Bought mostly because of lower price at time ($13.99). Would NOT pay/be satisfied if paid full price (return).That being said, build quality is great. This is NOT a cheap feeling case at all. Some like the smooth back, some don't.  For me, anything OTHER than that faux leather back! (What was Samsung thinking?)  Anyway, there is a nice lip around the screen edge which helps keep the screen glass from rubbing when face down.  I am using a Ghost Glass "tempered glass" screen protector.  I am NOT using the Spigen brand one this time around.  The tempered glass protector fits fine within this case. Note, I highly recommend using a button jelly with this case (and definitely is using glass screen protector) as the HOME button is just about flush with the protector installed.  A jelly over the HOME button to raise it would make pressing a little more easy.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: the case looks awesome. But the only thing i am worried about is that the plastic backing is going to scratch easily.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: So I was iffy about hearing all the negative feedback about the customer service. I got my case within 5 days.  The tracking on it was BS but I think that USPS had something to do with that, not the seller. Came home and was surprised to see it.  Popped it on and wow it makes the note 3 look sexy!IT ADDS WEIGHT, but I like that.  I am used to the note 1, a heavier previous version of the phone.  Haven't dropped it yet, not going to try and test out the durability of this case, but if feels SOLID.Recently bought the 'hyperion explorer hybrid case' and I thought that one was ugly.  It trapped dirt and overall had a very cheap look to it.  Also the buttons aren't all that easy to push on it.  This Spigen case is way cooler and after shipping on the hyperion case, it was only about 10 bucks more.The buttons work nicely under cover, the headset jack seems to have enough room for most headphones.Everything is recessed, so you can place the phone face up or down and not have to worry about the camera or screen touching anything.Let me recommend the matte slate color, its AWESOME.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: The case seems to do it's job protecting the phone but I haven't drop my phone to see if it does.  I don't mind what other reviewers say about the flip case digging into the hand, you kind of expect that just because the way it was made.  The reason I bought this was for S-View functionality and protection.  The S-View feature it's supposed to do only works some of the time.  You have to kind of "trick it out" by either removing your phone and putting it back into the case or doing a phone reboot....or a combination of both.  It's too much of a hassle and if i just wanted a phone where I don't need the S-View feature, I can just buy a regular flip (or wallet) case for a cheaper price.  I've purchased 3 Spigen products and sad to say, I've returned all 3.  So three times a charm and I will no longer purchase from Spigen again.  So if you want S-View functionality, just get the Samsung OEM flip case.  It works like a charm and it looks sleek as well.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: For the price you can't beat it. It made the phone seem less bulky if that's possible but I didn't like the finger prints i left (just my OCD)
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Awesome case. Snug fit and has that premium look to it. It even has a cutout for the humidity sensor which some cases do not. Goes to show how much attention to detail Spigen puts into their products. It does add a tiny bit of weight to the phone but the trade off is protection. Another thing, the edging near the USB port had little sharp corners to it that could dig into your fingers depending how you hold the phone, but can easily be fixed with some very light sandpaper. I was looking for a case that would also protect the buttons and this fits everything perfectly. Buttons are not hard to press and looks great.*** Be advised. The USB Charge/Sync cable that comes with the phone fits perfectly flush in the space provided by this case. I did get a 3rd party cable so that I could have one in the car. The aftermarket cable does NOT fit nicely flushed with this case. You can force the cable to be secured, but it will "lift" the case on the front and back. This might be an issue with a lot of cables that aren't from Samsung designed for this phone. Something to consider. ***I'm giving it 4/5 stars for the added weight to it. It feels like I'm carrying a small bible in my pocket.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: The best phone case I've ever had! It's slim, attractive and rugged. This doesn't add any bulk to an already large phone. Easy to get to the stylus. I had another kind that was thicker, and you couldn't get the stylus out very easily.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Protection is decent. Style is pretty good. Why the 2 star rating? The inner liner on my case is so botched up when on the phone. With or without a screen protector, the very edge/lip of the inner liner looks as if it has been cut in sections. It does not lay flat on the screen surface at all. Makes it appear as if there is something stuck underneath it or little flap are still tucked underneath. For the issues involved with this case, from the price jumping around, to the super long delay in shipping, delayed tracking info, I was hoping that at least I'd get a flawless product worth the hassle. Was not the case, no pun intended. No idea if seller has fixed the issues. Tried contacting but got no response. Will not buy again from Spigen until this issue is resolved.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: It's a nice case. Looks pretty well made. One thing I would change or missing, a grip on the side to better handle the phone. I see the grip rubber on the top and bottom but I would have prepared to have them all on the side as well. It makes it easier to slip off the hand and drop, if you're not careful.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Wow lately Spigen has been disappointing at every turn and this case just adds to it's downfall.I used to be a huge Spigen fan and always recommended their cases and screen protectors but lately all I have are issues with the protectors and the cases and this one so far is the worst.Here's what I like:It's like a sophisticated otterbox case for your note 3 that will protect your phone from falls, even those nasty corner drops.-The s view does work but it lags and you may need to apply a bit of pressure.-Case is actually assembled in 2 parts so you can remove the door and the plastic that holds it together to have a silicone cases that is not too shabby-Camera hole is the perfect shape and does not allow surfaces to touch so the lens is always protectedWhat I hate:-Your phone will be protected but the case will not survive the falls especially the door bc its made out of cheap plastic-The s pen is a pain to get out-The headphone is not easy to access-You have to remove your phones original back to use this case (otherwise s view will not work)-The s view windows does not always work and may at times cause your phone to be stuck on s view lock screen mode-The door hinge is poorly made and will not last long-Since the case is assembled in two parts, expect the plastic portion to break-The door does not open as easily as you would expect-The s view door home button sticks (it will turn on many times when its in your pockets)-Matte finish so fingerprints and smudges will remain and give off a wear and tear look within months (gloss always leaves fingerprints but its easy to wipe off)I preordered this case and it took a while before I got it due to supply issues but when I received I was very happy and pleased. Unfortunately that did not last. The part of the case that holds the door and the hinge together snapped off and essentially the case came apart.Luckily for me Spigen announced that they would cover this cases for an extra 2 years or so with their new cases and I was told on twitter that it also applied to their past cases (I forget exact coverage years). I was able to get a replacement by sending them photos via twitter and email and I honestly expected to get brand new case but no. What I got was a replacement door. I contacted them again and sent them better photos and told them that the door is not the only thing broken. They apologized and sent me the plastic cover that holds the hinge and door and goes over the silicone portion of the case. At this point I just gave up and used what they gave me since it worked...for a month.That same plastic part of the case broke and the door continues to pop out now but they have not responded to my twitter complaints and frankly I am tired of their slow service so a negative review it is.I have never dropped my phone, banged it or let if take any damage. All I do is put it in my front pocket and attach it to my car dock that is all and yet the case does not last.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: My favorite case every owned. I frequently change phones ( about every 6 months or so) and I usually buy between 3-6 cases for each new phone, so I get to experience many different types and styles.This case is my favorite due to the fact that it fits perfect, looks very elegant and offers quite a bit of protection. It also is a 2 piece case so if it drops, the impact will be distributed over more material and protect your phone better.The mention on the ad that can change the exterior price when this gets scratched or damaged but I don't think that will be cost effective. I'm sure when this one gets scratched or damaged, I'll just order another one.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I would always abide by using Otterbox for all of my phone cases.  I recently got a Note 3 and wanted to use the S View feature that came with the phone.  I looked at Otterbox but it was a little too big especially since the note 3 is already a huge phone.  Putting on a Otterbox would make the phone look like a brick. I looked and looked for a case that was slim, had the Sview feature, and had protection all around.  This is it.  This is THE case for all you tech junkies.  This case is full body protection especially the screen.  It is hard body unlike the soft body ones you find on the market.  Also, the clasp is a definite winner.  On some other sview cases, the front cover would dangle and over time it would become loose and unstable. The cover is well made, from a hard plastic and i feel it won't become loose over time.  This is the opposite of the negatives of the soft sview covers.  Also, if you want, the s view cover is removable.  The case itself is a bit slick all over but I don't mind it at all.  As long as it covers and protects my phone, I'm all for it.I would recommend this to anyone who loves Otterbox and any full body protection case but want a slim and hardbody sview case that you won't regret. This case is easily a 10 star rating.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Giving this 5 stars because the quality is great. I would recommend this to anyone who needs a slim case that has good protection.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This case is absolutely gorgeous looking.  I feel that it would also provide a good level of protection for the GN3.  The lip around the screen is not very high though (not like an Otterbox Commuter).The thing that I really don't like at all is the texture of the hard plastic outer shell.  The colored shell is very slippery.  Because of the slippery nature of the colored plastic, the phone is very hard to grasp securely.  I'm always afraid that when I go to pick the phone up, after it has been sitting on a desk or table, I am going to drop it.This case, for me, does not instill a feeling of security while holding the phone.  The colored hard outer shell needs to have a rubber grip along both sides below the power and volume rocker.  This design would provide something sticky rather than slippery to assist grasping the phone when lifting it from a table or desk -  or even while holding the phone during use.  I would then give it 5 stars.Let's face it, unless you are buying this just to change the appearance of the phone, it is supposed to provide protection for your expensive device.  Why would any manufacturer make a case that could actually help you drop your phone.After I removed this case from my phone, I felt that the naked phone actually had more grip than with the case.The Spigen "BOUNCE" or Otterbox "Commuter" are both much better cases if you want something that feels secure and grippy in your hand.Because a case is supposed to help protect your phone, not help you drop and damage your device, I can only give the Slim Armor Case 2 stars.  It looks really nice, but grippyness is lacking.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Thin and added a solid feel. Drop my note 3 a couple of times with this case on, and I very pleased with the drop performance. Easy to put on the phone too.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This case is really good looking and i especially like the back design of the case. It just gives it a really flashy type of look. The corners are protected really well with the TPU casing and is held on by the outter shell. This case is a really good case but it's just way too slipper. I have pretty rough hands from years of working in a warehouse type environment and this case was sliding in my hand. The only way I could secure it was to hold on to the power and volume buttons.Again, great looking case and it looks like it will protect the phone from drops but I just can't get over how slippery the outter shell is.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Being that this case is called "Slim Armor" it does add a little heft to the phone, however, it does provide a decent amount of protection, more than the TPU style cases.  It adds about 0.1" thickness all around.  This is a dual layered case, and looks very nice aesthetically speaking.  All the ports are easily accessible, and the fit and finish on this case is very good.  My only issues with this case are that it leaves fingerprints (I have the white back case), and the case Is chamfered where the back and sides connect. I wished that it was rounded, so that it would have a more pleasant feel in the hand.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: It's design is very good.But for the ear-phone hole is not fit to some earphone. I got several earphones, but only one is fit to this. its size of the jack is small. I mean the jack is normal size but its plastic connector which cover that jack is small. Moreover, if you use a normal USB3.0 cable to connect to PC or Charger, this case will be also just little bit small.Others are very good.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I am so glad that I ordered this case for my phone. It may add a little bulk but the protection it providesgreatly outweighs a little extra size. I went with the graphite/blue as it has a matte back and does not show fingerprintsas much as the glossy black but, I still might get that one as well.As it stands right now I have no con's about this case only praise.If you want  good quality protection with little or no added size then this is the product for you!Please note: I ordered this from another site. Won't say the name but most of you know who I'm talking about.and I got an obvious fake more then likely from China that was such a POS and a hassle to return.All of Spigen's products ship with a card inside that guarantees that you are getting thegenuine deal,  Order from Amazon and you'll get double protection if there ever a problem.Thanks for reading my review.David
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I received my Auto Sleep/Wake Case exactly on the expected due date and was, based on a lot of the previous reviews here, prepared to have to fiddle with it extensively to get the case to work with the S-View Window.  Thankfully, I did not have to do any tricks to get it to work correctly.SETUPPrior to installing the case, I activated some of the S View Cover options first by going to Settings> General> Accessory> and go to the S View Cover Section and check "Automatic unlock" and change colors for the window, etc.To get the case on, you have to remove the OEM battery cover. After that, line up the S View chip on the case with the pins on the phone and press the phone into the case. It's as simple as that. From what I heard, if these pins don't line up exactly, the S View feature will not work. I'm not sure if Spigen made adjustments to the chip after customer complaints; however, I had no issue with loose chips or misalignments.BUILD QUALITY/MaterialsObviously, the makers of this case gave lots of thought and effort into developing the case. This is evident in how perfectly the cutouts are and the lack of gaps. This makes for a very good hold of the phone.  The phone never moves inside of the case. The case is done so well, in fact, that you could almost think it was made by Samsung.  One thing to note, although all the holes line up, some headphone jacks will NOT work in this case, if they are of the larger variety.I found 3 negatives with the build materials: the S View Window "glass", the soft-feel matte finish (in this case, black) and the hinge material:1 & 2) The glass is a FINGERPRINT MAGNET. It shows everything. Fingerprints, oil, etc. This wouldn't be a problem if the glass could be easily wiped clean. For my first day, I used EVERYTHING imaginable to clean the glass, short of Windex. All the materials used simply smeared the oil and fingerprints. Finally I cut a small, 4"x4" piece of "Sham-Wow" and used that to wipe the front of the case and it works perfectly.  It's a shame, though, that you HAVE to keep wiping the window, if you want it to look decent.  Same goes for the finish of the entire case. It shows every little fingerprint and oil. On the flip-side, it is indeed easier to wipe these blemishes away.3) For such a tough case, the hinge that marries the front window cover to the rest of the case appears to be SUPER flimsy. So much so, I open the front cover very carefully every single time. Maybe if it were built of metal painted black to match, I'd feel more secure.IN-HAND FEELClosed, the case feels nice and solid in-hand. There is a little added heft to the overall weight of the phone, which for me is a plus. The phone no longer feels fragile and delicate. While there IS added heft, the overall size of the phone doesn't appear to have gotten much bigger/thicker.  People with small hands will notice a difference (I have small hands), but it's not a deal breaker.One of the selling points is that the front cover is able to open fully and be folded all the way to the back of the case. This 1) gets the cover out of the way while also 2) enabling the case to act as a stand. In landscape, simply fold the case back so that it's about 25 degrees from the back of the phone and put it down. Now you have an instant fairly stable stand. Nice.  One of the negatives, though, with the front cover folding all the way back, is that the plastic eats into your hands when holding it.  You literally have to change the way you hold the phone in order to keep your hands from hurting. For me, this was ok, as I'm adaptable to change. For some, this may be an irritation.PROS+Very well made, fits the phone perfectly+Full protection without adding TOO much bulk+The S View function works flawlessly+Front cover folds all the way back+Case can operate as a "landscaped mode" standCONS-Entire case and S-View window is a fingerprint magnet-Large headphone jacks do not work-With the cover fully open and on back of the case, causes discomfort to the handsWith that said, I DO like the case, but wouldn't give it a 5 star rating. Would I buy another one, I surely would.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Excellent case for my new Note 3. Even though there were lot of negative reviews when I was looking for a case, it actually delivered before the promised date. Really happy with the delivery and especially with this case.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Spigen did a wonderful job engineering this case to precisely fit the Galaxy Note 3. Every function is usable, all ports are easy to access, including the s-pen. Unlike the competition; this case is Very Slim by comparison and offers adequate shock protection and grip.Since these reviews have been written so many times, I'm only going to point out one additional feature nobody has mentioned. The screen cover sits on beveled edges of the case, which means it never actually touches the screen. It's also very rigid, which means you can effectively store the phone in places like your pocket, coat pocket, handbag, backpack, etc; and not have to worry about compressing the phone or screen. Lastly, the hinged design is absolutely superior to anything else offered on the market."Nice Job" to the Spigen Team!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Purchase this for my Galaxy Note 3. Dropped my phone a few times since purchasing, no problems, it works. :-) I would recommend. Great workmanship.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I was introduced to the wonderful world of S View when I upgraded to the Note 3, then outright snubbed AT&T;'s overpriced case offerings in store....I stepped out into the mall then approached the Cellairis kiosk. I picked up a cheap, vinyl case for $15. If you don't know anything about Cellairis kiosks, the cases they offer are $5 ebay and flea market fodder, only typically marked up to $35+. So that tells you how flimsy and cheap the $15 case I bought is...but the S View worked flawless. I figured it would do me until I could get home and research for better.So, I come upon this case here. I didn't really get a good take on the reviews on Amazon due to this case sharing reviews with Spigen's less problematic offerings (oh touche Amazon/Spigen. Well played.) Anyhow, once I received my Slim Armor View, put it on my phone...I was outraged at how poorly the S View worked. Android 4.3 mind you....I really, really love this case other than the S View not working. So I did more research, found that this is common and that Spigen would offer a replacement chip...so I emailed Spigen CS. Within a few days I received a replacement chip...followed the instructions to the letter...to no avail. The new replacement chip performed as badly as the old one.So as I'm about to package this all up to send back, it dawned on me. "Why not try the chip from the cheap-o, mall crappy case inside the SAV...?" So I did, and low and behold, my Slim Armor View S View is now working flawlessly.I'm a bit miffed that some knock-off mall fodder company got the chip right, where a company like Spigen could miss the boat entirely.I'm still giving 3 stars because Spigen was quick to respond, tried the rectify the issue, their Slim Armor View is a really nice, protective case other than S View issues...and I got it to work, so I am personally happy. Oh, and the S View window collects fingerprints and tends the get rather "oily" over time.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: What more can I say? I've owned the Samsung Galaxy line since the original Galaxy and have a lot of experience with numerous cases out there. My favorites used to be TPU cases as I loved how they hugged the phone well and most importantly protected it from face drops by having a lip that curves over the front of the phone. You know...around the edges...the rim. That's ideally my main concert with cases if they provide that rim that will elevate the front of the phone just enough off the ground in case it does a face plant. (Assuming it's on a smooth surface.) Anyway, this Spigen case is the Mercedes of the auto World. Just pure elegance. Strong and durable. It's the luxury of all cases. The best way I can describe it is this: It gives you all the protection of those stupid bulky armor military cases that make your phone look like brick (so annoying), while being as thin as possible to achieve a slim profile. All the cut outs are perfect. Also if you notice from the picture, there are rubber areas where it needs it..ie..the top, bottom and around the front of the phone on the "rim." -- Look no further.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Very good quality case, excellent fit, protects well - dropped without any damage to Note 3, but the plastic surface easily slides out of hand, not sticking to the fingers, would prefer some stickier surface, though slidy plastic helps to glide Note 3 into the pocket easily ,,, Will not fit with QI enabled OEM Samsung Verizon backplate, only with regular backplate, but the QI backplate is larger size, so no stars deducted for that.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: First the good. The case is beautiful. Good solid feel. I have confidence that if I dropped the phone it'd survive intact. The only part that's a fingerprint magnet is the view port. Which leads me to the bad...The bad. The software is just about as quirky as can be. WIthin a few seconds of running the software glitches and the call/message notifications may/may not work. I don't know if it's the case magnets or what, but the screen for the software pops up even when you're not using the viewport.I'm hoping that Spigen/Samsung work on the software issues or Spigen makes their own software at some point. I'd buy it again if the kinks were worked out.Edit: Also, there is no LED cutout to see notifications and the headphone port is too small for many headphone connectors.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Best darn case in the world.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I was a little skeptical about this product but after looking at a review by Floss Carter on YouTube I was sold not only that is has a great feel and you don't feel like your gonna break your phone for example I use headphone all the time and all my dumb friends always pull my phone out of my pocket and drop it but I don't care because I know my phone is going to be fine lol
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Let me preface this review by first indicating that I purchased the infinity white case for a white Galaxy Note III.- First of all, those complaining about the tracking number didn't really look for it.When you get the e-mail that notifies that the case has been shipped, simply open it and it gives you the tracking link.There, Amazon updates tracking, albeit they do a slow job. I simply copied the tracking number and monitored it directly through USPS.- Onto the actual review of the case.This case is brilliant. It truly is.I have tried cases from Otterbox, Incipio, Caseology, Hyperion, Speck, and others.This particular Spigen case beats all of the other cases out indefinitely.Although it does add some bulk to the phone, I feel like it's a good type of bulk.My Note III feels much more substantial and just feels more stable to me.However, the glossy back of the case + small hands = A tough to grip Note with one hand.Buttons feel great to push, very tactile, I don't think that accidental button presses will be a problem.All the cut-outs for speaker, camera, etc are right on point. The cut-out for the S Pen is a welcomed addition.Overall, I love the design and protection that the case provides the end user.I think that it's a good investment for anyone.I used to buy a variety of cases to switch out, but I am pretty sure that i'll stick to this one case for a very long time.It's just that good.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: The front case doesnt always seem to work. Have to open and close it several times. It is very annoying. Have contacted seller for exchange I hope they dont give me problems. Not worth $60.

reviewText: This is an <u>excellent</u> case! I even dropped my phone in the toilet and with the case lid closed, <b>very little water</b> entered the phone! !!! Excellent all-around protection. Even with Kit Kat (4.4.2) the included chip (easy to install) the case lid will operate in sview mode! Excellent choice for anyone who wishes a case for their Note 3.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: The Good:  I was pleasantly surprised by this case at first.  It has a very cool and protected feel to it.  The finish is smooth, but not slippery, so it will easily go into a pocket (if you have one large enough!), but still has a 'grip' to it in the hand.  It took some help from a Verizon rep to get the S-view working properly (there are some settings to be changed in order to be able to check messages from the front screen.  But once I had that done, the front screen was very convenient!The Bad:  As others have said, the audio jack port isn't easily accessible to many headphones with the case on.  The front cover is difficult to open with one hand, unless you can brace it against something while popping it free.  It folds all the way to the back, but will obstruct the camera viewfinder in that position.  With the cover open, it feels very awkward - kind of flops all over the place.  I wish that it had the capability to hold a 'propped up' position for hands-free viewing.  I have noticed that it will kind of 'space out' when the cover is left open for too long.  A restart of the device solved the problem - until now...The Ugly:  Just got the Kit Kat 4.4.2 update this morning and wa-la!  The s-view no longer works on the case.  I will be spending some time researching a solution before getting a new case, but I do wish I hadn't spent so much on this one.Update:  After some Googling, I found a recommendation to remove the phone from the case and restart.  After re-inserting the phone, the s-View now works again!!  Hopefully, this fix will last. I'm upgrading to 4 stars :)
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This is the second best case for the Note 3 that Spigen produces.  The added size does translate into an enhanced confidence in the protection offered to the device. The glass screen protector fits without a pause for concern. Buttons and ports are perfectly sized and located. This is a tank of a case no doubt but the gloss fish of the hard skeleton back cover is unattractive.. especially in the black that I chose. When polished it is beautiful to see but that effect is short lived and the OCD in me causes me to constantly be wiping the case clean. As far as my number one Spigen case? It is the Bounce.

reviewText: It is a well built product and looks very attractive. It seems to protect the phone well against accidental drops or water splashes. It replaces the original battery cover of your Galaxy Note 3, but it is impossible to open the flap with one hand, the latch is too hard to push open with your thumb. The other problem I have with mine is that the flap does not turn off my screen. When the flap is shut the phone is supposed to display a smaller image through the window where you can answer calls or take notes etc. Mine stopped doing that after a few uses and never turned back to normal. I tried resetting the phone by taking the battery out and putting it back in, but didn't help. My older Samsung leather cover works fine with the screen, so it is not my phone. If I wasn't using my phone 40-50 times a day, I would have lived with this cover, but not being able to open the cover with one hand and not being able to answer without opening the cover, I will give it a low rating.

title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: To begin with, I am reviewing the soft black S-View version of this cover. Amazon has intermingled the reviews for S-view and non S-view versions, so make sure the review you read applies to the case you want to buy!I was concerned about reports of problems using these cases that may or may not be associated with  the kit kat update. My phone is not yet on kit kat. I absolutely loved the similar Spigen case for my Galaxy S4, so I went ahead and bought one of these, ordering it ahead of time so it would be on hand when I became eligible for a subsidized phone upgrade!Just like the S4 case, this one looks to give reasonably good protection to the phone. To get better protection than this, you'd have to go with the Otterbox Defender or a similar massively bulky case. Even this case adds a small amount onto both sides of every dimension. I still can fit it into my front jeans pocket for easy carrying, but it isn't as instinctive to slide it in as it was on smaller phones. The soft black has a soft, fairly grippy feel that makes my grip on the phone feel good. This is an excellent choice, not quite as good as the coating on the Seidio cases I've used, but very usable. I handled a white Spigen case for the S4 that had a much slicker feel, and wouldn't have made me comfortable for fear I'd drop it, I assume that the white Note 3 case is the same more slippery material.To my relief, when I removed the back cover of my phone and inserted it into the case, it worked perfectly. None of the reported problems. The next morning, I was disturbed to find that the auto-on and auto-off features of the case were now NOT working! I took the phone out and reinserted it into the case, and everything was fine. I'm hoping that is the end of the matter, but uncertainty makes me give the case four stars rather than five. If I go for a few weeks without more trouble, I'll try to remember to come back here and upgrade my rating to five stars.ADDED LATER: unfortunately, I had two more failures of the S-View feature to work within 24 hours. Removing and replacing the phone in the case seemed to fix the problem, but this is unacceptable. I lost confidence in the place and have asked for a refund. Back to Amazon it will go. I used the case for a one more day until I could get a replacement regular case, and found that it works unreliably. It is unfortunate, because I love this case on my Galaxy S4. I have changed my rating from four stars to one star.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Best case available for Note 3 if you are looking for complete protection with a slimmer profile (removed back cover) & S-View functionality.  My wife bought this for me as part of my birthday gift so the actual purchase is under her Amazon account.  This case will COMPLETELY protect your phone, without a doubt.  It has a solid feel to it and I'm not afraid if I happen to drop it on gravel or concrete.  It gets an A+ for case protection and durability.  I have been using it a couple of months now.  There are a few common complaints that I want to address from other reviewers.S-View - I know many people, including myself, had an issue with the S-View function.  It would stop working and to get it to work again I had to take the case off.  If you have this problem, send an email to Spigen.  They quickly sent me over a new chip to replace the one in the case.  It works perfectly now!  I was ready to return the case but decided to reach out to Spigen first to give them a chance to do the right thing.  I would have given 3/5 stars with a case that had a dysfunctional feature but Spigen customer service provided me a quick fix in replacing the chip.Hinge - I read previous reviews saying that the hinge is a weak point and can break easily.  While this may be true, if you drop your phone when the case is opened and the hinge breaks; I don't blame the hinge for breaking.  There may be merit that the hinge is inherently weak but if it breaks because I dropped the phone that isn't the cases' fault but mine.Final thoughts:Compared to the price of the Samsung S-View case, this is a bargain.  I had the Samsung S-View case but I wanted something that offered better overall protection.  Would recommend to all my family, friends and Amazon users.  One more thing I wanted to add concerning the Samsung S-View case; the front cover would flap or wouldn't close properly.  Spigen makes a magnetic clip that works perfectly for this problem.  I gave my old case to my dad and bought the magnetic clip for him.  Works great.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Spigen really knows how to make a nice looking and durable case of just about any phone. You wont be disappointed!!

reviewText: Could not be happier with this purchase! Form fitting and all the cutouts for recharger and speaker are perfect.  Perfect cutout for the stylus too.  Feels like it would give good protection in a normal type drop, from waist level to the floor.  The Note 3 is long and wide but very thin. This give it just enough extra thickness without adding too much to the length or width.  If you are a fan of the way Speck products fit I would say this is comparable or better.  Love this case!
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Spigen is becoming my favorite wireless accessory company of all time.This case looks great and provides great protection for your device.Spigen's customer service is terrible though. Shipping took over a month. Emails are never answered. I paid 24.99 for this and they dropped the price twice before they even shipped it to me. The case is great though.

reviewText: The sleek elegant look of this case really had me excited when I bought - and it continued after it arrived.  This is as beefy a case as I'd venture to get and it really feels good in the hand.  I would definitely recommend this case.

reviewText: This was a nice looking case and very sturdy.  I received the case on a Friday and by Sunday the screen had scratches on it.  Also there was a bubble in the center of the case that I wasn't able to get rid of.  I refuse to pay $45.00 for a case that scratches so easy.

reviewText: looks great, very good protection. no problems as of yet. very well made. Spigen doesn't disappoint in their task :)
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I have to say that I'm very happy by choosing this case. It protects my Note 3 quite well. I can feel the edges been thicker then the rest of the case which helps protect the edges more in case of an accidental drop. The buttons are cover by the case but they work great. With this case on the Note 3 feels a little heftier but I like it. With out the case the Note 3 feels strange in my hand a little to slim for my taste.  I made a good choice by buying this case because it protects the Note 3 and makes it feel better in my hand.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: I have had many phones, and many different cases to go along with them. This case fits snug, and looks great. It is slim and does not add much bulk at all to the phone while keeping very classy styling. The only down is that the back of the case is glossy (I got the black one) and it shows finger prints, and if your hands are dry... it does make the phone a little slick. The edge of the case holds nicely though and the buttons are easier to press than without the case which is a very nice perk.Can't say I have dropped the phone with this case on, however I can guarantee that it will offer better protection than a plastic case or even a standard TPU case. There is a good lip around the face to keep from hitting the case of the phone... feels good on your ear, and offers good protection for those of us that lay the phone face down. Overall... build quality is very nice, styling is very nice... perfect compliment to my Note 3.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Slim Armor has got the be the best mid range case out there. It's not as bulky as an otterbox, but it's not like a TPU case. It provides the right amount of protection without being too bulky.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: The hard plastic cover is extremely hard to remove. I need to have access to phone to replace battery on trips and micro SD card. Every time I try to take of the cover I need to use some sort of tool and it is so hard that I am afraid to break the phone. I have received another case by Spigen – Neo Hybrid and it is much easier to use and better quality so I will keep it.I am returning this product.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This Spigen case is what protects my Note 3 100% of the time these days, and lo and behold I have had some horrendous drops and crashes happen of late, and thought my phone was smithereened at least twice (down a slight of stairs, and a 2nd attempt at destruction right there in my foyer's heavy tile flooring..OUCH!) but this case somehow protected the phone through some horrible drops/abuse by yours truly. Just being in a rush at times itself causes mishaps to happen, and I'm a testament to that phrase...always put your phone IN ITS CASE before going out, if you've had it out for some reason or other...take the time to protect it and this Armor Case (slim) by Spigen is just the cat's meow for strong, protective cases for the Note 3 by Samsung. I bought an Otterbox Defender and it still sits in its packaging, I've found no reason to take it out and use it yet...maybe never will if this Spigen case continues to perform as it has of late! FIVE STARS ALL THE WAY!!!Wavey Davey - 1-13-2014
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Very good product. I would recommend to anyone to use. I am loving this very much. total protection of my phone.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: Amazing case, very sturdy material and looks quite impressive.only gripe is it adds much bulk to the phone but a good trade off for people who want their phone to look good while giving it the maximum possible protection.
title: Galaxy Note 3 Case, Spigen Slim Armor Case for Galaxy Note 3 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10457)

reviewText: This case is wonderful, the quality is top notch and has a great material feel. The buttons have a very reassuring click and are actually my favorite part of the case. My only knock on this case is the fact that it's likely meant for the gold iPhone 5s owners but the case is black and gold not white and gold like the actual phone. Seems weird that there isn't a white and gold option to match better.Otherwise, great case with minimal added girth but with a good amount of protection.Update: Another minor issue is that the gold back does scratch fairly easily. Better the case than the phone but just something to note.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Fits well and protects the 5s.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: [3/21/14]I've always been a SGP, now called Spigen, fan and customer ever since the iPhone 4.That being said, I've used many different screen protectors and cases from them for both iPhone and Android devices, and the Slim Armor S is no exception in build quality, functionality, and design.It looks crisp and it gets compliments from most everyone else who either use those huge LifeProofs or similarly large Extra Battery Cases. This case keeps the bulk to a minimum while providing ample protection with the TPU case / Polycarbonate backing.The cutouts are precise and cleanly cut and it just feels great in the hand.Minor complaints:- The headphone cutout is big enough for most aux plug-ins, but the AmazonBasics Coiled Stereo Audio Cable for car use is too large and won't fit through the cutout.- The TPU parts of the case (top and bottom) are grippy enough, but the plastic shell is a bit slippery when handling with clean dry hands. It hasn't slipped out of my hands though... yet.Otherwise, I am in love with this case and couldn't have asked for anything more compact and attractive as this.I'm planning on getting a variety of different colored shells so I can swap them out and keep it looking fresh.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Since November I believe I have been using the Spigen Neo Hybrid champagne colorway for my black 5S. That case was perfect. It was a slim case that survived some hard falls. One time it fell face down hard because I tried to catch it but ending up slapping it down, it survived.But back to the slim armor S. The case fits perfectly, buttons are aligned, the cut out for the vibrate switch is easily accessed and the ports are big enough for some third party accessories. The camera flash works well with the photos and doesn't wash out the pictures due to the black lining around the camera hole. My 5S also has the spigen glass.tR slim. With this glass screen shield both the slim armor S and neo hybrid had a flush front. Sadly no lay on the table design but oh well.My only complaint is that this case is pretty slippery if you're not too careful. Also I noticed other spigen products such as the tough armor for the Samsung S5 have a small black platform on the corners to prevent the plate from touching the table. I would like to see that implemented on the 5S models.Overall I love this product.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Sharp aesthetics, thin, looks just as great as iPhone 5S itself.  Fits in my Proclips car iPhone holder great.  I did have to quit using one of my headphones that had a type of connector that this case interefered with.  But since I have several different types of headphones to use, had no trouble finding one of my other types that works just fine.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Love the look. Fit is better than most but not amazing. Colored panel scratches way too easy. The case blocks the speakers and softens their output a little bit. I'm not sure I would buy again.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: This cover very thin looks great good price  I tell other to buy this cover good have that u will live it
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Thought briefly about using my new 5s without a case because I like the look of the space gray. The day I ordered my phone I got out of my truck and dropped my ip4 on the gavel driveway(had it on the seat between my legs and forgot).Had it in a Spigen Neo Hybrid, the phone and case survived without a scratch. So as soon as i ordered my phone ordered this case. Great looking case and doesn't ad much bulk to the phone. The gunmetal keeps it looking like an Iphone. Fit and finish is great. As soon as I took my new phone out of the box it went directly in the case. I did the exact same thing with the 5s, dropped it on the gravel driveway. Between the Slim Armor s and the Tech Armor screen shield, both the phone and case were unharmed. Would definitely purchase again.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I really do like the design of this case, especially since I chose not to upgrade from the 5 to the 5S. Seems protective enough to survive a short fall.The only thing that bothers me is the durability of the case shell, as it has already started to show deep scratches from day to day use. I'm not sure if this was intentional by Spigen to sell replacement shells or if it was done to keep the product cost low, but this is the only issue that I wish was corrected.Overall, solid case for the price but be aware it will show wear and tear over time.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I have owned several iPhones over the years and this case is the best I have come across. It is the best blend of protection and sleekness that I could find. Even though the Spigen Slim Armor doesn't take up much more space that a typical slip cover, the sides come up far enough around the front that the phone's edges are completely protected. I also have not yet experienced any wear to the thin piece below the iphone button and above the charging area, which is a common problem in a lot these armor cases on the market.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Great case, well made and strikes good balance between protection and bulk. Looks like original phone design. title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I really like this case, but the reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it is a little slippery.  I have an iPhone 5s and even with this case it is very light and I worry that it could slip out of my hand if I'm not being careful.  That being said, it looks really good and feels like a quality product.  I love how it covers the buttons and makes them very easy to access.  It does take two hands to get to the mute, but that doesn't bother me. It also does have a little lip that comes up over the glass so it has a little protection on the front.  Overall I would recommend this case however I think I would go with a 100% TPU product next time just for the extra grip.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Perfect case. Much improved from the original slim armor, which was also a good case. The slim armor s has easier access to the sleep/wake switch and a much more responsive lock button. Fits phone perfectly, slim design, and protects it from every day use. Would strongly recommend.

reviewText: This case fits my phone very nicely and the volume buttons are very responsive. My only complaint about it, is that it does wear on the back rather fast from like sliding around on tables and stuff, other than that it is a solid case.

reviewText: EDIT: This case was good for a little while. Now, as some time as passed, meaning about 2 months... this case has really deteriorated on the back. I am not rough with the phone, it goes from my pocket to desk and nowhere else and the back plate is just scratched to the heavens and is fading from my hands holding it. Wouldn't recommend anymore.Fits extremely snug and is just aesthetically appealing. Highly recommend and would buy again, if and when it breaks! Great case by Spigen.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: For me, cases serve 2 key purposes: (1) protect the phone, (2) make it less likely that I will drop the phone.  While I am reasonably certain this case would have served purpose #1, it would have failed miserably on purpose #2.  In fact, I can say with certainty that my phone was MUCH MORE SLIPPERY with the case on it than it was before I put the case on it.  Even if the case protects the phone when it hits the ground, anybody who has dropped a nice case will tell you that the case is pretty much shot once it hits the ground.  Unless you want to walk around with a $700 phone that looks like it has been dragged behind a pickup truck, you will toss the case and start over.  I am saving myself the aggravation and returning this case immediately.  I did find a very nice Speck Candy Shell Grip CaseSpeck Products CandyShell Grip Case for iPhone 5 & 5S - Retail Packaging - White/Blackat my local club store for a price that seemed quite fair.  It isn't as pretty as the Spigen, but it will serve both of its purposes well.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: The case is slim and compliments the phone beautifully. Fit and finish is perfect. Button feedback is great. The back plastic isn't scratched yet, but I have the white version too and it scratched pretty quickly. Overall good protection with minimal bulk.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I dropped the phone a few times after putting on the case, and I'm thankful I got it. One long drop onto the ground did dent the back plate slightly, but it feels good to know I can replace just the metal backplate, should I want. (and I can change up the colors easily!)

reviewText: This is one of the better of the dozens of cases I've had. title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I replaced my Otterbox Commuter case with the Slim ArmorPros:-It is surprisingly sturdy for a slim case.  I have dropped my phone a couple times with the case, and it is clear that the rubber sleeve protected the phone well.  It obviously isnt going to protect as well as more bulky cases, but it seems to do the trick.-It looks great and seems to come in other great colors.-Very slim, after carrying this around a few days I realized that the Otterbox is massive in comparison.Cons:-The case can be slippery to grip, especially if you hands are wet or have lotion.  On a couple occasions I the phone either dropped from my hand or I had to fumble so it didn't fall.-The otherwise great looking case scratched up quite a bit in a short amount of time, which obviously takes away from my second "pro".Its OK if you dont use your phone often,  But I will probably not be repurchasing this case when I need a replacement.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I've ordered the slim armor, the Saturn, and the tough armor from Spigen.  I love all of them but this one is clearly the best.  The Saturn just looks cool without offering the front lip that the tough armor and slim armor do which really improves screen protection.  The tough armor is a little too bulky for my taste.  The Slim armor meets you in the middle with great protection and a sleek look that can't be beat.Bottom line this will protect your phone without making it look like crap.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I really loved the aesthetic appeal of the Slim Armor S -- it really looked excellent on my white iPhone 5S. However, the TPU seemed a little flimsier than it should be, and after less than a month of regular use I noticed that it bowed out from the top and bottom of the phone. The hard plastic shell kept it all in place on the sides and back, and I really liked that the shell could be changed to other colors. But ultimately I purchased a Spigen Tough Armor, which isn't that much bigger than the Slim Armor S and used more rigid materials.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: this case offer great protection without any noticeable size increase and i looks and feels great in your hand!! i drop it from 3ft on tiled floor and it protected it perfectly!

reviewText: This case has a tight-fit yet provides great protection!  I would strong recommend this case to my friends.Good Job Spigen

title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I love this case. It protected my phone just like I needed it to, the buttons are easy to press, it has a good grip to its texture, and it looks nice on my iPhone 5s.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I want to love this case. I love the more rugged TPU material of the inner core and I like the plastic bright orange backing of the exterior.  It was definitely built very well.  But I won't be using it - the TPU inner (which is exposed on top and bottom) and the plastic both share very angular edges all the way around the case.  It makes the phone uncomfortable to hold.  I don't know what case to try next, but this one isn't going to work.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I really love the case style, protection, and snug fit. I have a tempered glass protector on the front of my phone and this case still fit perfectly.The only reason this isn't 5 stars is that the rubberish material on the bottom was too thick for some of my accessories. I ended up cutting some of it off to make room. Not the most beautiful solution, but practical
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Simple, straightforward, slim, and sleek.  (couldn't think of any more "s" adjectives ;-)  One thing though, the hole for the earphone/headphones was too small for my Shure earphones so I had to cut off the bottom portion of rubber.  It still seems to be holding together fine.  Quite possible the Shure is just oversized  (I have the SE535s).  Otherwise, it was what I wanted.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I am apparently overly picky about phone cases, evidenced by the fact I can never find one I like. I thought my criteria was fairly simple: A case/bumper that provides some edge protection (will never get a lot of drop protection from one of these), fits snugly and doesn't pull-away/warp, looks of professional quality that matches the quality of the phone itself, feels good in the hand (neither slippery, tacky, nor "chalky"), doesn't interfere with phone functionality, ports, etc.,  and doesn't add too much bulk to the original phone design. Yeah, maybe that's asking too much.But finally, I tried this new Slim Armor S. It is wonderful, and fits every criteria.  It was hard to tell from descriptions and photos whether the inner shell was soft rubber (as on the Neo cases) or would be more rigid. I'm happy to say the top and bottom sections (that are exposed) are more rigid (almost like a hard plastic, but not quite) and hold their shape well - and don't collect lint. The back plate snaps on securely and feels and looks great. I purchased the gunmetal which looks nice, but I was torn between that and the slate - I'm sure either would look equally good. The slate would probably look more like the actual iPhone 5 back, but the gunmetal adds a nice bit of contrast/color.Overall I am very happy with this. I'd love to have a standard Neo Hybrid to compare, but I don't think I'd like to full rubber back, as opposed to the solid back on the Slim Armor S. I tried the Neo Hybrid EX Slim (no back) and did not like it - cutouts for ports were too small even for some of Apple's own connectors, and it just didn't provide a secure feel to me.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: The case looks nice but the edges need to be rounded out. This case hurts my hands when I grasp it. After awhile I got fed up with that sharp plastic plate and put another case on instead. It was a waste of money in my opinion.
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: Love the color, love the rubber protection, and I love the case! Spigen is one of the best brands to get for a phone case. Durable, protective, yet slim!
title: iPhone 5S Case, Spigen Slim Armor S Case for iPhone 5/5S - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10365)

reviewText: I was looking for a slim case that provided adequate protection and this one works for that. I was using a Casemate Tough Extreme case, which looks nice and offers excellent protection (like I could chuck my phone against the wall and not worry about it), but I was constantly getting liquid underneath the built in screen protector.
