title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Provides decent protection agains falls, but feels miserable in the hand. Whereas the Nexus 5 without a case feel slim and very comfy to hold, with this big boxy case I never quite feel like I have a decent grip on the phone.Funny thing, I feel like I'm going to drop the damn phone with this.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: This is a handsome case which offers good protection for the Nexus 5. I added on a tempered glass screen protector, and together these products have done an awesome job of protecting my phone. I also like the feel of the buttons. It is as if you are pressing the actual buttons on the phone, and not the ones on the case. Overall, the products exudes quality, and adds minimal bulk to the phone.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Not a bad Nexus 5 case.  Adds a tad too much width to the unit, and the version with the silver bezel makes it look too iPhonish. I kind of liked the curved back of the 5, and it is gone now. Going to try the Ionic GUARDIAN Armor LG Google Nexus 5 Case (Black) next.  This is the case I had for my Nexus 4, and it was the best of the best IMHO... Nevertheless, the SPIGEN is classy, stylish, and does the job. Buttons all work extremely well, even though I did manage to pop one out while installing the phone!  But it went right back into place. The rubber inner glove wraps around onto the front of the screen just enough to look good and "grab" the phone.  You slip the bezel on afterwards, IIRC. The front does stand out slightly from the screen, allowing you to set the phone down face first and not worry about scratches. This may be my "out on the town" case, and the Ionic my mountain biking case.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Decent seeming.  Button overlays made they REALLY EXTRA SENSITIVE, but otherwise seemed to fit/do the job, so 4 stars because of the button interaction.(Never dropped it in this case, so cannot comment on protection... just hope that it's there...)
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: The case is amazing and sleekThe case is very snug to the phone and the rubber is not cheap its a sturdy good material. The back of the case seems as though it may get scratches easily  but overall the protection is offers is superb. The "metal" like material that surrounds the phone is good quality as well and the buttons are the best on this case I have had many cases and have had the button response feel terrible, but the volume rocker and power are five stars! The headphone jack will fit your average headphone (I use bose QC 20's) and when I put the headphone in they bareley make it for a perfect fit so if you have anything the size of DJ type headphone jacks that are bigger than an iphone type style you are out of luck. The power port and speakers have ample space for any type of device you may be trying to connect to the phone as well so no worries in this department, the speakers also are not being covered all ports are aligned. Also if you are concerned about ruining a screen protector with bubbles from cases lifting the screen protector up have no worries, I use a glass Screen protector which is very thick plastic and when I put the case on I got a small bubble in the corner, i took my credit card and smoothed it out and perfect never lifted again!
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: This is a good case in terms of protection. It feels very sturdy and I believe would hold up well under accidental drops and scratches.Be prepared to take your phone out of the case, though. And often.Every micro USB cable I've tried to use to charge it will not fit in the opening. It plugs in about halfway. The same problem exists with the headphone jack. The white Apple headphones seem to fit, but the cord I use to plug the phone into my car stereo will not.I'm hoping the constant removing of the case doesn't cause substantial wear and tear on the phone.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I've been very happy with this case.  It fits very securely on the phone and the buttons work well.  It is hard to remove which I think is a feature, but if for some reason you need to do that you would want something else.  I've been using it a month and it's been great.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I really like this case.  I haven't used a case in years because I've never been a big fan.  The back has a nice feel, and the sides are very solid.  The case is perfectly designed to lift the face off any surface when flat down, and also lifts the camera glass when it's face up.  An excellent case, and I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: This is a great phone case and you just can't go wrong with this choice. It does and slight bulk as do all cases. You can live with the bulk bc it's a great looking case. The metal band is flimsy when it's not on the rubber sleeve.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I hate cases, but wanted one to fit my Nexus 5. This is what I found and it works great. Awesome build, its slim, and quite nice on the eyes.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I was looking for a slim case to put my N5 in to preserve that new-like finish as long as possible, but at the same time not add too much bulk. The early availability of this case, low profile design and quality of the marketing of course brought me to this product. This case does feel like a quality case and it came in some pretty premium packaging as well. The case fits very well and looks like it'll protect the device just dandy. There's a small rise in the rim around the glass that protects the glass from sitting directly on a flat surface and with the case on, the camera lens on the back sits recessed inside the case so that it won't rub when the phone sits on it's back (one of the reasons I seeked out a case!). I'm not thrilled about the engraving on the side or back, but that's a first world problem. Personally I would have preferred an incognito look there.The fit around the buttons is just fine and I have no trouble pressing them. The phone is a bit tough to get in and out of the case, but I'm okay with that because it just means it's less likely to fall out of it. The material of the case itself has a similar texture to that of the matte finish on the black Nexus 5 and I definitely enjoy that. I don't particularly care for the two-toned look with the plastic rim around the case. I would have preferred a black trim to match the black on black theme of the device itself, but again first world problems; plus who knows maybe when/if different colors are available, I'll be more inviting to a quick, easy and hopefully cost effective way of customizing the case.Final thoughts, no doubt this is a quality case AND it's more competitively priced than the currently unavailable OEM offering. I would have preferred a more minimalistic touch on the color scheme and not have the branding so visible, but those aren't deal breakers, the details are well implemented and not overly done nevertheless. Lastly, the case DOES add some bulk to it, but hey, it's a big device under there and there's got to be some compromise right?Oh and for the record, I have no issues using this case and wireless charging on my LG WCP-300.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Seriously one of the coolest looking & functioning cases on the market. These guys at Spigen sure know how to make a slick unit. I'd highly recommend this to anyone!
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Extremely nice case. Spigen makes a great product and this is no exception. It fits the phone perfectly and I like the matte feel of the back of the case. Offers good protection without being too bulky. It's a little tricky to install the plastic ring around the rubber case but once it snaps on it holds the phone secure and safe.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: for what I paid I don't think it can be beat.the overall flexible "shell" seems well constructed and fits the nexus 5 like a glove.outter shell snaps into place for a nice sleek look!we will see how to phone holds up to the abuse after a couple months but I have no worries if it were to be dropped.also installed a Steinheil clear screen protector prior to this case also by spigen.they seem to work well together, no issues.would recommend to someone who doesn't want added bulk (my wife) but also wants adequate protection from accidental dropsedit 5/12/14: after a couple weeks/months the wife noticed the case makes it difficult to use certain aux cables in headphone jack.  had to buy special cable to listen to music in car.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: **2nd EDIT AT THE END OF THE REVIEW changed from 4 stars to 3.(1st)Edited review:FIRST THINGS FIRST:-When installing and removing this case, DO NOT attempt to separate the plastic bumper from the TPU layer!!! I would strongly suggest Spigen to include a simple instructional guide/pictorial guide showing how to remove the case the right way. The first time around, I ended up bending the plastic bumper around the USB port when attempting to separate the case before taking my phone out. Instead, you should just work the corners of the phone, and pop it out of the case edge by edge. It isn't nearly as difficult or time consuming this way (and you wont end up potentially bending or damaging the case).THE NEXT IMPORTANT THING:-I am very happy with Spigen because they truly care about their customer's satisfaction. There aren't many companies that are willing to do what it takes to keep their customer happy. For that reason, I will ALWAYS buy my cases from Spigen.-After damaging the case, I was very frustrated at Spigen for not including a simple instructional card that showed how to properly/effectively put on and take off the case. I left a negative review and contacted Spigen letting them know that I was unhappy with the product. A couple days later, they contacted me, and today I received a replacement case with a card thanking me for my business and an apology for the inconvenience. What great customer support! I'm extremely satisfied that even a small issue such as a dented bumper is a big deal for Spigen. Thank you.And now, THE REVIEW:Pros:-Very Very slim! The case adds very little size and weight to an already light and thin device.-The TPU material feels great. It doesn't show fingerprints very easily, and has a smooth texture. The smooth texture allows the phone to slip in and out of your pockets easily.-The precise raised lip is crucial! Never ever buy a case without it! It means if you lay your phone face down on a desk or drop your phone face down, the screen will not make contact with the ground/surface. This GREATLY reduces the chance of shattering the phone's screen.-The camera lens is also slightly recessed, so it wont make contact with your desk.-This is the slimmest form factor for a case that I would purchase. Anything bulkier is too much for me, and anything slimmer will sacrifice on shock absorption. I prefer thin cases and this is the perfect size.-The volume/power buttons don't feel mushy.-The camera and speaker cutouts are perfectly sized.-Design wise, the case looks flat, sleek, and simplistic which I personally love.Cons:-Removing the phone from the case can be difficult especially if you try to separate the bumper from the TPU case first. The solution is to pop the phone out from the edges. Spigen can easily avoid this issue by including a simple diagram.-The 3.5mm audio jack cutout is pretty small. I haven't had an issue with the headphones that I haveSony MDR-ZX100 ZX Series Headphones (White)but others may have a problem.-The micro USB cutout seems like it will accommodate most cables without any issues, but anyone that has an oversized cable might have a problem. Personally, I've used 4 different cables and haven't had any problems.-The bumper is made out of plastic. It only feels cheap/flimsy when the phone isn't in the case. Once the phone is in the case, the bumper feels solid and doesn't flex.-This isn't a con but something to keep in mind: If you want to apply a screen protector, I would highly suggest applying it WITH the case on the phone. If your screen protector isn't centered, there will be a risk that the lip of the case will push against the edge of the screen protector causing bubbles.IN CONCLUSION:I would give this case a solid 5/5 if it came with a diagram showing how to put on/remove the case. Other than that, I love the case and I love the dedication and commitment Spigen has for making their customers satisfied. I would highly recommend this case, and don't regret my purchase one bit. I will definitely be buying my future cases from Spigen as well.**Please mark this review helpful if you've found the information to be useful so more people can see the review. Feel free to ask any questions! I'm usually good about answering them:)**EDIT 1/25/2014:I have knocked one star off this case, so now it is at a 3/5 rating. Unfortunately, this case does not hold up to the daily usage very well. Only after a month or two, the back of the case shows blotches of discoloration and scratches. I am very gentle with my phones so I was especially surprised to see that the case looks like I just came back from a war zone!Also, other reviewers have said that taking this case on and off frequently has caused the edges of their nexus 5 to wear out. I haven't experienced this because I have been using other cases along with this one; however, I could see why it can cause wear on the nexus 5 because it does take some pressure to put the case on and take it off...It's something to keep in mind!that's all for now!
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: With the order for my nexus 5, I also ordered 3 cases at the same time, including Neo Hybrid and now it's my favorite one. It's true that it modifies the shape and now it looks like an iPhone, but it's not bad for me. It protects what it must and feels pretty nice in my hands. The only thing I'd improve is the side buttons.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I bought this case because from the images it seemed to offer a good amount of protection over the back and edges while still looking really nice in its own right. I've put my thoughts below on different criteria for this case.Fit: It fits very securely around the nexus 5 and shows no signs of give once put on securely. It consists of two pieces - a main rubber back that covers most of the device and a 2nd more rigid (but still flexible) outer "ring" to hold the case tightly to the body of the phone itself. I think this system works well, and inspires confidence with a snug secure fit. The only thing that isn't quite so snug are the buttons on either side, with a little bit of looseness on the volume-rocker buttons of the case. Not a deal-breaker, and certainly hasn't at all impacted usability.Protection: It offers very good protection from drops and just every-day usage. I would say that if I dropped this onto a hardwood floor or just outside on the ground - so long as it landed on part of the case I'd expect the phone to be unharmed. The problem is if you drop the phone and it lands on the screen - there's pretty much minimal protection there. The case does offer protection when you place the phone screen facing down on a flat surface by raising the screen up a little. But beyond that you have no real protection. Conveniently, spigen sells glass screen protectors for exactly that reason which should work very nicely. I plan to buy one soon actually.Finish: I just think this is a very classy looking case - and certainly far better looking than the rubber nexus one that google is trying to sell directly through their store as the official case. It just feels like a quality product, and certainly worth the $20 asking price that I bought this at. The one downside is that the backside of the case and just along the edges - its a bit slippery. The Nexus 5 phone comes with a nice soft-touch rubbery finish that feels easy to grip. You definitely don't get any of that with this case. So while the case itself looks and feels nice on its own, it does make the phone a bit harder to get a firm secure grip on for me at least.Verdict: I think this is still the case to beat right now for the Nexus 5. If you too are worried/had a bad experience with dropping your phone or just want something that looks nice and will keep your phone feeling new - the spigen neo hybrid case is one I'd highly recommend. It does have some short-comings, but overall it's still a great case and out of the ones I've seen being sold on amazon is the best one to go with. You have to decide how much protection you want and what size you're willing to go with, but I think the spigen is a great balance of protection and good looks.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I just received this case today as well as my new Nexus 5.  The case fits very nicely on the phone.  I cannot speak to it messing up the screen protector as I do not have one installed. Would buy again!

reviewText: I have two Spigen cases for my Nexus 5 - the Slim Armor and Neo-Hybrid.  While both are great cases, I prefer the Neo-Hybrid. Great tactile feel, almost like the buttons on the phone itself.  A+ for Spigen.

reviewText: The case does seem to offer good protection, and I like the cooling air channels on the back.  However, the cutouts for both the earphone and the usb port are much too small.  Out of 8 sets of headphones/ear buds I had around, only two would fit through the tiny hole for the jack.  Both that would fit were ultra-cheap, so I can't use good headphones and the case at the  same time.The USB cutout is also too small, or perhaps too tall.  It fits a lot of standard USB cables, but not all.  "Amazon Basic" cables do not fit.  Unfortunately, most of my cables are amazon basic.  I also have found that a lot of power accessories like Anker Power Banks do not work with the case.Given the Nexus 5's generally poor battery life, I depend on using by bakup chargers.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Just received both the Ultra Hybrid and this Neo Hybrid (Gold) today, and I had a rude shock. The Ultra Hybrid has a slight dint in the bottom left corner of the case, which looked like something a made-in-china TPU case would have.As for the Neo Hybrid, the case looked so promising on Amazon's website, but yet was utterly disappointing in real life. Firstly, the polycarbonate rim had multiple slight scratches right out of the box, which looked like it had either been used, or very poor QC was done. Secondly, the buttons are misaligned and so loose they actually popped out when i took off the case to try out the Ultra Hybrid. I have the original LG bumper case for my Nexus 4 and boy, the buttons are miles ahead in terms of rigidity and feel. Thirdly, which is the most shocking part, the process of removing the Neo Hybrid actually opened up the back plate of my Nexus 5! Thankfully, I managed to push the back plate back into the phone.At $19.99, not only does this case comes without a screen protector, unlike the $9.99 Ultra Hybrid, it also feels worse than the cheaper case. Spigen always had a good reputation for churning out quality products, but sadly, they are shooting themselves in the foot by releasing this kind of shoddy work. Search "nexus 5 slim armor" on amazon and you'll know what I mean.Avoid if you can, at least until Spigen rectifies all the problems.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: This is a very good case...it's also very large.  It adds too much bulk to the svelte design of the Nexus 5.  I am planning to return it in exchange for the Slim Ultra Fit which is much more minimal but still provides protection for the camera.

reviewText: Got this for Xmas. I have to say I like it a lot more than the Rinke Slim for the Nexus 5. That case was an absolute fingerprint MAGNET. This thing definitely gives better protection too.I'm not sure about the headphone jack- but I haven't had any problems like some reviewers have suggested. I have two pairs of headphones (one large pair of Sony, and one Earbud pair also by Sony) and they both fit fine with no issues. Not sure just my $0.02.All-in-all I think it's a nice case. The only con I can really find is that it does take away some of the nice aesthetic feel of the curved nature of the Nexus 5 and dust collects in the outside of the screen inbetween the case and screen. It's rather easy to clean but still kind of annoying nonetheless.I would say if you want a nice rather cheap case that will be comfortable, lightweight, and protecet well then go for it. Otherwise just leave the nexus 5 bare, and use a screen protector because nothing else out there is worth it at this point that I can see.

title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I bought this case along with theSlim ArmorandGLAS.t NANO SLIM Tempered Glass Screen Protector. The glas.t fits very nicely with both cases, my friends don't even notice it's on. You do have to take care when installing it to have it fit right. If it's off by even a tiny bit the lip of the cases will start to peel up the edge of the protector. Also, there is just enough of a gap between the case and the protector that lint and dust can build up in an unattractive ring all the way around the screen. Qi charging works with both cases just as well as with the phone naked.I broke my Nexus 4 recently (dropped it without a case on) and was very disappointed by the aesthetics of the Nexus 5, possibly the ugliest product Google or LG have ever made. Enter Spigen. Both of the cases are very stylish and give the phone a much better feeling (not to mention, let it lay flat on a table ...geez LG, what were you thinking!) I prefer the subtle accent color and chrome buttons of the Neo Hybrid case, and don't feel like I'm giving up very much in protection. I'm used to an OtterBox commuter case, and both the Neo Hybrid and the Slim Armor feel more cosmetic than protective. Maybe smartphone case engineering has just advanced enough that we don't need very much bulk around a phone to protect it... I hope I don't find out.I have had no issues with button presses on either case, it seems Spigen has corrected whatever defect was reported in their first run of Nexus 5 cases. I read some complaints in other reviews about the cut-outs for the USB port and headphone jack being too small, I have not found this to be an issue at all for either case.I have alternated between both cases as my daily driver, and am pleased with the look and feel of both.However, I have a very low degree of confidence that either case would protect my phone against anything more than surface scratches. At the same time, I am reticent to take away stars because it *might* not work, so I have removed 1 star for my apprehension.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: What makes this case great is its seamless design. Quite often, people have commented on how my phone looks a little bulky, but they like the silver bezel. reviewText: Let me start off by saying that this case is probably the best looking case i have seen on the nexus 5, i got the champagne gold one, and it looks really nice, it is a really nice and snug fit and i can feel the protection that it gives to the phone.i only have 2 concerns with the case, the first one is that the buttons could have less play in them, usually when i hit the power button it does not click or gets stuck and almost turns off the phonethe other concern is that the headphone jack is way way too small, i have tried fitting in 4 of my headphones in the jack but all of them are too big, even my cars audio cable is too big to fit, which is frustrating.Now i really really wanted to keep using the case because it just looks so good, but i need to listen to music every day because i drive a lot, and it gets super boring in the car, so until Spigen fixes the problem with the headphone cut out then i wont be using the casesorry SpigenUPDATE:I found a possible fix for the headphone jack, just get a small 3.5 to 3.5 adapter and you are good to go!B0013RTHEOthere is a link to one, i use it now and it doesn't effect the quality of the audio and its fairly cheap, still only going to 4 stars because the buttons still have a lot of play in them

reviewText: I wanted a case that didnt add too much bulk and that felt great in my hand, and I found it. I love this case and have always liked Spigen cases for all my old phones.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I got this case a couple days before my Nexus 5 arrived. At first, I thought it would be a nice case. But ultimately I didn't like it on my Nexus 5 and just sent it back.The feel of the case is very smooth. A little too smooth if you ask me. The feel of the Nexus 5 is smooth yet grippy. It just feels really nice. This case ruins it.The case adds too much bulk as well. I have fairly large hands (can easily palm a basketball). The phone is already pushing it in terms of easy one handed use. It is nearly impossible to the bottom right corner and the top left corner without strain and without adjusting your grip. This case just makes it worse.Also, the back of the Nexus 5 is slightly curved. The back of this case and the inside is completely flat.The one good thing I can say about this case is the buttons on the sides. I love that these actually include buttons instead of just cutouts. But ultimately this is not worth $20.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: When I received the case, it was a used one. It seems that someone bough the case, used it, return it and Spigen re-sell it as new. The indication that the case is used:1). Secure tapes covering the box of the case has been cut - someone has opened the box2). The top left of the back case has scratches and there are "oily" marks on the back of the rubber case - someone has used the caseWhen you buy this case, check for these thing!
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I really like this cover, but it does have its issues.1. The side thing looks metallic but it's just plastic.I knew this when buying it but once you start using it you realize just how much cooler it would be if it was metal.  It doesn't matter much though, it still looks good and it works good.2. I don't think they sell just the side bumper thing, that'd be so cool if they did. (ok technically that's not something bad about the product)3. The headphones and MicroUSB openings are not very good.Putting headphones is an issue if the jack isn't extra skinny, same issue with the MicroUSB plug.  Whenever I want to use those ports with certain devices I have to take it off the cover which I hate doing because it's not that simple.4. Unless you put your screen protector on perfectly, there is a good chance this will push the sides off and you'll end up with a screen protector that you need to change because now it's full of lint from your pockets.With all that said, I will tell you that I really do like this case, it looks nice, buttons work great, it makes my Nexus 5 feel more premium.  I still say they should make some metal bumpers in different colors and sell them.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: I installed it on my phone after having the feeling that i'll have a broken edge . It wasn't easy to install .. however , once installed .. it looks nice. It does add a considerable bulk to the phone and the volume and power rockers have a cheap feel to them . I expected more for a $20 case .
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Besides the fact people keep thinking I have an iPhone now (I have the silver ringed case), this case seems to work pretty well.  The phone snaps right in (do not separate the pieces to install).  It is also just as easy to remove.  I haven't dropped it yet, but based on my history that is coming soon.I purchased a Made-In-China Lerway Wireless Qi Power Charger Pad to try out as well.  The phone charges just fine through this case while on the charging pad.  I'm sure the official Google charger will work fine if this sub-$20 device works.  I may buy anther one for my desk at work.I did discover that the AmazonBasics Micro USB cable will not plug into this phone with the case installed.  The Micro USB end is too 'fat' to fit through the opening.  I didn't take off a star for that since it appears most other cables should fit and this is likely more Amazon's problem.  The end on the AmazonBasics cable is quite large.  I may try to trim it, since that is my current charger at work.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Good protection but a bit too bulkyI would prefer bumper that doesn't cover the backand that is lighter in weight
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: This case looks & feels good on my Nexus 5, and isn't too bulky.  In fact, most people who aren't familiar with the phone don't even realize it has a case on it.  I don't have any issues with the buttons, speaker, or USB port.My only complaints after a few weeks of use:(1) Not all headphone jacks will fit.  I have one that fits and one that doesn't fit.(2) On the side of the case, on the silver liner, it says 'NEO HYBRID' in big letters.  Doesn't hurt any functionality of the case, but it looks pretty lame.(3) As with any case like this, with a small lip around the front, dust has a tendancy to build up on the screen and can be difficult to get it off.
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: Yes I know it's not marketed as a low profile case, but the picture do try to make it appear that way. I purchased this and a Ringke Slim and I'm sorry to say, this Sipigen Neo Hybrid is not my case for daily use. It is simply too bulky for my liking, but I still have the case if I need something for extra protection. If the front screen lip and back plate where half the thickness it would be perfect. At this point the looks are the only thing it has going for it... in my opinion.

reviewText: You will love it the moment you see your phone wearing this beautiful protector, it does the job, it looks simple and slick, but dont get fooled by it simplicity is quite resistant. Also, a pair for you to match this protector is the Screen protector from Spigen.

reviewText: The material is the same AMAZING quality you'd expect from Spigen, and the buttons are very tactile, and responsive. I wish there were more colors available (like the 5s case, or S4) but the Silver on Black gives it a professional look.The back TPU isn't as "soft-touch" as the back of the naked Nexus, but it isn't a fingerprint/grease magnet either. The cutouts on the bottom are big enough to let the speakers sing, and every Micro-USB cable I've tried has fit with no issue (MonoPrice, LG, HTC, Blackberry...)The headphone port is a bit small if you're using professional studio headphones, but work fine with Koss Portapro, and the Apple EarPods.The buttons are a glossy chrome material and are easy to find when on a call, but not easily miss-pressed.Overall this is my go-to case for my Nexus 5
title: Nexus 5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Series for Nexus 5 - Retail Packaging - Metal Slate (SGP10562)

reviewText: This case fits better than a glove! If fits like the skin of your own hand! The TPU inside is high quality and very tight fitting but what really makes it is the plastic or polycarbonate outer shell. This 2nd piece wraps tightly around the TPU and basically clips into a small groove on the TPU at the sides so that it is hooked in on both sides of the phone.Some cases you can easily pull on and off. So much so that they feel cheap! This one fits so well that it will actually take you a minute to take it out of the case, which I think is how a custom case should fit! I've been telling all my friends about it and highly recommend it!
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This is my go-to case for my new Samsung S5.  It's a slim fit but don't let that fool you.  This case is very robust and protects all angles of your S5.  It's a precision fit, leaving no gaps or uneven lines when installed, too.  I like the small rubber corner "feet" tabs so when you lay the phone camera-down on the table, it has rubber bumpers to keep from scratching up the case prematurely.  The lip around the front of the case very sufficiently protects the face of your phone when set down on flat surfaces.I love this case, and ended up buying the gunmetal (sort of a coppery silver color) and also the black one.  Highly recommended for a strong case that still slips in your pocket and even fits in a sport coat inner pocket without being seen.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Amazing, protective, and light weight couldnt have asked for a better case for my phone.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Easy to use not complicated to put on and well I have not dropped it from a high place worth the price.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I like the look of this case and it feels very sturdy. Issue I ran into was once I installed the Samsung wireless charging back that makes the phone slightly thicker, the case would no longer fit well. Contacted manufacturer and their only response was that it's was made to fit the phone. Didn't even acknowledge existence of the wireless charging back.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: When my husband bought his S5 he wanted to get a case that would protect the phone without all the bulkiness that the Otterbox and Body Glove add.  He found this case and decided he had to have it.  It is a good case with a nice lip on the front to protect it.  The only fault I see is that, as others pointed out, the case is a bit slippery.  For the price you can't beat it.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This is a very good case...and I might go as far as to say great.  I have a number of cases for my s5 and this is my favorite.  I think the price is good for what you are getting.First, the bad.  I think the case is a little slippery.  Not so much that I have dropped the phone, but it has slipped a little before I caught it.  I don't think it is a deal breaker, I would definitely buy this case again....but it could cause problems if I had really dry hands.  Also, I'm not completely sure of the drop protection. I have read about the air corners and how they disperse impact. I have yet to drop the phone, so I cannot comment on that.  I will say that it feels really good and sturdy in the hand..and that is how i will transition to the Positives of the caseThe Good.  It does feel good in the hand, very solid and well made.  I am not concerned at all about dropping it...I think it  will survive just fine.  All the cutouts are fine, and the buttons on the sides are easy to press.  It takes a little getting used to the fact that they are not raised up at all from the sides.  I was a little concerned about that when I bought the case, but now I really like the feel.  The headphone cut out is quite big and fits all the miniplugs and headphones I have thrown at it.  The lip around the screen is fine, and raised up enough to protect the screen.  All in all, I really like the case...it feels great in the hand and I love the gunmetal color and feel.  To me, it almost looks and feels like real metal.  I came from the otterbox commuter case and I like this so much better.  Why?  I like the look, much more stylish.  I like the feel, feels more solid and well made.  I like the price, quite a bit cheaper then otterbox.  I like that I don't have to open a flap to put my headphones in.  I just like it better. Having said all that, I think the otterbox is a good case and has its place. That being said, my new s5 will stay in the Spigen Tough Armor until I find something better....I'm always on the lookout for a new better case.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This case feels rugged and tough. Nothing about this case feels cheap. It is one piece, fits my Galaxy S5 like a tight glove and makes the phone look amazing. I like it much better than all of the other cases including otter boxes. I dropped the Galaxy S5 off of a  2 story roof today and it didn't break nor did the screen crack and that was BEFORE I put this case on.With the toughness of the S5, matched with this case. Your phone is safe. The edges of the case are a tough rubber and not plastic. Very absorbent to shocks.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: of protection!  Corner protections seems quality.  Raised for the front glass, and recessed enough for the back cameras and sensors.  THe best thing though is the big buttons!!!Good:  Edge protectionscreen protectioncamera protectionmakes side buttons much easier to use!the bad:Make the edge rough,  I have a hard time holding onto the phone due to the smooth plastic side overcase.Overall this has slightly less protection in my mind than the otterbox defender, but is better than the commuter. and is about the same size as the otterbox commuter.

reviewText: I have no complaints whatsoever about this case.  It fits my phone perfectly and I have had no issues with the fingerprint scanner or heart rate monitor. The case is not bulky by any means I am confident that it will help protect my phone.  Probably the only downside to the case is that accessing the charging port can be a bit difficult but, if you have a pinky finger with a bit of nail grown out, opening the charging port is no problem.  I'd recommend to both family and friends.

reviewText: I was a bit worried that this case would be difficult to put on, as the Otterbox often felt like a chore to take on and off with previous phones. reviewText: It is the perfect size
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This is my second Spigen case I have had now, and I am pretty confident that I will keep buying them in the future. I used to swear by and only use otterbox cases, but I hated how bulky they were. They always had great protection but I were extremely difficult to slide in and out of pants pockets. The Spigen Heavy Duty and Slim Armor cases still provide the protection that I need and are designed in such a way that they don't add much bulk to the phone. You still need to add a screen protector but I actually like that as it doesn't allow dirt and dust to get under the screen like some cases. This case is a great improvement over the slim armor case I had for my GS4. They have redesigned the buttons so they are easier to use and the plastic part of the case no longer has a thin piece that goes over the button that can break off. Also the rubber isn't so soft that it sticks to stuff, but it still allows for it to have the shock protection needed to keep the phone safe. The only real downside to this case is the cutout for the heart rate scanner is a little steep and doesn't read effectively. This was addressed from the company and the fix is to not press too hard. I was skeptical if it actually worked, but it actually did work that way. Overall it's not a huge issue because it's not something I use all that much.Pros:PriceSizeLooksNo Built-in screen protectorCons:No built-in screen protector ( not really a con)Cutout for heart rate scanner is hard to use.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Very nice feeling case. Buttons all work properly and are lined up exact. Case slides in / out of pants pockets with ease. The fingerprint scanner can be a bit tricky with this case, but it is usable.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: A great case at a great price. Protects my phone without adding bulk. Doesn't slip or slid off my hand or other surfaces. All the cut outs are big enough to allow access. reviewText: Very easy to install, and fits the Samsung Galaxy S4 very well.I originally had used an Otterbox Defender series case. It worked well, but added a lot of bulk to the phone. Also, the screen cover built into the Otterbox makes it impossible to see when out in the sun light.I decided to try the Tough Armor case by Spigen, as a slimmer alternative. The phone popped right into the case, no issues at all. I added a protective screen film to the phone to help protect the screen. This case adds protection around the edges, as well as wrapping around the front enough that it protects the phone slightly from a fall face down.Overall, I really like the case. I have owned it for approximately 3 months now, and besides the logo on the back rubbing off, the case and phone are perfect still.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Works really well, had to take the case apart to confirm the back is plastic and not aluminum. Fits well, little slippery as other have noted but fits and looks very good.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: After buying and receiving this case from Amazon, I was simply amazed at how thin the Tough Armor case was. I also own the Spigen Neo Hybrid for the S5, but I simply like the Tough Armor better after trying it out. Allow me to point out the pros and cons of the Tough Armor, compared to the Neo Hybrid.Pros:- Thicker rubber top and bottom gives you greater shock protection and absorption than the Neo Hybrid.- Slightly bigger cutout for the USB charging port, giving you more room to open the port.- Form-fitting, recessed Power and Volume buttons ensure you do not accidentally turn off/on or change volume.- The four back corner guards allow you to lay your S5 flat on a surface without scratching up the back of the case.- Greater lip for your back camera and heart-rate sensor.- The thicker rubber of the case gives your phone even more lip (with and without a tempered glass screen protector) than the Neo Hybrid.Cons:- The rubber part just below the home button is thinner than its counterpart on the Neo Hybrid. The Neo Hybrid's rubber is backed by the polycarbonate frame which provides better resistance and protection for that part of the case.- The case back of the Tough Armor may be easily scratched over time with constant contact (though I will try my best not to ruin it). The rubber back of the Neo Hybrid does not have this issue.Overall, I highly recommend the Tough Armor and the Neo Hybrid cases for your Galaxy S5. Your phone is an investment worth anywhere from $200 to $700 dollars, so it is important you have the best protection possible. Spigen's glass screen protectors and the Tough Armor case is essential to protect your S5.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This is simply an awesome case, it looks very sharp, has a very thin profile thus allowing it to slide in & out of your pocket easily & protects the phone very well.  I also put a ballistic glass screen protector on it & my phone has never felt safer.  In the times my phone has fallen, nothing has happened to it.  This case does exactly what it claims, it protects the device very well.  Highly recommend.

title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Edit: 4/10/14 I have reached out to Spigen with all my concerns as stated below in my first edit of the review. They have responded back both by phone and email to all of my concerns.First: the heart rate sensor may be flawed or defective on my phone. I have found that you need to put your finger down and lift up briefly till it starts measuring and than apply your finger back. Also you don't need to apply any real pressure to get a reading doing so will cause it not to get a reading with or without the case.Second: they believe I may have a defective TPU portion in regards to the charging cover. While I don't believe this to be the case I did figure out the charging cover can be opened on the long end with this case.Third: The infrared port is designed to be covered as best as possible for protection which is what the case is providing. Yes you do lose a little bit of flexibility in pointing it with the case but you are getting the added protection.Fourth: Yes it hurts my hands to hold it could it be the way I hold it, absolutely! Should it be taken out on the review of the case, not at all. It's just not my cup of tea but than again I don't like the competing versions of these cases.Lastly I can't fault the case at all on my "suspicions" of it causing problems with the microphones, that's just silly.In conclusion this is a fine case made to be durable and protect your phone from being broken. It does all that while looking good to boot. Did Spigen pay me off to fix my review, no. They reached out to me to address my concerns and make sure I was a happy customer. That is something you don't see very often in a company. Did I realize I was being silly in some regards, yes. Like any good reviewer you need to take the case as it is and not for how you may or may not like it. It's not the cases fault I don't like it why should I rate it differently? In the end do I feel like this case does what it's supposed to, yes, thus why it deserves 5 stars.FinEdit: 4/9/14 I finally received the phone today and have changed my rating of this case from a 5 to 2. I should have waited to receive the phone before I submitted my initial review. Yes the case is premium quality and very nice looking however with actual usage it has some problems.First: problem as others have said the heart rate scanner is impossible to use which is due to the thickness and size of the cut out.Second: problem I am surprised no one has mentioned I can't get a fingernail in to open the cover for the charger. I've had to use a knife to get it open with the case on.Third: the infrared on the top needs to be pointed almost dead on to the device you are controlling. With the case off I can point the phone at the ceiling and it will work.Fourth: it almost hurts to hold for any great length of time. This is due to the edges of the case being squared off instead of rounded which would have given a much better feel to it I think. Also the flatness is made worse by it having rough edges to it.Lastly this is not something I have been able to prove but I believe their may be an issue with the microphones being so deeply set in with the case. I will be reaching out to Spigen on my issues tomorrow and I will update this accordingly.Original Review:Not much to say other than that. Retail packaging is even high quality! I was very impressed with this case as a whole. Spigen is definitely on my list of recommended retailers.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: After having many cell phones and cell phone cases, I decided to skip the bulky and thick protective cases so a more sharper looking protective case. The case fits the Galaxy S5 perfect. title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This case case very well thought out. It has a stylish design that compliments the S5 very well.The bezel on the front is high enough to provide some protection to the screen should it fall.The rubberized sides make it easy to grip and help to make sure your phone doesn't fall out of your pocket.The back of the case does a nice job blending the camera into the phone. Another nice feature is that the back has just enough clearance when you set the phone down to let the rear speaker play without getting muffled.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: First things first the problem.. color. When I chose color gun metal it looked a lot more black then what I revived it's very..copperish. not bad color I just expected a darker color as shown in picture. Other then that case fits extremely well feels sturdy adds very little bulk buttons are right amount of pressure to click. And will add more to review after owning for a week or so.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Spigen does it again. I've never had a bad case from these guys. I'm so confident with this case, that I don't even try to catch my phone when it drops. Just let it go and I know the phone will be unaffected and usually the case is ok too. Minor scratches show up after dropped a few times, but I don't notice it. I'm pretty sure you can drop this phone with the case from the 2nd floor with no worries, maybe even higher.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I love this case. I just got it in and i love the way the case fits the device as well as how nice the case texture is.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I will buy in case from Spigen. In fact this one is the 3rd case that I purchased from them. I bought 1 for my Note 3 and 2 for my S5. But anyways, this case is nice and sturdy and feels great in the hand. The design is also great and stylish as well. The case has great cutouts for all the ports..even the IR Blaster and the cancellation mics.All in all its a great case for everyday use and i will surely be buying the other colors as well :)
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I really want protection for my phone, but I do not want to turn it into a brick.  This case is a nice compromise.  does not make the phone much thicker and with the hard rubber bumpers and the silicon inside the cast, will definitely help with drop protection.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Perfect fit for my S5. Bit bulky,  but as advertised Bulky. Volume and on/off buttons little large.  Recommended if you are looking for good protection without excessive bulk.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: It has only been on my phone for about an hour, but I am well satisfied with the purchase.  It will obviously provide sturdy protection. It allows for all side buttons to function. And while I dislike the charging port cover to make a concerted effort to open, this case does not impede that task...it still takes skillful fingernail dexterity to open.  I would have preferred a textured back rather than the smooth panel because it feels slippery initially; however the sides are rubber like and that provides a good grip. Now with the addition of Hero Glass screen protector, I am confident I have done my best to provide protection for the sizable investment in my Samsung S5 cellphone.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Very easy to get the phone in, very solid, looks very good. Case is very smudge resistant.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Sleek, lightweight, not bulky and good looking. The hard plastic on the back does seem to scratch quite easily, however. Does not come with screen protector.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Wow, what a great case for the S5!It seems to be very durable and I like how the back is flat, even though the phone itself has the camera sticking up and a weird raised part on the speaker.The side buttons work fine, IR blaster works  fine, and I have no trouble at all with the heart rate monitor or fingerprint scanner. The hole for the headphone jack is huge, so I shouldn't have any problem plugging it up (this was actually a problem I had with my previous OEM Samsung case on my S3). The USB port hole is not as big, but I haven't had any trouble with it.It is technically a 2 piece case, with the rubber/TPU part and the plastic cover that goes over that (would be AWESOME if this was metal, but it isn't bad the way it is), but you can still take it off/put it on without taking it apart.Overall, it's just a great case, and I'd definitely recommend buying it.05/02/2014 UPDATE: I've been talking to Spigen customer support the past few days, because basically, I managed to scratch the outer plastic frame up pretty bad (completely and totally my fault) and wanted to see if I could just buy that part. Joyce has been SUPER friendly and helpful, and although they don't sell the piece separately, she offered to let me exchange the case (again, for something that was my fault!). This has to be the best customer service I have ever experienced. I'd add another star if I could.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I bought this for my Samsung Galaxy S5. I'm super careful with my phones so I didn't really buy this for the drop protection but rather for its design. I can't stand the chrome edges on the S5 and this case does a good job of covering them up. You can still see a very small amount around the edges, but if the edges of the case came in any further, it would most likely cause issues with the screen on the phone as you wouldn't be able to swipe on the edges. The fingerprint reader and heart rate sensor DO work as mentioned, and the camera cutout is PERFECT - that's the best part of the design is how great it fits around the camera and finger sensor. Not sure why it says "AUTO FOCUS" below these cutouts. Like duh, its not 2005, all phones now have cameras that automatically focus. Anyways, great case and looks great on the S5
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Seriously great case... its not heavy or bulky. The styling and design is gorgeous. I can honestly say I love the way it looks. The buttons are perfectly ergonomic providing feedback when pushed. I've dropped my phone twice since having the case and performance is as expected. The USB port is also designed well, with a wide enough opening to accommodate after-market mini-usb+mini-hdmi cables.Bottom line: Slim case, great fit and even better finish. Oh and cannot beat that price!!!
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I have dropped my phone twice with no issues using this case.  So I am happy with it.  Would buy again.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This case is good - but, with some simple "editing" it's great! Spigen contacted me via email to let me know they updated the case and are sending me a replacement part - that's very cool as I ordered this case before the phone was released - they noticed it needed updating and are sending me the updated part at no cost!What I did to make this case more awesome and totally functional in the meantime. Take the plastic back piece off - cut out all the raised part on the rubber casing around the camera and heartbeat monitor (The raised rubber that says "auto focus" and all - just cut that whole section out - put the case back together and BAM - total functionality.The heartbeat monitor only works well if I rest my finger on it sorta flat. The case pre-edit would not allow the heartbeat sensor to work at all.Keep all your stars spigen - customer service is too important to ignore and you guys are doing it right.Edit: had to take a star anyway - the replacement spigen sent is nice - so customer service by this company is really good but, they didn't make the key adjustment needed.I still had to cut out the camera/heartbeat monitor area of the rubber part of the case. I still like the case - the new material does feel much improved but, the fact that I still had to edit the case myself for full functionality. Had to take a star.The case still looks great because after that section of the case has been cut out - the plastic outer casing hides the case "edit".
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I guess my expectations are met because I have not dropped my phone as of yet  to really be able to test out the product and I only hope I do not. But, if and when that occurs, I will surely let you know.  Otherwise, I like the product and it looks pleasing to the eye in protecting my Samsung S5.  I bought this product because of the design and the details in how this particular design is to protect my cell phone, especially the supposed shock absorbers on each side.  So, thus far, I will give it 5 stars.After experiencing dropping a cell phone (that was one day from being insured), and having to pay for a new phone without a contract since it was two soon to upgrade - I thought I better get the best thing out there or what I felt was the best.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: This is now my default phone case. It is easy on and easy off as you don't have to take the case apart to get the phone out.I have accidentally dropped my phone on a few occasions and neither the phone or the case appear to be any worse for the wear. With just a little effort you can peel back the case from the top to get the phone out to change batteries and such and just push the phone back into place when done.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: I was looking for two cases for my Galaxy S5, a thin but strong protective case for everyday use, and then a travel case with a kickstand and belt clip. The Spigen - my everyday case - is a seriously tough case that is thin, lightweight but strong. It's not just a fitting piece of rubber, it is well thought out. For example the corners are rounded and solid to absorb energy in those nasty drops on the edges. The bottom has tiny bumps - barely noticeable - that act as legs to keep it from sliding around on a table or flat surface. And the cutouts for the ports are oversized, so it's easy to open the charging port or insert the jack of your headphones. (I've had cases where I had to trim the opening to get the jack in). There is also a slight overhanging lip on top which will keep the screen elevated if you place it face down.The buttons operate perfectly, the styling of the case is rugged but cool looking and it comes in a variety of colors. I also installed their screen protector which was simple to install and very high quality. Overall I have found this brand to be very high quality and worth the price.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: The cover is so thick and solid that it sometimes causes the phone to run a little warm (especially when doing "heavy duty" work, such as transferring files). It also - being so sleek - doesn't have much grip...slipping thru my hands as often as not.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: nice case. does what it is supposed to do.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: Bought this case for a friend who is constantly dropping his phone. He loves it. Says it's the best case he's ever used. Looks sleek enough for a professional setting, but rugged enough for rugged activity.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

reviewText: The cover is fine but there is not front screen protection, it's not a bad case otherwise. It looks very cool.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Tough Armor Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Smooth Black (SGP10761)

title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: Only reason I don't give this sexy case 5 stars is because the metallized buttons stick out a bit in the pocket and can get bumped which turns the screen on.  No big deal, but I don't want to do any emergency calls from my pocket or waste battery.On the good side, this case fits so well on the phone that it almost looks like the phone is merged with it.  Very low profile for a great fit in the pants or suit coat pocket.  Great rubberized inside protection for those simple falls.  This isn't a big heavy duty case but it does add that perfect first line of defense when you want to stay lightweight and low profile.  The cut and colors are flawless on  mine, with no seams or molding tabs showing.  It looks like it was lazer cut.  It snaps on solid to the S5 and leaves easy access to the headphone jack, camera lens/heartrate sensor, and the charging port.  This is my everyday case now.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I have had this on my phone for about 6 weeks now.  It went on easily, and has stayed on.  It has some texture which helps me hold on to my phone.  It has good access for the ports.  I have not dropped my phone, so I can't address that . . .and I am not planning on "testing" it just for reference, LOL. reviewText: So far Spigen never dissappoints. Their line of cases always seem to work for me. They are beautiful and never bulky. This case is a keeper. It doesn't thicken the phone and actually enhances it by giving it a nice flat dotted back.  Imagine the flat back of an iPhone 5s and you get the idea.The fit is perfect, just make sure you apply it as one piece and not seperates (the case is built in two parts: frame and rubber case). Overall I am happy with this case and will be buying more color options to swap and play.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: Gorgeous case for the price. I haven't seen any that look as nice.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I have two different Spigen cases for my S5.  This one and a slightly bulkier 2 piece design.  Of the two, this is by far the most stylish.  The inner piece is made of the soft TPU material.  It's edges go above the face of the screen, helping protect it should you turn it over.  The back is also exposed completely and helps the phone lay flat.  Not to mention the exposed back (besides having a nice stylish print on the back) allows for a good grip, similar to that of the phone itself.  The outer hard-shell portion is more of a frame, or bumper as it were.  It only goes around the outer edge, holding the TPU cover in place and providing polished buttons for power and volume.  The amount of added bulk is minimal, but worth it regardless.  This will definitely be my primary case.  If you're looking for something stylish and functional, while being slim and not adding much bulk, I definitely recommend this one.  The hard part is picking the color for the outer piece.  I normally go black, but this silver definitely makes it pop.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: i was excited when this product arrived. But after installing it, i wasnt too trilled. Its a great case. Very fashionable, but the volume and power buttons feel very flimsy. Other than that, it seems like it would protect your phone if ever dropped. I'd buy it in the future if the buttons were a bit more stable.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: This case is great. It adds protection to the phone and is lightweight. The fingerprint scanner works fine as well as the heart rate sensor. title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: Got this case last week, it went on the phone easily (make sure to put the outer shell on from the back of the phone) The inner and outer shell fit the phone fine, not to loose and not to tight.After sliding the outer "shell" on and clicking it into place the case feels really solid, the buttons feel AWESOME, but sadly after only a few hours of use I had already dropped the phone, the outer shell is again to slick, and grabs oil like a magnet, this is my 2nd spigen case i have had issue with, I won't be buying anymore.Again another case that fails solely on the slipperiness of it.Seems the engineers here have work to do the first "case" there was not enough material on the back to protect the camera and this one slips out of your hand. PLEASE GET ENGINEERS WITH COMMON SENSE ALREADY!!!My other review of another case is herehttp://www.amazon.com/review/RWDW0LXV95SOS/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewerName: EddieP "Technology is dominated by two types ...
reviewText: Fits nice, looks sleek, the dimpled back feels good in your hands. The edges are a little stiff to hold. have no problems getting to the bottom power flap. LOVE the buttons they feel like real buttons on like a stereo or  something.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I use this when I'm out and about for "just in case". I had to replace my GSIII screen and LCD because of drop so I'm not taking any chances. I didn't want a huge thick case but I felt like thin TPU by itself wasn't enough. This is a happy medium. It looks and feels great, the price is about right, and it's quick to put on and remove. I also have a tempered glass screen protector (Sorry not by Spigen) and the combo should be more than enough and better than paying for Sprint's ridiculously price $11 total equipment protection.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I have ordered this case as well as the Spigen Slim Armor case.  I absolutely recommend Spigen cases.  The quality is top notch and fit perfectly on my S5.  Really makes the device look professional.  The only downside to this case is the metal buttons.  Both buttons are loose... however... the buttons work perfectly.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: Very well made but I fear that the protection offered is not nearly as good as some of the other cases. Very stylish also.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I use this case for my Samsung Galaxy S5 and in my view, this is the best Spigen case for the device. The UV coated frame provides tough protection around the device, while the rubber-like back of the TPU ensures you have important grip of the phone. In addition, the Neo Hybrid's case back will not be prone to scratch marks. While the Tough Armor series has extra rubber lisps on the back to guard against drops, people have complained about the slippery feel of the case. The Neo Hybrid does not have this problem. In addition, the cutout for the USB charging slot is a bit bigger on the Neo Hybrid than on other Spigen cases.Regardless of which case you use, I highly recommend pairing it with a Spigen tempered glass screen protector (use Glas.t ones if you pair your phone with a case, and Glas.tR ones if you do NOT use a case), to ensure the maximum protection for your phone.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I was really looking for a S-View case by Spiegen but came across this one in the Slate color for <$20... so I snagged it up for now. I just got it today and I'm very happy with it. It was a little tricky to put on at first but that was only made worse because I was putting it on backwards. I was hoping that the hard ring would feel a bit more stiff/solid but I have to remember that it's a phone case, not a bullet proof vest. This is a very sleek case and fits well. I had no issues opening my charging port because of the case. Fingerprint sensor works well, heart rate monitor works as well as to be expected. I only wish they offered the option to buy the outer rings separately as some days I might be feeling a slate blue and other days RED.. ya kno? Spigen, if you're listening, you could definitely rack up some more sales if you offered this case to come with 2 or 3 different ring options in the packaging. Or did something like have a few different styles of outer rings, like one with a kickstand built-in or one with a wallet attachment where a person could use the same soft (inner) shell but switch out the outer shell depending on their needs for the day.... just a thought.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: This case seemed great but unfortunately I recieved the defect product. The edge part was cracked. I should have return back and could hav3 replaced but didn't want to go thru all just ordered new one. Thus one star is because of the carelessness.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I like this case, I'm going to keep it, I'm not unhappy with it, although my review will seem to focus on the things I don't like, it's still overall just fine and you aren't going to hate yourself for choosing this.  The main issue is that I'm comparing it to the Spigen Slim Armor case that someone else has, which I like better, so of course I criticize the one I have.  First world problems I know.The main thing that makes me like it a little less than the Slim Armor is the rubber cushion on the inside of the case instead of the outside.  This means all of the exposed sides are plastic so if you are the type that drops their phone a lot you will certainly scratch it at some point.  Fortunately I hardly ever drop my phone, which is why I can't complain about it too much.  This is the main reason I like the Slim Armor Case a bit better, is because it has rubber on the outside, which gives the impression of being more protective and gives you a nice feel in the hand.  I suppose the real test will be if and when I drop my phone on a hard surface, so far it's only fallen on carpet.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: The material is very cheap, the fitness is not great.The color faded away after few days.This is not a good case
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: This is a pretty case, well made, fits the phone like a glove and I really like the look of it;  Let's face it, it is designed to make your S5 look more like a big iPhone.  Similar metal like case around the outside.Another BIG plus, is that the main on/off sleep/ wake button on the right edge of the phone, built into the case works perfectly.  Adds very little resistance to the pressing action which is great because I use that button a lot.  Molded TPU cases with that button molded into the side of the case add a LOT of resistance so you really have to push the button much harder to get it to work, with those cases on.What I'm not psyched about, is that it makes an already big phone, even bigger.  Of course any case adds to the size of the phone, but this really does.  I had this cover on for a week or two when I first got the phone, got used to it, then took it off and was amazed at how thin, light and svelte this phone is without that case.  Second, because it is in two parts, it is kind of a production to get it on and off, so if I need to change the battery or plug it in to my large car charger and need to remove the case, it adds time to the process.  The outer plastic ring has to fit into a channel in the black silicone part of the case perfectly so you have to spend extra time working it into the groove with your fingers. By comparison, I bought a Tech 21 impact mesh TPU case that, like any molded TPU case, pops on and off in a couple of seconds and offers excellent protection for the phone and adds less bulk than the Spigen case.Without a doubt though, this Spigen case looks fantastic, very classy and is perfectly made.  I use the TPU case for everyday, going to work use where I need solid, basic protection for the phone and the ability to pop the cover on and off.  On the weekend, out socializing etc where I want my phone to look great, I use the Spigen case.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: Very nice case - actually looked better than the S5 itself. I'm sure it have provided great protection but was just bulky to my liking, so I had to return it. If size is not a problem I would say give it a try - it is a great looking case.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: I have never been overly excited about a smartphone case….but this one is so beautiful & well made, I am actually thrilled to look at it & use it.I bought the red & it's a beautiful, glossy, cardinal red.  The back is black rubber with the Samsung S5 "dimple" design.  This looks really good and classy.  The silver buttons (like S5) work perfectly - no fumbling around.  All the ports are perfectly exposed & the back is raised just enough to protect the camera & the heart monitor from getting scratched.  The rubber on the back & front edges provide a little skid resistance & the front is raised enough to protect from scratches.It is also very slim - not bulky in the least so adds very little thickness.  Slides into my purse, etc. easily.The only possible downside is if you tend to have butter fingers.  The colored sides are glossy & a bit slippery.  Has not been a problem for me, but I'm guessing from examining this case that it would help your S5 survive a drop.
title: Galaxy S5 Case, Spigen Neo Hybrid Case for Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - Satin Silver (SGP10771)

reviewText: This case is easy to install and protects my phone. I will still remove it when my phone gets wet just to be sure water doesn't gather behind it. I am eager to order different colors. I wonder if I can just order the plastic bands instead of a whole new rubber case

reviewText: Had this case on my galaxy S4 and love it, so I was very pleased to find it for my S5 as well. Great protection and great feel.
